Having pioneered the single-stock ETF market in Europe, GraniteShares is now bringing its expertise and popular product range to the U.S. market.

title: NVDL Stock Fund Price and Chart — NASDAQ:NVDL

title: Micron Technology Sees Chip Recovery by the End of 2023

Analysts have revised their ratings and price targets, with some maintaining overweight or buy ratings despite the current downturn.

title: Sales of computer graphics cards slump to lowest level in two decades
summary: Sales of computer graphics cards hit a 20-year low in Q3 2022 due to a global economic slowdown and the impact of the Ethereum merge on cryptocurrency mining. Major chipmakers like AMD and Nvidia experienced significant declines in discrete desktop GPU shipments, with AMD particularly hard hit. Despite the slump, new high-end GPU launches and Intel's entry into the market (grabbing a 4% share) offer potential for future sales boosts.

(NVDA) due to their robust financials and promising market outlook.

title: Data Center Sales Drive AMD's Q4 Resurgence

The company forecasts first-quarter revenue of up to $5.6 billion and expects its data center business to continue growing, allowing it to gain market share against rivals like Intel despite an overall chip glut.

title: Beamr teams with NVIDIA to accelerate Beamr technology on NVIDIA GPUs
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. announced that its video encoding technology now supports NVIDIA GPU acceleration, achieving up to 10x faster encoding speeds compared to CPUs. This advancement enables real-time optimization for live video streams, reducing storage and bitrate while maintaining high visual quality. Beamr is collaborating with NVIDIA to develop a cloud-based Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) offering, with a beta launch planned for Q3 2023, aiming to attract new customers with competitive pricing.

summary: The first quarter of 2023 saw a significant rebound in technology and communication services stocks, with Nvidia, Meta Platforms, and Salesforce among the top performers. This resurgence was driven by factors such as better-than-expected earnings, cost-cutting measures, and growing enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, contrasting sharply with the downturn experienced in 2022. title: Qualcomm, Nvidia spar for top spot in AI chip efficiency tests
summary: Qualcomm's AI 100 chips outperformed Nvidia's H100 chips in two out of three power efficiency categories for AI inference tasks, specifically image classification and object detection. Nvidia, however, took the lead in natural language processing performance and power efficiency. This highlights the competitive landscape in the growing market for data center inference chips, where power consumption is a key cost factor.

(NASDAQ: ALGM), that are showing strong growth potential despite being smaller players in the chip industry. Both companies are experiencing increasing sales and earnings, with analysts expecting continued growth in the coming years. title: Rebellions CEO aims to outrival Qualcomm within a decade
summary: Rebellions Inc., a South Korean AI chip design startup, plans to mass-produce its ATOM AI chips early next year after its ATOM chip outperformed rivals like Qualcomm and Nvidia in MLPerf tests. The CEO, Park Sung-hyun, aims to surpass Qualcomm within a decade, seeking validation from potential clients like Google and Microsoft, with significant investment already secured from various venture capitalists and institutional investors. The company's success is seen as good news for Korea's semiconductor

title: Msci Kld 400 Social Index: Meaning, Example, FAQs
summary: The MSCI KLD 400 Social Index is a market capitalization-weighted stock index that focuses on large, mid, and small-cap U.S. companies with high environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards, excluding certain industries. Founded as the Domini 400 Social Index, it was a pioneer in socially responsible investing. The index is reviewed quarterly and tends to be dominated by large American technology companies like Microsoft, NVIDIA, Alphabet, Tesla, and Visa.

title: Super Micro stock surged more than 30% after it offered a bullish forecast based on AI demand
summary: Super Micro's stock rose over 30% after the company issued a positive forecast driven by high demand for AI-related technologies. CEO Charles Liang noted a boom in sales, particularly due to advancements like ChatGPT, leading investors to significantly increase their bids for the San Jose server maker's stock.

title: Growing chip supply helps Baxter slash backlog
summary: Baxter International significantly reduced its backlog for Front Line Care products by half in Q1, thanks to an improved supply of electromechanical components, including semiconductor chips. This improved availability has allowed the healthcare company to reduce spot purchasing, lower costs, and enhance operational predictability, though an elevated backlog still remains which the company aims to address throughout the year. Despite facing continued pressure from rising supply chain costs from suppliers, Baxter expresses cautious optimism about turning the corner on component supply.

title: YieldMax™ Launches NVDY, the YieldMax™ NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF
summary: YieldMax™ has launched NVDY, the YieldMax™ NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF, which seeks to generate monthly income through a synthetic covered call strategy on NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA). This actively managed ETF由ZEGA Financial aims to provide substantial monthly income to investors, joining other YieldMax™ ETFs like TSLY, OARK, and APLY, and adheres to a gross expense ratio of 0.99%.

title: Here's how AI is driving the rise of GPU cloud specialists
summary: The rise of AI is fueling a new class of cloud providers specializing in GPU compute, offering lower prices than generalized cloud competitors. Companies like CoreWeave, Lambda Labs, RunPod, and Arc Compute are catering to AI workloads that require substantial GPU resources. These niche providers differentiate themselves through competitive pricing, strategic locations, and ready access to scarce compute resources amidst supply chain challenges.

title: Best AI ETFs
summary: This article identifies and compares five top Artificial Intelligence (AI) focused ETFs for investors looking to capitalize on AI growth without betting on individual stocks. The author details each ETF's inception date, expense ratio, AUM, year-to-date performance, and top holdings, along with a discussion on the risks and benefits of investing in AI. The article highlights that these thematic ETFs offer global exposure to companies benefiting from advancements in robotics, automation, and AI.

title: ServiceNow and NVIDIA Announce Partnership to Build Generative AI Across Enterprise IT
summary: ServiceNow and NVIDIA have partnered to develop enterprise-grade generative AI capabilities, leveraging NVIDIA software and infrastructure to enhance workflow automation on the ServiceNow Platform. This collaboration aims to create custom large language models trained on specific data to boost productivity across IT departments, customer service, employees, and developers. NVIDIA will also use these generative AI tools to streamline its own IT operations.

title: Roundhill Launches Generative AI & Technology ETF With CHAT
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT), an actively managed ETF focusing on global companies leading in generative AI technology. The fund aims to offer precise exposure to generative AI, distinguishing itself from other AI-themed ETFs that may lack such specific focus. Top holdings include Nvidia, Microsoft, and Alphabet, with expectations for the basket to expand as more companies genuinely contribute to the generative AI space.

title: Roundhill Investments Launches Generative AI & Technology ETF (NYSE Arca: CHAT)
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched the Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (NYSE Arca: CHAT), providing investors with exposure to companies at the forefront of generative AI technology. The ETF aims to capitalize on the rapidly growing generative AI market, which Roundhill estimates to have a total addressable market of over $120 billion for enterprise software. CHAT is an actively-managed ETF with top holdings including Nvidia, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Salesforce, offering investors a way to participate in this innovative and transformative technology.

title: Supermicro Launches Industry's First NVIDIA HGX H100 8 and 4-GPU H100 Servers with Liquid Cooling -- Reduces Data Center Power Costs by Up to 40%
summary: Supermicro has launched the industry's first NVIDIA HGX H100 8 and 4-GPU servers featuring liquid cooling, designed to significantly reduce data center power costs by up to 40%. These new rack-scale solutions accelerate deployment and increase performance for AI and HPC workloads, while also lowering operating expenses and improving Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) by up to 86% in direct cooling costs. The systems offer up to 30x performance improvement over previous generations for large transformer models and boast advanced features like PCIe 5.0 and NVIDA H100 SXM5 Tensor Core GPUs.

title: Applied Materials plans $4B Silicon Valley R&D facility
summary: Applied Materials announced plans to invest up to $4 billion in a new Silicon Valley research and development facility. This "EPIC Center" will focus on advancing semiconductor manufacturing and is expected to house over $25 billion in research work within its first decade. The investment is contingent on receiving funding from the CHIPS and Science Act, aiming to accelerate the industry's ability to bring new technologies to market.

title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:FMET)
summary: This article provides an overview of the Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET), including its price, holdings, and recent news. FMET tracks a market cap-weighted index of equities related to the metaverse, launched on April 19, 2022, and is managed by Fidelity. The ETF has seen a significant increase in share price since the beginning of 2025 and lists its top institutional shareholders and key holdings.

title: NVIDIA Collaborates With Microsoft to Accelerate Enterprise-Ready Generative AI
summary: NVIDIA announced the integration of its NVIDIA AI Enterprise software with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to provide an end-to-end cloud platform for enterprise-ready generative AI. This collaboration offers Azure customers tools to build, deploy, and manage customized AI applications using over 100 NVIDIA AI frameworks, enhancing development speed and security for large language models. The integration leverages high-performance NVIDIA accelerated computing for AI model training and inference and also makes NVIDIA Omniverse Cloud available on Microsoft Azure.

title: How to Invest in Gaming
summary: The gaming industry, projected to reach US$211.2 billion in revenues by 2025, offers numerous investment opportunities, including mobile and cloud gaming which are experiencing significant growth. Investors can engage through individual stocks of hardware and software companies, or by using exchange-traded funds (ETFs) for broader industry exposure. Esports, particularly, is set for rapid expansion with a compound annual growth rate of 17.8 percent due to increasing smart device adoption and internet connectivity.

title: BlackRock’s $9 Billion Quant ETF Set to Lean in on Nvidia, Tech
summary: BlackRock’s iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (MTUM), a $9 billion fund, is expected to significantly increase its exposure to technology stocks, including Nvidia. This rebalancing will raise the fund's allocation in information technology to 21% from 3%, shifting away from sectors like health care and energy. This move is driven by the recent equity rally in large technology companies and is anticipated to make the ETF pricier and more volatile.

title: For the First Time Ever, Single-Stock ETFs Will Close Soon
summary: Seven single-stock ETFs, primarily offering leveraged or inverse exposure to individual stocks, are set to close in June, marking the first time such products will cease trading. Despite initial high expectations when they launched in July 2022, most single-stock ETFs have struggled, with minimal assets under management for those slated for closure. AXS will close five of its single-stock ETFs tied to companies like Nike, Pfizer, and PayPal, while GraniteShares is closing a Tesla-related fund, and AXS will also close two other leveraged/inverse ETFs targeting China internet and de-SPAC companies.

title: CoreWeave Secures $200 Million Series B Extension, Bringing Total Round to $421 Million
summary: CoreWeave, a specialized cloud provider, announced an additional $200 million in Series B funding from Magnetar Capital, bringing its total Series B round to $421 million. This extension comes just one month after their initial $221 million Series B funding, highlighting the accelerated demand for their specialized cloud infrastructure due to the boom in generative AI technology. CoreWeave's focus on GPU-accelerated workloads offers faster and more cost-effective solutions for compute-intensive tasks compared to larger, generalized cloud providers.

title: A.I. ETF Sold Out Of Monster Energy, Three Ways To Look At It
summary: The Artificial Intelligence driven ETF (AMOM) unexpectedly sold its entire position in Monster Beverage (MNST), despite Monster's strong performance and growth. The article explores three perspectives on this move, comparing Monster's valuation and performance against Starbucks (SBUX), PepsiCo (PEP), and Coca-Cola (KO), highlighting Monster's aggressive growth trajectory versus the more predictable cash flows and dividends of its peers. The analysis suggests Monster still has significant room for outperformance.

title: Chart of the Week: How To Benefit From AI on Advisors' Minds
summary: This article discusses how financial advisors are increasingly interested in artificial intelligence (AI) as an investment theme, surpassing interest in electric vehicles or healthcare technology. It highlights various sectors AI impacts beyond major tech companies and reviews several AI-focused ETFs, including Global X Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AIQ), ROBO Global Artificial Intelligence ETF (THNQ), and WisdomTree Artificial Intelligence and Innovation Fund (WTAI), detailing their holdings, fees, and performance. The article also mentions related ETFs partially connected to AI and robotics and promotes an upcoming webcast on AI investing.

title: High Beta ETF 'SPHB' Lifted by Heavy Tech Sector Tilt
summary: The Invesco S&P 500 High Beta ETF (SPHB) performed strongly in May, driven by its significant allocation to the information technology sector. While the broader S&P 500 saw modest gains, the S&P 500 High Beta index climbed 2.4% due to the tech sector's 9.5% rally. SPHB has also demonstrated strong long-term performance, outpacing the S&P 500 over a three-year period.

title: Microsoft Inks Deal With NVIDIA-Backed CoreWeave
summary: Microsoft has signed a deal with NVIDIA-backed cloud-computing startup CoreWeave, planning to invest billions to bolster its cloud computing infrastructure for AI operations. This partnership will provide Microsoft easier access to NVIDIA’s GPUs, which are crucial for AI-based applications like ChatGPT, and aims to give Microsoft a competitive edge against rivals like Alphabet Inc. and Amazon Web Services. CoreWeave’s access to over 45,000 GPUs and its status as an elite CSP in the NVIDIA Partner Network positions it as a key enabler for Microsoft's AI endeavors.

title: Cathie Wood Dodged Nvidia Stock Before Its Enormous Surge: Is This a Warning for Investors?
summary: The article discusses Cathie Wood's Ark Invest firm selling a significant portion of its Nvidia stock before the chipmaker's massive surge, costing shareholders over $200 million in potential gains. It questions whether this decision is a warning for investors considering Ark Invest ETFs, especially given the funds' performance compared to Nvidia. While Wood defended the sales due to Nvidia's valuation and the presence of other AI plays, the article points out inconsistencies in her valuation arguments and suggests investors may want to explore other options.

title: Applied Materials Announces $4 Billion Investment In EPIC Center For R&D Collaboration
summary: Applied Materials is investing $4 billion into its new Equipment and Process Innovation and Commercialization (EPIC) Center, a collaborative R&D project designed to accelerate semiconductor production techniques. This initiative aims to reduce the time from foundational research to mass commercialization by 30% through overlapping R&D phases and fostering direct collaboration between universities, equipment makers, and chip companies. The EPIC Center will strengthen Applied Materials' position in the industry, benefit chip makers with faster product roadmaps, and provide invaluable learning opportunities for university students.

title: Nvidia and Oracle back $270M funding round for generative AI startup Cohere
summary: Generative AI startup Cohere Inc. has secured $270 million in a Series C funding round with significant backing from Nvidia Corp., Oracle Corp., Salesforce.com Inc.'s venture capital arm, and SentinelOne Inc., led by Inovia Capital. Cohere, founded by former Google AI researcher Aidan Gomez (co-author of the Transformers paper), offers AI models via cloud APIs for tasks like text generation, summarization, and search, and is currently valued at $2.2 billion.

title: Big Tech Is Outpacing Small-Caps Amid Market Rally
summary: Big Tech is significantly outperforming small-cap stocks in the current market rally, with the Direxion Daily Technology Bull 3X ETF (TECL) up nearly 120% compared to the Direxion Daily Small Cap Bull 3X Shares (TNA) 3.7% gain year-to-date. This outperformance, particularly by companies like Microsoft, Apple, and Nvidia, is despite lingering recession concerns. The article questions the sustainability of Big Tech's rally while suggesting that small-cap funds like TNA could offer future upside.

title: A breakdown of AI ETFs as tech names burn bright
summary: This article breaks down various AI-focused ETFs available in Europe, examining their methodologies, holdings, and performance. It highlights the differences in how these ETFs define and capture the AI theme, from market-cap weighted exposure to companies involved in big data and NLP to equally-weighted exposure based on AI-related revenue or IP. The piece also compares their costs, liquidity, and correlation of returns, noting that while some are dominated by large tech names, others offer differentiated exposure to companies leveraging machine learning.

title: AMD launches new Instinct MI300X AI chip to take on Nvidia’s GPUs
summary: AMD has launched its new Instinct MI300X AI accelerator chip, designed to compete with Nvidia's GPUs in the generative AI market. The company also introduced its Infinity Architecture Platform, powered by eight MI300X chips, and its ROCm software ecosystem. Despite these announcements, AMD's stock fell due to a lack of major customer endorsements for the new chips and details on pricing.

title: AMD's AI chip challenge to Nvidia remains uphill fight with no big customers named
summary: AMD unveiled new details about its MI300X artificial intelligence chip, designed to challenge Nvidia's market dominance, but did not announce any major customers for the product. While the chip offers significant memory capacity aimed at cost reduction for AI services, the lack of customer commitments disappointed Wall Street, causing AMD's stock to fall. Analysts noted that Nvidia's strong market position is reinforced by its software ecosystem, which AMD is attempting to counter with its Rocm platform.

title: AMD is chasing down Nvidia in AI, but one analyst worries the company is ‘somewhat late’
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) is pursuing the lucrative AI data-center market, estimated to be worth $150 billion, following recent product announcements. While many analysts praised AMD's efforts, Bernstein analyst Stacy Rasgon expressed concerns that AMD is "somewhat late" to the AI race compared to rival Nvidia Corp. Rasgon noted that AMD's AI discussion offered limited "hard numbers" and a timeline that seemed delayed relative to the competition.

title: The A.I. Race Is Now Between Two Chip Giants Led by Taiwanese American CEOs
summary: The generative A.I. boom has intensified competition between semiconductor giants Nvidia and AMD, who are racing to produce advanced A.I. chips. AMD recently announced the MI300X, a direct competitor to Nvidia's H100, aiming to challenge Nvidia's dominant market share in the A.I. chip sector. Both companies are led by Taiwanese American CEOs, Jensen Huang of Nvidia and Lisa Su of AMD, who share similar backgrounds and have played pivotal roles in their companies' success in the semiconductor industry.

title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FMET)
summary: The Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET) has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" with an average price target equal to its current share price of $36.66. The rating is based on 613 analyst ratings covering 20 companies (69.5% of the portfolio) over the past year. The ETF's top holdings include major tech companies like AMD, Alphabet, Apple, and NVIDIA.

title: Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FDTX)
summary: This article provides a review and aggregate rating for the Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX). MarketBeat calculates this rating by considering the weighted sentiment of analyst ratings for the ETF's constituent stocks. FDTX currently holds a "Moderate Buy" aggregate rating with an average predicted price target reflecting its current share price, based on analyst coverage of 22 companies.

title: Fidelity Disruptive Automation ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (FBOT) $FBOT
summary: This article provides an aggregate rating and price target for the Fidelity Disruptive Automation ETF (FBOT). Based on analyst ratings for its holdings, FBOT has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" with a consensus price target of $35.26. The report details the individual ratings and price targets for the top 12 holdings within the ETF, including companies like NVIDIA, Alphabet, and Amazon.

title: Comparing the Expense Ratios of ETFs Investing in AI: Which One Is Right for You?
summary: This article compares the expense ratios and year-to-date returns of four ETFs that invest in artificial intelligence, focusing on options with lower fees. It discusses broad-based tech ETFs like FTEC, IETC, and IYW, and a new economies composite ETF, KOMP, highlighting their investment strategies and top holdings. The piece advises investors to consider expense ratios, YTD returns, investment goals, risk tolerance, and portfolio diversification when choosing an AI-focused ETF.

title: TGRW Doubling Returns of SPY
summary: The T. Rowe Price Growth Stock ETF (TGRW) has demonstrated strong performance in 2023, doubling the returns of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) year-to-date. TGRW's strategy of investing in growth firms with strong financial characteristics and a competitive expense ratio has contributed to its success, even as it approaches its three-year milestone. The ETF has also shown significant asset under management growth and strong technical indicators suggesting continued momentum.

title: Active Growth ETF TGRW Doubling Returns of SPY
summary: The T. Rowe Price Growth Stock ETF (TGRW) has demonstrated strong performance in the first half of 2023, doubling the year-to-date returns of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) with 32.1% compared to SPY's 15.8%. TGRW, which focuses on firms with strong cash flow and above-average earnings growth, is approaching its three-year anniversary and has seen substantial AUM growth. This active growth ETF is outperforming its benchmark thanks to its investment strategy and a competitive expense ratio of 52 basis points.

title: Artificial Intelligence Opens a Generational Opportunity for Chipmakers
summary: The article discusses how the expansion of AI applications, especially large language models, is creating a "generational opportunity" for chipmakers. It highlights the projected growth of AI chip spending to nearly $165 billion by the end of the decade, primarily benefiting GPU-based chip providers like Nvidia, and notes that the demand for specialized AI hardware is leading to significant investments, partnerships, and a potential "long capital investment cycle" for the semiconductor industry. The article also examines how this shift will impact traditional CPU providers and accelerate the replacement of legacy computing infrastructure with AI-first hardware.

title: Chipmaker Micron beats on demand from booming AI, easing glut
summary: Micron Technology exceeded third-quarter revenue estimates driven by high demand for its memory chips in the rapidly expanding artificial intelligence sector and an easing supply glut in traditional markets. The company's shares rose over 2% after reporting stronger-than-expected earnings and anticipating improved pricing trends. Despite ongoing U.S.-China tech tensions impacting its presence in the Chinese market, Micron expressed confidence in the memory industry's recovery.

title: Stock of the week - Advanced Micro Devices (29.06.2023)
summary: This article discusses the potential impact of new US chip export restrictions to China on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). While such restrictions negatively affected semiconductor stocks, AMD's exposure may be limited as China's share of its revenue has significantly decreased. The article also compares AMD's stock performance to Nvidia and Intel, noting Nvidia's stronger recovery from the 2022 sell-off.

title: The Best QQQ Stocks To Buy Now
summary: The article identifies nine top-performing tech and tech-adjacent stocks within the Invesco QQQ Trust ETF, highlighting their growth, innovation, and involvement in artificial intelligence. It details each company's industry, market value, and key factors contributing to its strong performance and future potential, especially in the context of AI advancements. The QQQ ETF itself is noted for its strong returns compared to the S&P 500 over various timeframes.

title: Apple’s market value ends above $3 trillion for the first time
summary: Apple Inc.'s market value surpassed $3 trillion for the first time at the close of a trading session, driven by positive inflation data and confidence in its market expansion strategies. This milestone reflects a 49 percent gain in Apple shares for 2023, amid a tech stock rebound fueled by expectations of slower interest rate hikes from the US Federal Reserve and buzz around artificial intelligence. The company's financial resilience, strong balance sheet, and a recent augmented-reality headset launch contribute to its success, making it one of only five US companies with a valuation exceeding $1 trillion.

title: Growth-Stock Funds Fly High but Fall Short in 2023′s First Half
summary: Growth-stock funds experienced a strong rebound in the first half of 2023 after significant losses in 2022, with large-growth funds doubling small-growth funds' gains. However, two-thirds of U.S.-centric active managers underperformed stylistically relevant indexes and passive rivals due to untimely sector allocations and light stakes in mega-cap stocks that drove market performance. International and emerging markets showed more modest gains, with some regions outperforming others, leading to a mixed bag for global stocks.

title: HIVE Blockchain Rebrands, Leveraging The Breakthrough Of AI
summary: HIVE Blockchain Technologies is rebranding to HIVE Digital Technologies to reflect its expansion into AI-focused HPC data centers. The company will leverage its green energy data centers and GPU Cloud computing technology for AI and machine learning applications. This strategic move aims to bridge the gap between blockchain and traditional capital markets, while the company's trading symbols and share structure remain unchanged.

title: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. – More market share gains expected
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is expected to gain further market share in the data center CPU market and capitalize on opportunities to expand its presence in the data center GPU market due to increased generative AI adoption. The company's margins are projected to grow post-acquisition of Xilinx and Pensando, driven by increasing revenue contributions from its Data Centre and Embedded segments. Phillip Securities Research initiates coverage with an Accumulate recommendation and a target price of US$125.00, anticipating marginal revenue growth in FY23e and re-acceleration in FY24e.

title: Semiconductor Stocks Are Hot -- So Is Their Long-Term Outlook
summary: Semiconductor stocks and related ETFs, like the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH), have experienced significant growth this year, driven largely by enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, particularly due to companies like Nvidia. While concerns about valuation exist, analysts believe the long-term outlook remains attractive, bolstered by a rebounding PC and smartphone market, and the massive potential of AI development across industries.

title: HIVE Rebrands, Announces Expansion Into Cloud Computing Services
summary: HIVE Digital Technologies Ltd., formerly HIVE Blockchain, has rebranded and announced its expansion into cloud computing services, utilizing its 38,000 Nvidia GPUs. The company plans to launch "HIVE Cloud" to offer rental services for GPU server clusters, aiming to tap into the high demand for AI-driven computational power. While expanding into a potentially high-margin business, HIVE will also continue its existing bitcoin mining operations.

title: NVIDIA Drives Performance Gap Between AI Funds
summary: The article analyzes the performance gap between two major AI-focused ETFs, Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (BOTZ) and Global Robotics & Automation Index ETF (ROBO). It highlights how BOTZ's significant outperformance is largely attributed to its heavy weighting in NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA), which has seen exceptional growth. The comparison provides insights for investors considering different approaches to AI sector investments, acknowledging NVIDIA's dominance while also pointing out the risks associated with such a concentrated bet.

title: Aehr Reports Record Revenue and Profit for Fiscal 2023 and Guides for Over 50% Increase in Revenue for Fiscal 2024 on Strength from Semiconductor Wafer Level Test and Burn-in Demand
summary: Aehr Test Systems announced record financial results for fiscal 2023, with net sales reaching $65.0 million and GAAP net income of $14.6 million, driven by demand for semiconductor wafer level test and burn-in products. The company also provided strong guidance for fiscal 2024, projecting revenue of at least $100 million, a 50% increase, and GAAP net income of at least $28 million, reflecting over 90% growth. This growth is attributed to increased adoption of their FOX systems and WaferPak Contactors for silicon carbide in electric vehicles, as well as new opportunities in silicon photonics and gallium nitride markets.

title: Fortinet’s stock nabs record closing high, while Microsoft, Nvidia, Broadcom bids all fall short
summary: On Friday, July 14, 2023, several AI-related stocks, including Microsoft, Nvidia, and Broadcom, aimed for record closing highs, but only Fortinet succeeded. Nvidia and Broadcom shares initially rose following positive analyst feedback on their AI chip market potential but ultimately closed down. This illustrates the fluctuating nature of the tech rally driven by artificial intelligence.

title: A breakdown of the changes to the Nasdaq-100 and what it means for mega-cap tech stocks
summary: Nasdaq announced a special rebalance of the Nasdaq-100 Index to dilute the weightings of mega-cap tech stocks that have outperformed in 2023. The seven largest stocks in the Nasdaq-100 will see their combined weighting reduced from 56% to 44%, with Nvidia and Microsoft being most affected. Historically, similar rebalances have not had a significant impact on stock prices.

title: Nasdaq Is Reducing the Influence of Giant Tech Firms in a Popular Stock Market Index
summary: Nasdaq is implementing a "special rebalance" of its Nasdaq 100 index to reduce the dominance of giant tech firms like Apple and Microsoft. This move addresses the historic rally of a few mega-cap tech stocks, which have caused overconcentration in the index and potentially increased diversification risk for investors. The rebalance, effective July 24, will prompt funds tracking the index to adjust their portfolios, potentially leading to trading costs and minor market volatility.

title: Applied Materials: Excessive AI Hype Drives Semiconductor Stock Overvaluation
summary: This article argues that the semiconductor industry, including Applied Materials (AMAT), is currently overvalued due to excessive AI hype, despite significant sales declines from major chipmakers. While AI will eventually benefit AMAT, the necessary capital investments may delay FCF boosts until the 2030s, and AI-related demand growth may be offset by falling demand in other sectors. The author believes AMAT's stock could lose over half its value as investors re-evaluate its immediate fundamentals.

title: U.S. chipmaker AMD to invest $400 million in India by 2028
summary: U.S. chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices (AMD.O) announced a significant investment of $400 million in India over the next five years, including the establishment of its largest design center in Bengaluru, creating 3,000 new engineering jobs. This move aligns with India's efforts to become a chipmaking hub, attracting other major players like Applied Materials and Micron with its incentive programs. AMD's expansion underscores the country's growing importance in the global semiconductor industry.

title: Pixar, Apple and Nvidia are teaming up to promote a 3D file format that could help boost Apple's upcoming Vision Pro
summary: Pixar, Apple, Nvidia, Adobe, and Autodesk are collaborating to promote OpenUSD, a 3D file format. This initiative aims to streamline the creation of 3D content, potentially benefiting game development based on Pixar movies and boosting Apple's upcoming Vision Pro mixed-reality headset by making 3D environments more accessible.

title: Megatrends, PCs, Servers and Moore
summary: This article from Citi Research outlines three megatrends shaping the IT Hardware and Networking space: Generative AI, 400G and 800G transition, and Digital Transformation. It also discusses the normalization of the PC market, the growth of the server and storage markets, and the significant projected growth for the semiconductor industry, driven by "More than Moore" advancements. The insights are based on reports from Citi Research analysts Atif Malik, Asiya Merchant, and Andrew Gardiner.

title: Beating the benchmark? How AI-driven ETFs stack up
summary: The article discusses the performance of AI-driven ETFs and whether they offer an information advantage in stock selection compared to traditional benchmarks. It highlights examples like the QRAFT AI-Enhanced U.S. Large Cap Momentum ETF (AMOM) and the AI Powered Equity ETF (AIEQ), noting AMOM's outperformance against a momentum benchmark while AIEQ trails the S&P 500. The piece also explores the potential benefits of AI in portfolio management, such as a lack of emotion and more frequent rebalancing.

title: Qualcomm's fiscal 3Q results fall short as slowing smartphone demand takes its toll
summary: Qualcomm's fiscal third-quarter results missed sales expectations and guidance due to softening smartphone demand, causing its stock to dip. The company, a major processor supplier for Android devices, reported adjusted earnings above Street expectations but significantly down year-over-year. CEO Cristiano Amon is banking on Qualcomm's artificial intelligence strategy to drive future growth.

title: CoreWeave Secures $2.3 Billion Debt Financing Facility led by Magnetar Capital and Blackstone to Meet Surging Demand and Ongoing Expansion of Specialized Cloud Infrastructure to Power AI
summary: CoreWeave has secured a $2.3 billion debt financing facility led by Magnetar Capital and Blackstone to fuel its expansion of specialized cloud infrastructure for AI. This funding will enable CoreWeave to purchase more compute resources, open new data centers, and grow its staff to meet the surging demand for large-scale GPU-accelerated workloads in the generative AI space. The company plans to have 14 data centers by the end of 2023 and recently unveiled the world's fastest AI supercomputer.

title: AI as an investment theme
summary: The article discusses Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a significant investment theme due to its potential to revolutionize industries and create new opportunities. It highlights the booming AI sector, strong investor interest, and the impact of AI on technology stocks and the broader market. The author also touches upon various ways to invest in AI, including specific ETFs, and emphasizes the importance of careful research despite the vast potential.

title: Opinion: Why Nvidia investors are rattled by Supermicro’s AI chip supply constraints
summary: Nvidia investors are concerned by AI chip supply constraints reported by Supermicro, a Silicon Valley computer and server maker. Supermicro's executives stated they need more AI chips from Nvidia, confirming existing supply limitations for Nvidia's popular graphics chips. This suggests that the high demand for AI applications may face hardware availability issues.

title: 3 Growth ETFs To Avoid in 2023
summary: This article identifies three growth ETFs—Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK), and AI Powered Equity ETF (AIEQ)—that investors should consider avoiding in 2023. The author, Bryan Armour, CFA, discusses concerns such as high concentration, performance chasing, high turnover, and valuation issues for these funds, despite growth stocks performing well year-to-date. The piece advises investors to focus on long-term strategies rather than chasing past performance in a market with stretched valuations and continued uncertainty.

title: SK Telecom to invest $100M in AI company Anthropic
summary: SK Telecom announced a $100 million investment in U.S. AI company Anthropic to expand its presence in the AI sector and collaborate on developing an AI platform and large language model. This partnership is expected to accelerate the development of the global Telco AI Platform, aligning with SK Telecom's broader strategy to foster an AI ecosystem with international telecommunications companies. Anthropic's chief scientist will lead the development of a new LLM supporting multiple languages, including Korean, English, German, and Japanese.

title: 4 AI-powered ETFs: Pros and cons of AI stockpicking funds
summary: This article explores AI-powered Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs), discussing how they use machine learning to select stocks and the potential benefits and drawbacks. It details four specific AI-driven ETFs, highlighting their assets under management and expense ratios. The piece emphasizes that while AI stock-picking is thrilling, it's still in its early stages and investors should consider their needs and costs.

title: Intel’s Terminated $5.4B Tower Acquisition: 5 Big Things To Know
summary: Intel terminated its $5.4 billion acquisition of Tower Semiconductor due to regulatory approval issues, a setback for CEO Pat Gelsinger's IDM 2.0 strategy and Intel Foundry Services. The deal's failure, possibly due to U.S.-China geopolitical tensions, resulted in a $353 million termination fee. Despite this, Intel remains committed to its foundry business, aiming to become the second-largest global external foundry by 2030, though Tower's capacity and customer base would have provided a significant boost.

title: Hedge fund exposure to 7 biggest tech stocks at record high, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Hedge funds have reached record exposure to the seven largest tech stocks by market capitalization, according to Goldman Sachs data, driven by strong performance and the artificial intelligence theme. These seven stocks, including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, now constitute about 20% of the total net market value held by hedge funds tracked by Goldman Sachs. Despite the concentration risk, investment managers rationalize these allocations due to the significant returns generated by these companies this year.

title: XOMO - YieldMax XOM Option Income Strategy ETF Stock Price and Quote
summary: This article provides a detailed quote and financial data for the XOMO - YieldMax XOM Option Income Strategy ETF. It includes current stock price, performance metrics, dividend information, fund characteristics, and recent news announcements related to YieldMax ETFs. The fund aims for current income and indirect exposure to Exxon Mobil Corporation (XOM) through a synthetic covered call strategy.

title: SOXQ ETF: Huawei's Latest Phone And Implication For Semis Stocks
summary: Huawei has launched the Mate 60, a new 5G smartphone, signaling its recovery from past sanctions and strengthening China's semiconductor industry. This development poses competitive risks for holdings within the Invesco PHLX Semiconductor ETF (SOXQ). Given these implications for the semiconductor market, the author maintains a "Hold" position on SOXQ.

title: POET Technologies’ New Module Designs Attract Major Companies at CIOE
summary: POET Technologies' joint exhibition with Super Photonics Xiamen (SPX) at CIOE in Shenzhen was a significant success, leading to numerous customer engagements and requests for samples of their 800G and 400G optical engines. The company's new module designs, based on the POET Optical Interposer, simplify assembly by eliminating the need for active alignments and attracted major end-users like Alibaba, FiberHome, and ByteDance. The positive reception at the event signals strong near-term commercial activity for POET.

title: Seagate And Western Digital: Benefiting From AI And Generative AI Storage Demand (STX)
summary: The article discusses how Seagate and Western Digital are poised to benefit from the increasing demand for data storage driven by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and generative AI. It highlights that AI applications require extensive memory and storage, positioning Hard Disk Drives (HDDs) from these companies to dominate data centers for the next decade. Advanced technologies like HAMR from Seagate and MAMR from Western Digital are expected to keep HDDs competitive against SSDs through 2030.

title: Arm, the Chip Designer, Raises $4.87 Billion in the Year’s Largest I.P.O. (Published 2023)
summary: Arm, the British chip design company, successfully raised $4.87 billion in the largest initial public offering of the year, valuing the company at $54.5 billion. This I.P.O. is a significant event for SoftBank, which acquired Arm in 2016 and aims to capitalize on the tech industry's focus on artificial intelligence, following a failed acquisition bid by Nvidia. Arm's return to public markets under the ticker symbol ARM is being closely watched as a gauge of investor interest in new tech offerings.

title: AIoT Platforms Are on the Rise, But What Are They?
summary: This article explains the concept of AIoT (Artificial Intelligence of Things) platforms, which integrate AI programming into IoT devices to enhance functionality and efficiency. It details real-world applications across smart homes, edge computing, healthcare, and smart cities, highlighting the projected rapid growth of the AIoT market. The piece emphasizes the transformative potential of AIoT for industries, resource optimization, and decision-making.

title: Check out Direxion Daily Nvda Bull 2X Shares's stock price (NVDU) in real time
summary: This article provides real-time stock price information for Direxion Daily Nvda Bull 2X Shares (NVDU), including current trading data, key statistics, and historical performance. It details the stock's last price, volume, 52-week range, and dividend information. The page also offers a summary of events, but notes there is no recent news for the security.

title: Arm climbs 25% in Nasdaq debut after pricing IPO at $51 a share
summary: Arm Holdings saw its stock jump nearly 25% on its first day of trading on the Nasdaq after pricing its IPO at $51 per share, valuing the company at almost $60 billion. SoftBank, which took Arm private in 2016, retains about 90% of the company's outstanding shares. Despite its high valuation relative to its current growth, Arm's unique royalty-based business model, including revenue from decades-old designs, and its strategic importance in AI and chip design, are key factors in investor interest.

title: Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS), including its current stock price, key statistics like PE Ratio and Dividend Yield, and its top holdings as of August 31, 2025. The ETF has a portfolio value of $8.44 billion with top holdings including NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms. It also presents historical performance data and breakdowns of asset allocation and sector exposure.

title: Equal Weight ETF EQL Hits Key Buy Signal
summary: The article highlights the Alps Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL) as an intriguing tool to mitigate concentration risk in the S&P 500, particularly due to the dominance of a few tech firms. EQL, an equal-weight ETF, assigns equal weight to each sector and then to stocks within those sectors, offering diversification and strong performance. The fund hit a key buy signal as its price rose above its 50-day simple moving average.

title: iShares MSCI ACWI ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI ACWI ETF (ACWI) offers investors global equity exposure to large and mid-capitalization developed and emerging markets. It tracks the MSCI All Country World Index, providing diversification across numerous countries and sectors efficiently. The ETF is marketed as a low-cost investment vehicle with potential for long-term growth, though it acknowledges inherent investment risks.

title: Supermicro At 30: From Designing AI Chips To Selling AI Systems
summary: Supermicro, founded 30 years ago, began with Charles Liang's vision to improve server motherboards and power supplies after working on an AI processor design. The company has grown into a $10 billion systems business with global manufacturing facilities and aims for $20 billion in the next three years, continuously expanding its operations and exploring new factory locations.

title: CHPS ETF Analysis: Dividends, Returns NEO:CHPS
summary: This article provides a detailed analysis of the CHPS ETF, Global X Artificial Intelligence Semiconductor Index ETF Class A. It covers key statistics such as Assets Under Management, expense ratio, dividend yield, and issuer information. The article also breaks down the fund's holdings by sector and region, discusses its performance, and answers frequently asked questions regarding its investments, dividends, and AUM.

title: Palantir: Implications Of The $28B Mega Cisco-Splunk Deal (NYSE:PLTR)
summary: Cisco's $28 billion acquisition of Splunk underscores the increasing value of AI capabilities in the industry, raising questions about potential takeover targets. Palantir Technologies, with its aggressive focus on AI and growth in Business Intelligence, is identified as a possible acquisition candidate. This deal highlights the broader trend of large corporations seeking to acquire advanced AI capabilities for long-term revenue growth.

title: Beamr Issues Q3-2023 CEO Letter to Shareholders
summary: Beamr's CEO Sharon Carmel issued a letter to shareholders detailing Q3 2023 activities and progress, highlighting reaching $1.4M in revenues from Q1-Q3 2023 and $5.4M in cash and cash equivalents. The company also announced signing another top-five media company as a client and is on track to launch its new Beamr SaaS in Q1 2024, expecting revenue ramp-up in 2024. Collaboration with Nvidia continues, and Beamr is expanding sales and marketing capabilities in preparation for the SaaS launch.

title: BlackLine (BL) Strengthens Portfolio With Microsoft Teams Integration
summary: BlackLine (BL) has integrated Microsoft Teams and introduced enhanced capabilities for its Microsoft Dynamics 365 Connector to streamline finance and accounting processes. This partnership offers seamless compatibility with Microsoft ERPs, providing real-time notifications and improved data access. BlackLine also highlighted its robust portfolio, including recent acquisitions, AI-enabled solutions, and strong customer growth, expecting significant revenue for fiscal 2023.

title: Supermicro Starts Shipments of NVIDIA GH200 Grace Hopper Superchip-Based Servers, the Industry's First Family of NVIDIA MGX Systems
summary: Supermicro announces the shipment of new GPU systems based on the NVIDIA reference architecture, featuring NVIDIA GH200 Grace Hopper and NVIDIA Grace CPU Superchip. These systems, designed with a modular architecture for AI infrastructure, are the industry's first family of NVIDIA MGX Systems. Supermicro highlights their advanced liquid-cooling technology and ability to deliver thousands of rack-scale AI servers per month, accelerating time to market for AI-enabled applications.

title: REX Shares Partners with Tuttle Capital Management to Launch T-REX Single-Stock ETFs
summary: REX Shares, in partnership with Tuttle Capital Management, has launched T-REX Single-Stock ETFs, offering targeted 200% and -200% daily exposure to Tesla and NVIDIA. This new suite of ETFs is designed for sophisticated traders seeking to enhance potential returns through pinpoint positioning in highly traded stocks. The launch follows REX Shares' recent introduction of the REX FANG & Innovation Equity Premium Income ETF, which focuses on generating income from top technology stocks using a covered call strategy.

title: Dow Theory Letters - REX Shares Partners with Tuttle Capital Management to Launch T-REX Single-Stock ETFs
summary: REX Shares and Tuttle Capital Management have partnered to launch T-REX Single-Stock ETFs, offering targeted 200% and -200% exposure to Tesla and NVIDIA. This new suite of ETFs, including TSLT, TSLZ, NVDX, and NVDQ, is designed for sophisticated traders seeking to enhance potential returns through pinpoint positioning. The launch follows REX Shares' recent introduction of the REX FANG & Innovation Equity Premium Income ETF (FEPI), further expanding their innovative product offerings.

title: Cathie Wood explains how the artificial intelligence boom could propel Ark's Innovation ETF
summary: Cathie Wood believes the artificial intelligence boom could significantly boost Ark Invest's flagship Ark Innovation ETF (ARKK). While the fund has gained 17% this year, Wood emphasized that AI represents a reality, not just a dream, and that its disruptive nature will create new industry leaders. She cautioned investors to be discerning with their AI bets, highlighting Tesla as a key holding while expressing reservations about some other "Magnificent Seven" stocks.

title: Bitcoin Miner Bit Digital Diversifies Into AI for 'Substantially Higher Margin' Than Mining
summary: Bitcoin miner Bit Digital (BTBT) is diversifying its revenue streams by expanding into the artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure business, anticipating "substantially higher margins" than its traditional bitcoin mining and ether staking operations. The company signed a deal with an AI firm to provide cloud-based GPU resources, expected to generate over $250 million in additional revenue over three years, funded by a $35 million investment in GPUs. This strategic move aims to create a reliable income stream uncorrelated to bitcoin prices, helping the company weather potential downturns in the crypto market and upcoming halving events.

title: Nvidia to take on Intel, Qualcomm with Arm-based processors for PC; availability pegged for 2025
summary: Nvidia is developing Arm-based processors for personal computers, aiming to compete with Intel and Qualcomm, with availability expected as soon as 2025. This move intensifies competition in the PC chip market, especially as AMD is also reportedly working on Arm-based processors for PCs. The initiative follows Apple's successful transition to in-house Arm-based chips, boosting Mac sales, and poses a significant challenge to Intel's dominant position.

title: Microsoft will hold a 27% stake in OpenAI and gain access to its AI models.
summary: Microsoft and OpenAI have finalized a new agreement where Microsoft will acquire a 27% stake in OpenAI, valued at $135 billion. This agreement grants Microsoft access to OpenAI's AI technology, including AGI models, until 2032. OpenAI has also committed to investing an additional $250 billion in purchasing Azure services.

title: AMD soars as AI chip sales prediction bodes well for rivalry with Nvidia
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares jumped 8% after CEO Lisa Su provided an upbeat 2024 sales forecast of over $2 billion for its MI300 AI chips, positioning AMD as a clear second source to Nvidia in the AI accelerator market. This prediction helped alleviate concerns about a disappointing fourth-quarter forecast despite at least 18 analysts cutting price targets due to conservative forecasts and weakness in other AMD markets. The MI300 is set to become AMD's fastest product to reach $1 billion in sales, having secured commitments from multiple large hyperscale customers.

title: Super Micro stock has surged this year, but investors may be overlooking a risk
summary: Super Micro Computer Inc., a partner of Nvidia, has seen its stock surge over 200% this year, fueled by AI-ready server sales. The company reported fiscal first-quarter revenue of $2.12 billion and raised its annual guidance to between $10 billion and $11 billion. However, investors are cautioned that the company's increasing reliance on AI-related server sales (now over half its revenue) could pose a risk.

title: Raspberry Pi Receives Strategic Investment from Arm, Further Extending Long-Term Partnership
summary: Arm Holdings plc has made a strategic minority investment in Raspberry Pi Ltd, deepening their partnership that began in 2008. This investment aims to further enable the Internet of Things (IoT) developer community with low-cost, high-performance computing solutions built on Arm technology, particularly as edge compute and AI applications grow. Both companies share a vision to democratize technology and remove barriers to entry for innovation across various user groups.

title: Fortinet (FTNT) Q3 Earnings Beat Expectations, Sales Miss
summary: Fortinet (FTNT) reported mixed third-quarter 2023 results, with non-GAAP earnings per share of 41 cents surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 37 cents, an improvement of 41.4% year-over-year. However, total revenues of $1.33 billion missed the consensus mark by 1% despite a 16.1% year-over-year increase, driven by strong demand from small enterprise customers. The company provided guidance for Q4 and the full year 2023, while several analyst recommendations were mentioned.

title: Investing in Semiconductor ETFs & Stocks
summary: This article explores investing in semiconductor ETFs and stocks, detailing the sector's evolution, market dynamics, and future outlook, especially concerning AI. It highlights semiconductors' crucial role in modern technology, the economic powerhouse of the industry, and the benefits of investing via ETFs for diversification and accessibility. The piece also discusses factors influencing the sector, including geopolitical efforts to secure supply chains and the profound impact of AI on semiconductor demand and innovation.

title: Cisco taps ex-Microsoft executive Rodney Clark to lead partner network
summary: Cisco Systems Inc. has appointed Rodney Clark, a former Microsoft executive, as its new senior vice president for Partnerships and Small & Medium Business. Clark will be responsible for leading Cisco's global partner network. His appointment was announced on November 6, 2023.

title: Amdocs and NVIDIA to Accelerate Adoption of Generative AI for $1.7 Trillion Telecom Industry
summary: Amdocs and NVIDIA announced a collaboration to optimize large language models (LLMs) to accelerate the adoption of generative AI applications and services across the $1.7 trillion telecommunications and media industries. This partnership will see Amdocs customize enterprise-grade LLMs on NVIDIA accelerated computing, leveraging NVIDIA DGX Cloud AI supercomputing and NVIDIA AI Enterprise software within the Amdocs amAIz framework. The initiative aims to enable communications service providers to efficiently deploy generative AI for customer experiences, network provisioning, and other operational enhancements, building on Amdocs' existing partnership with Microsoft.

title: After Earnings, Is AMD Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar assesses AMD's stock post-Q3 earnings, evaluating its fair value, economic moat, and future prospects, particularly in the AI accelerator market. The company's target of over $2 billion in AI accelerator revenue for 2024 positions it as a significant player. While fair value is estimated at $125 per share, high uncertainty exists due to competition from Nvidia and potential shifts in the x86 architecture dominance.

title: 10월 하락장 맞춘 AI ETF…엔비디아보다 '이것' 담았다 [글로벌마켓나우 플러스]
summary: LG AI연구원과 인공지능 전문 자산운용사 크래프트 테크놀로지스가 협력하여 'LG 크래프트 AI 파워드 US 라지캡 코어 상장지수펀드'(LQAI ETF)를 뉴욕증권거래소에 상장했습니다. 이 ETF는 엔비디아보다 구글과 마이크로소프트 비중을 높이고, 크래프트 테크놀로지스의 AI 위험 예측 지표를 통해 10월 하락장과 11월 초 반등을 예측하는 정확도를 보였습니다. 내년 시장 전망에서는 넷플릭스를 최선호 종목으로 꼽고, 기술주와 헬스케어 비중을 높이며 부동산 섹터는 편입하지 않고 있습니다.

title: FMR LLC Acquires New Stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc
summary: FMR LLC, through its flagship company Fidelity Investments, has acquired a new stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc (MGTA) by purchasing 2,218,212 shares at $0.6996 per share. This transaction gives FMR LLC a 14.97% ownership stake in the clinical-stage biotechnology company, indicating a strategic investment aligning with the firm's focus on technology and healthcare sectors. Despite Magenta Therapeutics currently operating at a loss, FMR LLC's move suggests a belief in the company's long-term value and transformative potential in stem cell and gene therapy.

title: Sudden release of the Nvidia H200: double the capacity, the bandwidth is booming
summary: NVIDIA has unexpectedly released the HGX H200, an advanced Tensor Core GPU based on the Hopper architecture, boasting significantly increased memory capacity and bandwidth for AI and HPC workloads. The H200, featuring HBM3e memory, doubles capacity and offers 2.4 times the bandwidth of its predecessor, the A100. It also claims a 2x inference speed increase over the H100 GPU for LLMs and will be deployed by major cloud service providers and used in the new Jupiter supercomputer.

title: Amdocs to create telco-specific GenAI models using Nvidia service
summary: Amdocs will utilize Nvidia's AI foundry service to develop custom large language models (LLMs) specifically for the global telecommunications industry. This collaboration aims to provide telcos with enhanced performance and optimized resource utilization through specialized GenAI capabilities, building on a prior partnership between Amdocs and Microsoft. The development emphasizes the growing industry need for tailored AI solutions to address sector-specific challenges, as highlighted by other major telecom players developing their own GenAI models.

title: AMD Is Powering the New Steam Machine. Will It Move the Needle for AMD Stock?
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) will power Valve's new Steam Machine with its RDNA 3 GPU and Zen 4 CPU, a development that reinforces AMD's reputation as an innovator and aids in brand visibility and diversification, despite being unlikely to significantly impact AMD stock revenue immediately. The article discusses AMD's strong Q3 earnings, high valuation multiples compared to competitors like Nvidia, Qualcomm, and Texas Instruments, and analyst price targets. While AI dominates current chipmaker focus, the gaming industry remains crucial, showcasing AMD's continued innovation in the sector.

title: The 3 Hottest ETFs to Buy Right Now
summary: This article highlights three top-performing ETFs for investors: the Invesco S&P 500 Top 50 ETF (XLG), the iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX), and the Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT). It details their holdings, expense ratios, and strong historical performance compared to the broader market, making a case for their inclusion in a long-term investment portfolio.

title: 3 undervalued artificial intelligence stocks
summary: This article identifies three undervalued artificial intelligence stocks—Snowflake, Cognizant Technology Solutions, and Salesforce—according to Morningstar analysts, while also highlighting dominant but fairly valued AI players like Nvidia and Microsoft. It emphasizes the significant impact of generative AI and offers insights into how investors can approach the AI boom by breaking down the space into various themes and subthemes with representative companies. The piece also notes the strong rally in AI stocks following ChatGPT's release and details the economic moats and fair value estimates for the featured companies.

title: Nova, MACOM, KLA Corporation, Lam Research, and Monolithic Power Systems Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Several semiconductor and analog semiconductor stocks, including Nova, MACOM, KLA Corporation, Lam Research, and Monolithic Power Systems, experienced significant jumps in their stock prices. This rally was fueled by renewed enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, particularly after Alphabet announced its upgraded Gemini 3 AI model, and positive sentiment from the New York Fed regarding a potential December interest rate cut. The article also provides a specific focus on Nova's recent stock performance and market context.

title: One ETF that focuses on employee happiness is outperforming the market this year
summary: An ETF focused on companies with high employee happiness, the Harbor Human Capital Factor U.S. Large Cap ETF (HAPI), has outperformed the S&P 500 this year, climbing nearly 25% compared to the benchmark's less than 20% gain. The fund's strategy is based on Irrational Capital's extensive employee surveys and publicly available data, creating a "human capital score" that is considered a novel and uncorrelated investment factor. While the large-cap HAPI fund includes major tech stocks contributing to its performance, a similar small-cap ETF (HAPS) is also available, offering potential for future growth.

title: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) Morgan Stanley Raises Target Forecast
summary: Morgan Stanley has increased its 12-month target price for NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) from $235.00 to $250.00, while re-iterating an "Overweight" rating. This upgrade indicates strong confidence in NVIDIA's fundamentals, driven by AI and data-center demand, despite market concerns about U.S.–China export restrictions and competitive pressures. The target hike acts as a counterweight to bearish sentiment, suggesting the recent stock pullback may be overdone relative to NVIDIA’s long-term earnings potential.

title: Netflix Stock Breaks Below 20-Day Moving Average Amid Selloff. Should You Buy the Dip?
summary: Netflix (NFLX) is experiencing a selloff, trading below its 20-day moving average, following Reed Hastings' sale of over 375,000 shares. This sale is not seen as negative as it was prearranged and Hastings maintains significant ownership, but technical indicators suggest bearish momentum with potential further declines. Despite this, Wall Street retains a "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price indicating significant upside.

title: Opinion: AMD’s new products represent the first real threat to Nvidia’s AI dominance
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc.'s new product launch, specifically its Instinct MI300 family of GPUs and ROCm software ecosystem, is seen by analysts as the first serious challenge to Nvidia Corp.'s dominance in the artificial intelligence market. These new offerings are designed to accelerate AI applications and directly compete with Nvidia's CUDA platform.

title: AMD releases new chips to power faster AI training
summary: AMD announced the availability of its new MI300 chips, including the Instinct MI300X accelerator and Instinct M1300A APU, designed to power demanding AI training and large language models. The company also unveiled the Ryzen 8040 mobile processors, which will bring enhanced AI capabilities to laptops in 2024. These releases position AMD to compete more directly with Nvidia in the booming AI chip market.

title: AMD launches MI300, claims AI performance lead over Nvidia ...
summary: AMD has launched its Instinct MI300 series data center AI accelerators and ROCm 6 software stack, claiming a significant performance advantage over Nvidia's H100. The MI300 series comes in two variants, MI300x and MI300A, offering substantial memory and processing power for AI and high-performance computing. AMD highlights strong demand and adoption by major tech companies, positioning the MI300 as a leading solution for generative AI.

title: Top 10: Edge computing companies and solutions
summary: This article lists the top 10 edge computing companies and their solutions, highlighting how edge computing addresses the limitations of traditional data centers by processing data closer to its source. The list features major technology companies like AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and NVIDIA, detailing their contributions to the evolving landscape of edge computing.

title: Lisa Su’s net worth: How she saved AMD & built her wealth
summary: This article details Lisa Su's background, her impact as CEO of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), and how she built her net worth. It covers her engineering career, her strategies to diversify AMD's product portfolio and financial recovery, and her compensation, highlighting that her wealth primarily comes from AMD stock holdings. The article also touches upon AMD's stock performance under her leadership and her status relative to being a billionaire.

title: The Best Artificial Intelligence ETFs of 2023
summary: The article highlights the top-performing Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETFs of 2023, with returns as high as 71%. It details five specific AI ETFs, including thematic funds that invest in companies benefiting from AI growth and AI-powered funds that use AI to select stocks, identifying key holdings and year-to-date performance for each.

title: Best Flying Cars Stocks 2024: 3 Names to Add to Your Must-Buy List
summary: This article identifies three top investment opportunities in the emerging flying car market for 2024. It highlights Joby Aviation (JOBY) for its strong earnings and potential commercial flight by 2025, Lilium (LILM) due to recent regulatory approvals and partnership MoUs, and the SmartETFs Smart Transportation & Technology ETF (MOTO) for diversified exposure to the sector. The author suggests these stocks are poised for growth in a market projected to reach $1.5 trillion by 2040.

title: The Rise of Smart Machines
summary: Advancements in AI and robotics are poised to revolutionize the industrial sector, driving a significant increase in automation and reshaping production lines. This shift will elevate human workers to supervisory roles over robots, boosting productivity and redefining labor's role in the global economy, fueled by capital investments and re-shoring initiatives. The article highlights the secular growth of the industrial robotics market and the expanding ecosystem it supports, including data centers and software providers.

title: Megatrends: How to Invest in the AI Boom
summary: This article from Morgan Stanley discusses investment opportunities in the rapidly growing artificial intelligence (AI) industry, projected to reach $3 trillion. It identifies four types of AI leaders for investors to watch: Margin Expanders, Trailblazers, Price Raisers, and Input Suppliers, while also cautioning about potential risks and the need for selective investing.

title: Wall Street’s 10 favorite stocks for 2024
summary: This article identifies Wall Street's top 10 favorite stocks for 2024, based on analyst ratings and implied upside potential. The selection process began with S&P 500 companies that have at least 75% "buy" or equivalent ratings. The list includes companies such as Nvidia, First Solar, and Halliburton, with implied upside potentials ranging from 27% to 37%.

title: Wall Street’s 10 favorite stocks for 2024
summary: This article identifies Wall Street's top 10 stock picks for 2024 based on analyst ratings and implied upside potential. The list, derived from S&P 500 companies with at least 75% "buy" ratings, includes stocks like Nvidia, First Solar, and Halliburton, highlighting the optimistic outlook following investor confidence in the Federal Reserve's interest rate decisions.

title: Apple's stock underperformed top tech peers in 2023 due to longest revenue slide in 22 years
summary: Apple's stock underperformed its mega-cap tech peers in 2023, experiencing its longest revenue slide in 22 years with four consecutive quarters of declining sales. This decline was attributed to a combination of a weak economic environment for smartphones and PCs, and company-specific issues such as the lack of new iPad models and an Apple Watch sales ban. Despite a 49% stock rally for the year, Apple lagged behind competitors like Nvidia, Meta, Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

title: Cyber Hornet S&P 500 and Bitcoin 75/25 Strategy ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:ZZZ)
summary: The Cyber Hornet S&P 500 and Bitcoin 75/25 Strategy ETF (ZZZ) is an exchange-traded fund launched on December 28, 2023, by Onefund, which invests in a 75/25 blend of US large-cap stocks and front-month CME Bitcoin futures. It does not directly invest in Bitcoin's spot price. The ETF has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy," assets under management of $6.02 million, and a net expense ratio of 1.01%.

title: Top-Performing Stocks of 2023
summary: The article details the top-performing stocks of 2023, highlighting Coinbase, Nvidia, DraftKings, Meta Platforms, and Palantir Technologies among others. It also identifies undervalued top performers and top-performing moat stocks and technology stocks, providing Morningstar analyst insights and key metrics for each.

title: The best and worst performing funds and sectors of 2023
summary: The article reviews the top and bottom performing funds and sectors in 2023, highlighting crypto, semiconductor, and AI-related funds as top performers. It also notes the strong performance of the Emerging Europe and Technology equity sectors, while Chinese and Hong Kong stocks were among the worst performers. Two property funds linked to the Chinese market were the poorest performing, with one facing termination.

title: Intel and DigitalBridge Launch Articul8, an Enterprise Generative AI Company
summary: Intel and DigitalBridge announced the formation of Articul8 AI, Inc., an independent company offering a full-stack, vertically-optimized, and secure generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) software platform for enterprise customers. Articul8 was created with intellectual property and technology developed at Intel, and the two companies will collaborate on go-to-market opportunities. The platform keeps customer data, training, and inference within enterprise security perimeters and supports cloud, on-prem, or hybrid deployment.

title: Markets in Focus: Concentrating on Diversification
summary: The article discusses the increasing concentration in equity markets, exemplified by the "Magnificent Seven" stocks, and the diminished diversification benefits of bonds, especially since 2020. It suggests that investors reassess top-down allocations and broaden equity exposure across diverse regions, sectors, and styles to create more resilient portfolios. The MSCI Adaptive Multi-Factor Allocation Model indicates an overweight to value and low size as of December 31, 2023, with Europe and China trading at lower historical valuations.

title: US plans $162 million award to Microchip Technology to boost production
summary: The U.S. Commerce Department plans to award Microchip Technology $162 million in government grants to increase domestic production of semiconductors and microcontroller units. This funding aims to triple production at two U.S. factories, reducing reliance on foreign supply chains for crucial components used in various industries. This award is part of the "Chips for America" program, designed to boost U.S. semiconductor manufacturing and research.

title: NVIDIA, Xiaomi and other giants are competing to lay out their plans! AI glasses may become the next super Hardware market by 2025; which Concept stocks are likely to become big winners?
summary: The upcoming CES 2025 is expected to highlight AI glasses as NVIDIA, Xiaomi, and other tech giants unveil new products and patents in the field. Industry analysts and reports predict rapid market penetration and substantial growth for AI smart glasses by 2025, with sales projected to reach 55 million units by 2029 and 1.4 billion by 2035. Several companies, including Vuzix, Kopin, WiMi Hologram Cloud, and Innovative Eyewear, are positioned to benefit from this emerging market, along with major tech players like Apple, Meta, and Google, and various solution providers and chip manufacturers.

title: Kodiak Unveils First 'Driverless-Ready' Semi-Truck Designed for Scaled Deployment, Plans Commercial Runs on I-45 This Year
summary: Kodiak Robotics introduced its sixth-generation 'driverless-ready' semi-truck, designed for scaled deployment, which includes redundant safety-critical hardware and advanced software. The company plans to launch driverless operations between Dallas and Houston later this year using this new truck, building on five years of real-world testing. This development positions Kodiak as a leader in autonomous trucking, with its technology being deployment-ready and truck manufacturer-agnostic.

title: Luminar expands partnership with Mercedes-Benz and debuts LiDAR-enabled AES
summary: Luminar announced an expanded partnership with Mercedes-Benz, including integrating LiDAR technology into the Official FIA F1® Safety Car and next-generation Mercedes vehicles. The company also debuted LiDAR-enabled Automatic Emergency Steering (AES) and Automated Valet software, powered by its new Iris+ LiDAR, and highlighted its commercial growth and year-end industrialization milestone with Volvo for the EX90. Luminar further showcased its innovations at the chip level and collaborations with technology partners like NVIDIA and Mobileye.

title: Upcoming Events
summary: REX Shares, in collaboration with Tuttle Capital Management, has expanded its T-REX Single-Stock ETF suite with new offerings providing 200% daily targeted exposure to Apple, Alphabet, and Microsoft. These ETFs (AAPX, GOOX, MSFX) are designed for seasoned traders to give leveraged exposure to major tech stocks. The T-REX suite, which debuted in October 2023, now covers diverse tech sectors and has already attracted over $100 million in assets.

title: CORSAIR Pledges PSU Support for GeForce RTX 40 SUPER Series GPUs
summary: Corsair has announced full power supply unit (PSU) support for NVIDIA's new RTX 40 SUPER Series graphics cards, including the RTX 4080 Super, RTX 4070 Ti Super, and RTX 4070 Super. Corsair recommends specific PSU models like the HX1000i, RM1000e, and SF850L for these new GPUs, noting their power delivery and included PCIe 5.0 12VHPWR cables. The company also offers a range of compatible hardware and will soon provide pre-built gaming PCs featuring these new graphics cards.

title: Synopsys to acquire Ansys to join forces for silicon-to-system design, simulation, and analysis
summary: Synopsys announced its acquisition of Ansys for approximately $35 billion, aiming to combine Ansys' simulation and analysis capabilities with Synopsys' electronic design automation (EDA) solutions. This merger seeks to create a leader in silicon-to-systems design solutions, addressing the growing complexity in technology R&D, particularly with advancements in AI, silicon proliferation, and software-defined systems. The deal is expected to expand Synopsys' total addressable market, enhance its silicon-to-systems strategy, and generate significant synergies.

title: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) Stock Rocketed Over 200% in 2023
summary: Polen Capital's "Polen Focus Growth Strategy" fund saw significant returns in 2023, with NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) being a key contributor as its stock rocketed over 200%. The article highlights NVIDIA's crucial role in the generative AI boom, providing the processing power for large language models and AI factories. NVIDIA was held by 180 hedge fund portfolios at the end of Q3 2023, up from 175 in the previous quarter.

title: Western Digital snags top spot in Morgan Stanley's microchip ranking away from Nvidia
summary: Western Digital Corp. has overtaken Nvidia Inc. as Morgan Stanley's top-ranked microchip company. This shift is attributed to Western Digital's decision to spin off its flash memory business. The article highlights Western Digital's corporate campus in San Jose.

title: Top 10 Semiconductor IP Companies | A Reusable Technology
summary: The article identifies and profiles the top 10 semiconductor IP companies, detailing their overviews, key offerings, financial data, and recent developments. It also provides an overview of the semiconductor IP market, including its drivers and projected growth from $6.4 billion in 2023 to $11.3 billion by 2032. The content highlights the importance of semiconductor IP in integrated circuit design, emphasizing benefits like cost reduction and accelerated development.

title: AI & The Dragon: What Trends Will Dominate 2024?
summary: In 2024, Emerging Markets (EM) are expected to rebound, driven by potential Fed rate cuts and a weakening US dollar, with China and Brazil presenting more attractive valuations than the "Magnificent Seven" and other EM ex-China countries. The article suggests focusing on long-term trends and strategic allocations to specific growth sectors within EM. China's "Year of the Dragon" is anticipated to bring a gradual recovery in consumer sentiment and real estate, supported by government policies and significant expected EPS growth.

title: Top metaverse investors and how to start investing
summary: This article explores various ways to invest in the metaverse, including indirect investments through company stocks and ETFs, and direct investments in virtual properties and cryptocurrencies. It highlights major metaverse investors across technology platforms, gaming, chip manufacturing, and software, while also cautioning about the significant risks involved in this evolving digital realm.

title: 15 semiconductor companies that have followed Nvidia's lead in two key areas
