summary: This article identifies 15 semiconductor companies that have demonstrated strong pricing power and improved efficiency, following Nvidia's successful lead. This combination of operational strengths is highlighted as a positive indicator for long-term investors in the stock market. The piece notes Nvidia's dominance in AI-supporting GPUs and anticipates its continued sales growth through 2025.

title: Fund selectors flock to AI and semiconductor ETFs in January
summary: Investors dramatically increased their allocation to semiconductor and artificial intelligence ETFs in January, betting on the continued strong performance of these themes throughout 2024. The Xtrackers Artificial Intelligence & Big Data UCITS ETF (XAIX) and the iShares MSCI Global Semiconductors UCITS ETF (SEMI) saw significant inflows, indicating sustained investor appetite for AI and chip-related investments despite a decrease in overall thematic ETF inflows in 2023.

title: Pixels to Profits: The Changing Economics of Gaming in 2024
summary: This article examines the evolving economics of the video gaming industry in 2024, highlighting its massive revenue and attraction for investors. It discusses key trends, how to gain exposure, and strategies for finding valuable opportunities within this diverse sector. The piece also provides a brief market summary covering Evergrande's liquidation, LVMH's record revenue, UK profit warnings, Meta's dividend, US Fed rates, job openings, and Australia's inflation, before diving into gaming company types and future outlooks.

title: How NVIDIA’s Failure Analysis Lab Solves Silicon and Board-Level Mysteries
summary: NVIDIA's dedicated failure analysis team plays a critical role in identifying the root causes of malfunctions in their complex hardware products, from silicon-level defects to board-level issues. Employing sophisticated techniques and collaborating across departments, this team ensures product quality and accelerates time to market by quickly resolving engineering challenges. Their work highlights the importance of in-house expertise in maintaining the high standards of NVIDIA's technology.

title: FDA Hits Blockbuster Amgen Drug
summary: The FDA issued a "boxed warning" for Amgen's blockbuster drug Prolia due to the potential for dangerously low calcium levels in patients with advanced kidney disease, especially those on dialysis. This news comes as Amgen also announced a collaboration with Nvidia to use generative AI for biomarker discovery and precision medicine development. Prolia, Amgen's second-highest selling drug, faces patent expiration next year, which could lead to generic alternatives.

title: Analyzing all the security and AI news from Cisco Live EMEA 2024
summary: Cisco Live EMEA 2024 showcased significant innovations in security and AI, with a strong emphasis on addressing key IT pain points. The company introduced Cisco Identity Intelligence and AI Assistant for Secure Access to combat identity-based attacks and streamline security administration. Additionally, Cisco unveiled new Validated Designs for AI infrastructure and expanded its partnership with Nvidia to provide diverse networking solutions for AI deployments.

title: ITOT ETF: Investing Well Doesn’t Have to Be Complicated
summary: The iShares Core S&P Total U.S. Stock Market ETF (ITOT) offers a straightforward, low-cost way to invest in a broad range of U.S. companies, providing exposure to 90% of the total domestic stock market. With an ultra-low expense ratio of 0.03% and a track record of strong double-digit annualized returns over the past decade, ITOT is presented as an effective long-term portfolio building block due to its wide diversification across 2,589 stocks. Despite its simplicity, it has delivered significant wealth building for investors since its inception in 2004.

title: Morgan Stanley hikes Nvidia price target ahead of earnings: 'AI demand continues to surge'
summary: Morgan Stanley has increased its price target for Nvidia to $750 from $603, reiterating an overweight rating, citing strong near-term demand for AI processors. This new target suggests a 10% upside for the AI chipmaker, which has seen its stock surge significantly recently. Analyst Joseph Moore notes that while there are concerns about sustainability, the current AI demand remains robust.

title: The Secrets of Money Monday Low Float Runners
summary: This article discusses the criteria for identifying "low float runners" in the stock market, particularly focusing on Monday mornings. It highlights the importance of premarket gainers, news catalysts, low float shares, high volume, and chat pumps, using Beamr Imaging Ltd. (NASDAQ: BMR) as a case study. The author also mentions the "aggression progression" of stock patterns and risk management for capitalizing on these opportunities.

title: Beamr’s collaboration with Nvidia helps fuel stock’s massive rally
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd.'s stock experienced a massive rally on Monday, driven by the announcement of its collaboration with Nvidia Corp. The stock surged by as much as 1,556% intraday before closing up 371.6%, with an additional 20% gain after hours. This significant movement was accompanied by an extraordinary trading volume of 141.1 million shares.

title: This Leveraged ETF Is Up Almost 50% the Past 3 Months
summary: The Direxion Daily Robotics, Artificial Intelligence & Automation Index Bull 2X ETF (UBOT) has seen a nearly 50% increase over the past three months, driven by strong AI-related revenue and positive future guidance from major tech companies. Nvidia, a key player in AI, is also experiencing significant growth, with its stock up about 50% year-to-date and threatening to overtake Amazon in market capitalization. Single-stock ETFs like the Direxion Daily NVDA Bull 1.5X Shares (NVDU) offer traders leveraged exposure to Nvidia's bullish performance.

title: Relx Share Price Spiked Up 3% but Later Fell on FY 2023 Results
summary: Relx PLC announced strong FY 2023 financial results, reporting an 8% organic revenue growth to £9,161 million and a 13% organic adjusted operating profit increase to £3,030 million. The company proposed an 8% higher full-year dividend of 58.8p per share. Despite an initial 3% spike in its share price, it later fell, trading at 3430.5p.

title: Nano-X Imaging (NNOX) Stock Soars 50% on Nvidia Investment
summary: Nano-X Imaging (NNOX) stock surged over 50% today after Nvidia disclosed its investment in the medical imaging firm. This investment, though small, has provided a significant catalyst for NNOX, which had been struggling and previously categorized as a penny stock. The news has thrust Nano-X into the spotlight, making it a top performer among the companies Nvidia recently invested in, despite prior bearish expert assessments.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2024
summary: NVIDIA reported record-breaking financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2024, driven by surging demand for accelerated computing and generative AI. The company achieved record quarterly revenue of $22.1 billion and full-year revenue of $60.9 billion, with significant growth in its Data Center segment. NVIDIA also announced a quarterly cash dividend and provided an optimistic outlook for the first quarter of fiscal 2025.

title: DigitalOcean beats expectations under the helm of new CEO Paddy Srinivasan
summary: DigitalOcean Holdings Inc. exceeded earnings and revenue expectations for the last quarter and provided optimistic guidance for the current quarter, leading to a stock surge. The company, under new CEO Paddy Srinivasan, is strategically focusing on AI solutions for small businesses, utilizing its Paperspace platform to offer Nvidia H100 GPUs, and demonstrating strong growth in its annual revenue run rate and average revenue per customer. Despite a slowdown in growth in the final quarter, analysts believe AI will be a key strategy for rekindling growth under the new leadership.

title: Dimensional ETFs and More: New on Syfe Custom Portfolio
summary: Syfe Custom Portfolio is expanding its offerings with new equity ETFs from Dimensional Fund Advisors, focusing on value and quality tilts, alongside additional quality-focused and equally-weighted Nasdaq ETFs. The article details Dimensional's factor-based investing approach and highlights specific ETFs added to the platform, including options for accredited investors such as Bitcoin ETFs and a Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF. Syfe also explains how to utilize Custom Portfolios to complement existing investments by allowing tactical allocation based on asset class, risk, geography, and sector.

title: Lotus Tech completes merger with LCAA, to trade as LOT on Nasdaq
summary: Lotus Technology Inc., a luxury electric vehicle manufacturer, has completed its merger with L Catterton Asia Acquisition Corp (LCAA). The combined entity, now named Lotus Technology Inc., will begin trading its American depositary shares on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "LOT" on February 23, 2024. This U.S. listing is a significant step in Lotus Tech's global expansion strategy for sustainable luxury mobility.

title: AI Theme 'Skyrockets', ETFs 'Attracting a Gold Rush': Who Will Be the Next NVIDIA?
summary: NVIDIA's recent exceptional earnings, with a 265% year-over-year Q4 revenue increase and 765% earnings per share surge, have driven its stock to new highs and significantly boosted its market value. This success has also fueled a "gold rush" into semiconductor and AI-related ETFs, with funds like the VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF and leveraged NVIDIA-focused ETFs experiencing substantial capital inflows and impressive gains. The article highlights that the AI dividend is far from over, with projections for significant growth in the semiconductor industry and AI-related applications globally.

title: SPY ETF Reaches Record High Amid Nvidia-Fueled AI Rally—Key Chart Pattern to Watch
summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) reached a record high, mirroring the S&P 500's surge driven by mega-cap technology stocks, particularly after Nvidia's strong earnings report. Nvidia, along with other AI-related companies like Microsoft and Broadcom, contributed significantly to the rally, highlighting the outsized influence of Magnificent Seven stocks within the SPY's portfolio. Investors should watch the SPY's rising wedge pattern for potential breakouts or breakdowns, which could signal future price movements.

title: How Nvidia grew to a trillion-dollar company fueling the AI revolution
summary: Nvidia has grown into a nearly $3 trillion company by specializing in Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), which have become crucial for the artificial intelligence revolution. Initially used for gaming, GPUs' ability to perform concurrent calculations makes them ideal for AI, giving Nvidia a significant first-mover advantage and market dominance. The company's unique technology and supply chain have led to widespread adoption by major tech firms, with discussions emerging about potential shortages and the need for continued investment in chip manufacturing.

title: TWN CEF: No FOMO, Ride The 'AI 5' Tailwind With This Hated Fund (NYSE:TWN)
summary: The Taiwan Fund Inc (TWN) is a closed-end fund focused on long-term capital growth through actively managed investments in stocks listed on the Taiwan Stock Exchange. With approximately $330 million in assets, the fund primarily invests in companies like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM), which has significantly contributed to its recent performance. The article suggests this fund, despite being "hated," offers a way to capitalize on the "AI 5" tailwind.

title: ServiceNow and NVIDIA Expand Partnership With Introduction of Telco-Specific GenAI Solutions to Elevate Service Experiences
summary: ServiceNow and NVIDIA have expanded their partnership to introduce telco-specific generative AI solutions aimed at improving service experiences. The first solution, Now Assist for Telecommunications Service Management (TSM), built on the Now Platform and leveraging NVIDIA AI, is designed to boost agent productivity, speed resolution times, and enhance customer experiences for telecommunications service providers. This collaboration focuses on using GenAI for critical use cases like customer care and service assurance to drive business transformation in the telco industry.

title: What's Cathie Wood been selling?
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Investment Management has sold shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp. and Nvidia Corp., diversifying holdings amidst the AI frenzy. This marks Wood's first sale of TSMC stock in over two years and follows previous sales of Nvidia. The move comes as both TSMC and Nvidia have seen significant gains, with Wood's funds betting on growth potential in less-talked-about software companies like UiPath and Twilio, despite earlier predictions of AI's transformative impact.

title: Micron begins production of a 'better' HBM3E memory
summary: Micron Technology has started volume production of HBM3E DRAM for AI datacenters, claiming its offering consumes 30 percent less power than competitors. Its 24Gbyte 8-high HBM3E components will be featured in Nvidia's H200 tensor core GPUs shipping in Q2 2024, potentially positioning Micron ahead of rival SK Hynix in HBM3E production. The company is also preparing a 12-high 36Gbyte HBM3E component for introduction in March 2024, with its stock opening almost 5 percent higher on the news.

title: Nvidia's Rally Casts Spotlight on 2 Leveraged ETFs
summary: Nvidia's strong financial performance, including 265% year-over-year revenue growth, has propelled its stock, highlighting the potential for leveraged ETFs invested in the company. For bullish investors, the Direxion Daily NVDA Bull 1.5X Shares (NVDU) offers increased exposure, while the Direxion Daily NVDA Bear 1X Shares (NVDD) provides an option for short-term profit-taking or hedging. Additionally, the Direxion Daily Robotics, Artificial Intelligence & Automation Index Bull 2X ETF (UBOT) benefits from Nvidia's AI-driven growth as Nvidia comprises a significant portion of its holdings.

title: ServiceNow, Hugging Face, and NVIDIA Release New Open-Access LLMs to Help Developers Tap Generative AI to Build Enterprise Applications
summary: ServiceNow, Hugging Face, and NVIDIA have released StarCoder2, a new family of open-access large language models (LLMs) for code generation. These models, developed by the BigCode community, aim to help developers build enterprise applications using generative AI with improved performance, transparency, and cost-effectiveness. StarCoder2 offers three model sizes, including a 3 billion-parameter model by ServiceNow and a 15 billion-parameter model by NVIDIA, and is trained on 619 programming languages for various specialized tasks.

title: NANC ETF Tracking Democrat Stock Trades Beating S&P 500 on Tech Bets
summary: The Unusual Whales Democratic ETF (NANC), which tracks stock trades by Democrats in Congress, has outperformed the S&P 500 since its launch in February 2023, returning 30% compared to the S&P 500's 24%. This outperformance is largely attributed to its significant holdings in mega-cap tech stocks like Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, and Nvidia. In contrast, a similar ETF tracking Republican trades (KRUZ) has only gained about 15% over the same period.

title: VONG ETF: A Great Way to Invest in Top Growth Stocks
summary: The Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) offers a straightforward and effective way to invest in a diverse range of top growth stocks. With a strong track record of impressive returns, a low expense ratio of 0.08%, and a portfolio that includes leading mega-cap technology companies and other high-growth firms, VONG is considered a compelling option for investors seeking exposure to large-cap growth in the U.S. market. The ETF's holdings are highly rated, with many featuring Outperform-equivalent Smart Scores.

title: Nvidia skyrocketed over the past 5 years, but 3 stocks performed even better—and none is Apple or Tesla
summary: While Nvidia has achieved an impressive 1,904% return over the past five years, three mid-cap stocks have significantly outpaced it: e.l.f. Beauty (2,491%), Super Micro Computer (4,175%), and Celsius Holdings (over 5,300%). The article highlights that smaller companies (mid-caps) often show greater growth potential and less media coverage than large-cap stocks like Nvidia, suggesting diversification into these smaller companies can boost long-term returns. Investors are advised to use diversified funds (ETFs and mutual funds) to mitigate volatility and risk associated with individual small-cap stock picks.

title: The AI Megatrend: 3 Global X ETFs to Capitalize on the Artificial Intelligence Frenzy
summary: This article highlights three Global X Artificial Intelligence ETFs (BOTZ, AIQ, CLOU) that investors can consider to capitalize on the growing AI megatrend. It details the holdings, focus, and performance of each ETF, emphasizing Nvidia's significant role in some. The author also discusses the broader landscape of AI ETFs and the importance of understanding their underlying assets.

title: Dow's nearly 125-point rally led by gains for shares of NVIDIA Corp., Cisco
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose by nearly 125 points, primarily driven by strong performances from NVIDIA Corp. and Cisco Systems Inc. NVIDIA's shares surged after an analyst upgrade, while Cisco remained relatively flat despite an analyst reiteration of an overweight rating. The overall market saw NVIDIA and Cisco among the top gainers, contrasting with losses from other Dow components.

title: Magnificent Seven vs. the ‘Granolas’: How does Europe’s version stack up?
summary: This article compares the U.S. "Magnificent Seven" stocks with Europe's "Granolas," highlighting their differences in market value, sector diversity, and profitability. While the Magnificent Seven are largely tech-driven and exceptionally profitable, the Granolas offer broader sector representation and solid returns, often trading at a discount despite their strong performance. The piece examines historical returns, valuation ratios, and individual stock assessments for both groups.

title: SK Hynix explores HBM chip collaboration with Kioxia
summary: SK Hynix is exploring a collaboration with Kioxia Holdings Corp. to produce high bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, with a proposal for joint production at existing Kioxia-Western Digital plants in Japan. This move comes as SK Hynix reportedly opposes a merger between Kioxia and Western Digital, fearing it would create the world's largest NAND memory manufacturer. The collaboration would leverage SK Hynix's HBM expertise and Kioxia's facilities to meet soaring demand for AI applications while potentially influencing the Kioxia-Western Digital merger discussions.

title: NetApp Turbocharges AI Innovation with Intelligent Data Infrastructure
summary: NetApp announced new capabilities for its intelligent data infrastructure, integrating with NVIDIA's high-performance compute, networking, and software, to maximize the potential of generative AI (Gen AI) projects. These updates include NetApp AIPod™ certifications for NVIDIA DGX BasePOD, new FlexPod for AI reference architectures, and validation for NVIDIA OVX systems. Additionally, NetApp is introducing Autonomous Ransomware Protection with AI (ARP/AI) embedded in storage to combat sophisticated cyber threats.

title: SCHX: As Cheap As It Gets For Large-Cap Exposure
summary: This article recommends the Schwab U.S. Large-Cap ETF (SCHX) for investors seeking exposure to large-cap stocks, highlighting its diversification, low costs, and tax efficiency. Key holdings include tech giants like Microsoft and Apple, leading to significant exposure to the Information Technology sector. The author, Michael A. Gayed, CFA, discusses market efficiency and offers insights from his Lead-Lag Report service.

title: Megacap tech stocks dominate many ESG funds. Here’s why
summary: Megacap tech stocks frequently dominate ESG funds because these funds still aim for top performers within economic groups, and the tech sector is considered "cleaner" regarding environmental impact. While ESG funds saw net outflows in Q4 2023 due to advisors pulling back, individual investor interest remains strong, viewing ESG as a long-term allocation strategy rather than a momentum play. Despite misconceptions, ESG funds can and do invest in energy companies, as explained by experts from DWS Group and former VettaFi.

title: Navitas unveils plans for 8–10kW power platform supporting 2025 AI power requirements
summary: Navitas Semiconductor is developing an 8–10kW power platform to meet the exponential power demands of AI data centers by 2025. This new platform, leveraging advanced GaN and SiC technologies, builds on their earlier 3.2kW and 4.5kW offerings, aiming for higher power density and efficiency. The company anticipates a full platform launch in Q4 2024, addressing the critical power challenge posed by rapidly advancing AI processors.

title: Aclara joins Nvidia and Utilidata in bringing AI to the smart meter
summary: Aclara Technologies has partnered with Utilidata and Nvidia to embed AI modules directly into smart meters, marking the first hardware collaboration for Utilidata's Nvidia-powered distributed AI platform, Karman. This initiative aims to provide utilities with real-time grid insights and significantly more processing power than traditional solutions, accelerating the adoption of AI-driven applications at scale. The partnership expands on earlier efforts to bring AI into smart meters and addresses the need to replace aging meters across the U.S.

title: AMD CEO Lisa Su Talks the Invisible Role of A.I. Chips in Oscar-Winning Films
summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su highlighted the significant role of A.I. chips in the production of Oscar-winning animated films at SXSW, noting how they drastically accelerate rendering times. She explained that AMD's hardware is used by partners like Pixar and Wētā FX, enabling sophisticated visual effects that were previously far more time-consuming. The executive VFX producer David Conley also emphasized the critical partnership with companies like AMD for the future of filmmaking, especially with the integration of real-time processing and A.I.

title: These Bad Habits Hold Investors Back From Peak Performance
summary: This article discusses how common investor bad habits, such as poorly timed buying and selling decisions driven by emotion and excessive activity, lead to underperformance compared to funds. It highlights the "behavior gap" and advises investors to focus on good habits and long-term goals rather than reacting to short-term market noise, political turbulence, or fear of missing out on high-performing stocks.

title: Dell Stock Has Tripled on AI Hopes. Is It a Buy or a Sell?
summary: Dell's stock has surged over 200% on optimism surrounding its AI server sales, but Morningstar analyst William Kerwin believes the potential benefit to Dell's bottom line is overhyped. Kerwin has a fair value estimate of $55 for Dell, considering the stock significantly overvalued at its current trading price of around $110. He points out that Dell's core businesses are commoditized and that AI servers represent a small portion of its overall sales, with high costs impacting margins.

title: Democratic ETF outpaces Republican peer on Big Tech bets
summary: An exchange-traded fund tracking Democratic lawmakers' stock trades has significantly outperformed a Republican-oriented fund since its launch last year, driven by strategic investments in megacap technology companies like Nvidia and Microsoft. The Democratic ETF, called NANC, has surged nearly 35%, benefiting from its tilt towards growth stocks, while the Republican ETF, KRUZ, which favors energy and value stocks, gained 18.1%. This performance gap highlights the differing investment strategies based on political affiliations and coincides with growing scrutiny over congressional stock trading.

title: NVIDIA Blackwell Platform Arrives to Power a New Era of Computing
summary: NVIDIA has announced the Blackwell platform, a new GPU architecture designed to power the next generation of AI and accelerated computing. The Blackwell platform promises to enable real-time generative AI on trillion-parameter models with significantly reduced cost and energy consumption compared to its predecessor. Major cloud providers and AI companies, including Amazon Web Services, Google, Meta, Microsoft, OpenAI, Oracle, Tesla, and xAI, are expected to adopt Blackwell.

title: Blackwell: Nvidia's GPU architecture to power new generation of trillion-parameter generative AI models
summary: Nvidia has unveiled its new Blackwell GPU architecture, designed to power trillion-parameter generative AI models with significantly reduced cost and power consumption compared to previous generations. This architecture introduces six transformative technologies, including a custom manufacturing process and enhanced networking capabilities, promising breakthroughs across various advanced computing domains. Blackwell will be available through cloud providers and third-party server manufacturers, enabling a new era of large-scale AI deployment.

title: The Next Big Theme: March 2024
summary: This article highlights key trends and developments across several transformative themes in March 2024, including advancements in humanoid robotics, continued growth in electric vehicle sales despite headwinds, breakthroughs in generative AI for audio and video, the scaling up of the global hydrogen industry, and AI-driven innovation in telemedicine and digital health. It also addresses the intensification of ransomware attacks and fortifying cybersecurity defenses. The article concludes by presenting performance and sales growth expectations for these themes, referencing corresponding ETFs.

title: NVIDIA, Huang Win Top Honors in Innovation, Engineering
summary: NVIDIA has been named the world's most innovative company by Fast Company magazine, recognizing its transformative work in putting AI to use across various industries. This accolade follows NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang's induction into the U.S. National Academy of Engineering for his contributions to high-powered graphics processing units and fueling the AI revolution. Leaders from Microsoft, Stanford University, and TSMC have praised Huang's visionary leadership and enduring impact on computing and AI.

title: ServiceNow injects more generative AI capabilities into its workflow platform
summary: ServiceNow announced its new Washington D.C. release, integrating enhanced generative AI capabilities across its workflow platform. Key improvements include Now Assist for IT Operations Management AIOps for quicker issue resolution, and updates to the Virtual Agent feature with dynamic translation. The company also introduced Impact AI Accelerators and partnered with Nvidia to simplify and accelerate AI deployment.

title: 3 ETFs That Could Turn Your Portfolio Into a Tech Powerhouse
summary: This article recommends three ETFs to create a diversified tech portfolio, moving beyond reliance on "Magnificent 7" mega-caps. It highlights the iShares U.S. Medical Devices ETF (IHI) for healthcare tech, the SPDR Portfolio S&P 600 Small Cap ETF (SPSM) for overlooked small-cap tech, and the iShares Global Tech ETF (IXN) for international exposure. The author emphasizes diversification to mitigate risks associated with concentrated tech holdings and inflated valuations.

title: Seeking a Growth ETF with Strong Returns? Check Out ILCG
summary: The iShares Morningstar Growth ETF (ILCG) is highlighted as a strong option for investors seeking growth, offering diversified exposure to 389 top U.S. large- and mid-cap growth stocks. The article emphasizes its long track record of strong returns, low expense ratio of 0.04%, and consistent double-digit annualized returns since its inception in 2004. Despite slightly underperforming the S&P 500 over three years, ILCG has outperformed it over five and ten-year periods, making it a reliable, cost-effective long-term investment.

title: What’s Inside Direxion’s Daily Semiconductor Bull and Bear 3x shares?
summary: This article describes the Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bull (SOXL) and Bear 3X Shares (SOXS) ETFs. It explains that these funds aim for daily investment results of 300%, or 300% of the inverse, of the performance of the NYSE Semiconductor Index, while cautioning that investment objectives are not guaranteed. The article also provides a link for more information about Direxion.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 03/24/2024
summary: This article highlights the top-performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week ending March 24, 2024, showcasing funds that gained significantly due to market movements in sectors like cannabis, housing, technology, and financials. It details the performance of the top 10 ETFs, providing context for their gains influenced by specific company news, economic indicators, and sector trends. Investors are cautioned about the inherent volatility of such leveraged products.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 03/24/2024
summary: This article details the top-performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week of March 24, 2024, highlighting their weekly returns and the underlying factors contributing to their performance. It covers various sectors, including cannabis, homebuilders, technology (Nvidia, META, FANG+), travel, banking, auto industry, and semiconductors, explaining the market drivers behind each ETF's gains. The article emphasizes the rapid movement characteristic of leveraged funds and the importance of due diligence.

title: Faith-Based ETF Aims to Compete With Secular Funds
summary: The Inspire 500 ETF (PTL) is launching with an expense ratio below 10 basis points, aiming to compete with secular funds on fees and performance. Robert Netzly, CEO of Inspire ETFs, believes investors shouldn't pay more for values-aligned investing and plans to offer more low-cost faith-based ETFs. This move challenges the traditional higher expense ratios seen in ESG and faith-based funds, potentially attracting a broader range of investors and advisors concerned with both values and costs.

title: 5 Best Momentum ETFs To Buy
summary: This article discusses momentum investing and lists five top momentum ETFs to consider buying, including the JPMorgan U.S. Momentum Factor ETF (JMOM). It highlights JMOM's structure, holdings, and performance, featuring NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) as a key holding. The article also touches on analyst insights and hedge fund sentiment regarding NVIDIA.

title: Best-Performing Stocks for the Quarter
summary: The article identifies the best-performing stocks in Q1, highlighting that while Nvidia is prominent due to AI, a broader range of companies including retailers, utilities, and packaged food companies also performed strongly. It categorizes top performers into overall, undervalued, and moat stocks, providing detailed analysis, Morningstar ratings, and fair value estimates for several key companies.

title: These Growth Funds Continued to Shine in Q1 2024
summary: Growth equity funds, especially those with exposure to AI-related stocks, continued their strong performance in Q1 2024, significantly outperforming value funds. While large-cap growth led the way, small- and mid-cap growth funds also fared well. International growth funds also saw gains, although they lagged behind their US counterparts.

title: NVIDIA’s Rapid Rise Fueled by Chip Giants TSMC and SK Hynix
summary: The article highlights that NVIDIA's significant market valuation and AI leadership are heavily reliant on its partnerships with semiconductor giants TSMC and SK Hynix. Despite their indispensable roles in manufacturing and developing critical components like advanced GPUs and HBM chips, TSMC and SK Hynix have significantly lower valuations compared to NVIDIA. The KraneShares Emerging Markets Consumer Technology ETF (KEMQ) is presented as a way for U.S. investors to gain exposure to these key enablers of AI technology.

title: Lowe’s looks to Nvidia and AI to improve its retail operations
summary: Lowe's is partnering with Nvidia to integrate AI across its retail operations, including digital businesses, supply chain, and in-store experiences. The collaboration aims to enhance customer interactions, empower associates, and optimize store management through technologies such as AI-powered visualizations, digital twins in Nvidia Omniverse, and computer vision for checkout efficiency. Lowe's has been leveraging AI for years and sees ripe applications for the technology in improving both business processes and customer satisfaction.

title: Alger Launches 2 Transparent Actively Managed ETFs
summary: Fred Alger Management has launched two new transparent actively managed ETFs: the Alger AI Enablers & Adopters ETF (ALAI) and the Alger Concentrated Equity ETF (CNEQ). ALAI focuses on companies involved with artificial intelligence, while CNEQ invests in large-cap growth companies, with a significant allocation to technology. These additions bring Alger's ETF family to five funds, building on their earlier entry into the ETF market in 2021.

title: Chip maker SkyWater cancels plans for Indiana plant—at least for now
summary: SkyWater Technology has canceled its plans for a $1.8 billion semiconductor R&D and fabrication facility in West Lafayette, Indiana, which was expected to create 750 jobs. The decision comes as the project was dependent on funding from the CHIPS and Science Act, which SkyWater did not receive. Despite this, Purdue University states SkyWater remains a valued partner for research opportunities, and the Indiana Economic Development Corp. committed incentives, though none were claimed.

title: How Eastman used its data and analytics experience to get started with generative AI
summary: Eastman, a global specialty materials company, leveraged its existing data and analytics expertise to begin implementing generative AI. Instead of a wholesale adoption, they focused on areas where their technical experience could enable deeper functionality and create a competitive advantage. The company is experimenting with generative AI tools for analyzing procurement contracts and sales call notes to extract previously difficult-to-unearth insights and identify cross-sell opportunities.

title: AMD Advances Open Source Initiative with MES Firmware Release for Radeon GPUs
summary: AMD announced its plan to open-source the Micro Engine Scheduler (MES) firmware for its Radeon GPUs, enhancing user control and accessibility. This move directly addresses lobbying efforts from companies like Tiny Corp and could facilitate the integration of third-party chiplets. The company also anticipates significant growth from its MI300s, projecting substantial revenue increases in the coming fiscal years.

title: Applied Materials Rethinks $4B Silicon Valley Project Amid Federal Funding Shortfall
summary: Applied Materials (NASDAQ: AMAT) is reconsidering or may abandon its planned $4 billion R&D facility in Silicon Valley due to a lack of federal funding. The Biden administration shifted focus away from financing semiconductor R&D facilities, impacting companies like Applied Materials that do not directly manufacture semiconductors. This decision jeopardizes the project and has led Applied Materials to consider relocating the facility out of California, despite strong financial performance in Q1 2024.

title: Nvidia drives top-performing ETFs in Q1 as clean energy woes continue
summary: Semiconductor ETFs, heavily weighted with Nvidia, were the top performers in Q1 2024, continuing their momentum from the previous year. Japanese equity ETFs also performed strongly due to a weak yen and rising Nikkei 225. Conversely, clean energy ETFs continued to struggle, facing challenges from high-interest rates and potential policy changes.

title: Cohesity completes late-stage $150M funding from IBM and Nvidia, expands IBM partnership
summary: Data management provider Cohesity Inc. has completed a $150 million Series F funding round with participation from IBM and Nvidia Corp., bringing its total raised to $955 million. The funding coincides with an expanded partnership with IBM, focusing on cyber resilience capabilities within hybrid cloud environments. This collaboration integrates Cohesity DataProtect into IBM Storage Defender to enhance data protection, monitoring, management, and recovery against cyberthreats.

title: Akamai expands cloud services with dedicated GPUs for media workloads
summary: Akamai Technologies Inc. has launched a new industry-optimized cloud service utilizing Nvidia RTX 4000 Ada generation GPUs, specifically designed for media workloads to enhance video encoding, decoding, and processing. This service aims to provide faster and more cost-effective solutions for media providers compared to standard virtual machines, leveraging Akamai's global edge network. Although optimized for media, the service is also capable of supporting other demanding tasks like generative AI training and inference.

title: Consider Active ETF RFFC's Long Term Returns
summary: The article highlights the ALPS Active Equity Opportunity ETF (RFFC) as a potentially appealing active ETF due to its flexible investment strategy across small, mid, and large-cap equities and REITs. RFFC employs a bottom-up approach, focusing on dividend-paying stocks and those with high or improving return on capital, and has significantly outperformed its peers over one and five years. With its active management and broad options, RFFC is presented as a worthwhile addition to core investment strategies, entering the second half of 2024.

title: Intel Builds World’s Largest Neuromorphic System to Enable More Sustainable AI
summary: Intel has developed Hala Point, the world's largest neuromorphic system, featuring 1.15 billion neurons and 1,152 Loihi 2 processors to address the efficiency and sustainability challenges of AI. Deployed at Sandia National Laboratories, this system aims to advance brain-inspired AI research and future real-time continuous learning for various applications. It achieves state-of-the-art computational efficiencies, rivaling and exceeding GPU and CPU architectures, and promises significant energy savings for future AI deployments.

title: Steering Clients Through Unstable Markets
summary: Paul Schatz, president of Heritage Capital, discussed with etf.com his strategies for navigating client portfolios through current market instability characterized by higher inflation and interest rates. He has reduced exposure to "hot" AI and tech stocks, finding new opportunities in "unloved" sectors like pharmaceuticals, chemicals, and staples. Schatz also shared his market outlook, anticipating a first-quarter peak followed by a minor pullback and potential for fresh highs over the summer, while also discussing his cautious approach to bonds.

title: 4 Undervalued Semiconductor Stocks
summary: Amidst the AI boom led by Nvidia, Morningstar analysts identify Infineon Technologies, STMicroelectronics, MediaTek, and Skyworks Solutions as undervalued semiconductor stocks. The article discusses the varying valuations between digital and analog chipmakers, highlighting the robust demand for AI-related semiconductors versus the mixed recovery in non-AI sectors like automotive, industrial, and personal electronics. It provides detailed reasons for each company's valuation and market position.

title: Cisco Reimagines Security for Data Centers and Clouds in Era of AI
summary: Cisco has unveiled Hypershield, a new security architecture designed to protect data centers and clouds in the era of AI. This innovation allows for security placement anywhere it's needed, providing AI-native security capabilities such as autonomous network segmentation and distributed exploit protection. Cisco Hypershield aims to tip the scales in favor of defenders against sophisticated AI-driven cyber threats, leveraging hardware acceleration and cloud-native technologies like eBPF.

title: How to Find Cloud Software Company Stocks to Trade and Invest
summary: This article provides guidance on investing in cloud computing stocks, detailing different types of cloud services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and key factors influencing stock performance like market demand and financial health. It offers investment strategies, including individual stocks (e.g., ServiceNow, Zoom) and ETFs (e.g., Global X Cloud Computing ETF), and lists major players like Amazon, Microsoft, and Adobe in the cloud software industry.

title: Nvidia and 3 More AI Stocks With New 'Outperform' Ratings
summary: The article highlights Nvidia and three other AI chip stocks—Microchip Technology, NXP Semiconductors, and Impinj—that have recently received "Outperform" ratings from Evercore ISI Group. It delves into their financial performance, market positions, analyst ratings, and future growth prospects, particularly in the context of the burgeoning AI and IoT markets. The analyst Mark Lipacis projects significant growth and margin expansion for these companies.

title: Akamai Launches Cloud Infrastructure and Services Powered by NVIDIA for Enhanced Video Processing
summary: Akamai Technologies has launched a new media-optimized cloud offering leveraging NVIDIA RTX 4000 Ada Generation GPUs to enhance video processing for the media and entertainment industry. This service aims to provide significantly faster encoding and transcoding compared to traditional CPU-based methods, offering scalable and reliable architectures for various demanding workflows. Beyond media, the GPUs are also applicable to generative AI/ML, data analysis, scientific computing, gaming, and high-performance computing.

title: NVIDIA to Acquire GPU Orchestration Software Provider Run:ai
summary: NVIDIA announced its definitive agreement to acquire Run:ai, a Kubernetes-based workload management and orchestration software provider. This acquisition aims to help customers optimize their AI computing resources across various environments, with NVIDIA continuing to invest in Run:ai's product roadmap and integrate its capabilities with NVIDIA's AI platforms. The acquisition will enable better GPU utilization and improved management for customers leveraging NVIDIA's accelerated computing platform.

title: Serve Robotics Hauls In $40M and Prepares to Put 2,000 Robots on Streets
summary: Serve Robotics has raised $40 million, bringing its total fundraising to $93 million since 2021, and plans to deploy 2,000 robots in new markets by the end of 2025. The company aims to expand operations in Los Angeles and enter new cities like Dallas, San Diego, and Vancouver, having formalized a partnership with Magna International for manufacturing. Serve highlights safety, labor savings, and adorability as key value propositions, with CEO Dr. Ali Kashani expressing confidence in scalability despite being in early pre-revenue stages.

title: Advanced Packaging Market Aims for Remarkable Growth, Targeting USD 79.9 Billion by 2033 at 8.4% CAGR
summary: The advanced packaging market is projected to grow from USD 35.7 billion in 2023 to USD 79.9 billion by 2033, achieving an 8.4% CAGR. This growth is driven by the increasing demand for miniaturization of devices and advanced packaging solutions for integrated circuits in various sectors, especially consumer electronics and automotive. The Asia Pacific region is anticipated to dominate the market due to its prominent semiconductor manufacturing industry.

title: An AI-focused ETF from a hedge fund veteran is gaining attention by soaring 60% over the past year
summary: Ivana Delevska's Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX), an AI-focused fund, has gained attention by soaring over 60% in the past year, significantly outperforming Cathie Wood's Ark Innovation ETF. Delevska, a hedge fund veteran, credits her early identification of the AI boom through extensive industrial sector research. The ETF, with $70 million in assets and about 26 holdings, has an almost 11% weighting in Nvidia, which contributed significantly to its outperformance.

title: AMD Q1 Earnings Preview: Analysts Bullish, But Warn Of Factors That 'Can Derail The Semiconductor Industry'
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) is set to release its Q1 earnings, with analysts expecting revenue of $5.46 billion and earnings of 61 cents per share. While many analysts are bullish due to strong AI MI300 and EPYC performance, they also highlight risks such as market share declines, intense competition, and macroeconomic uncertainties that could impact the semiconductor industry. AMD shares have performed well over the last year, but some analysts have adjusted price targets ahead of the report.

title: 4 Undervalued Semiconductor Stocks
summary: Despite the AI boom driving up semiconductor stock prices, Morningstar analysts have identified four undervalued semiconductor stocks: Infineon Technologies, STMicroelectronics, MediaTek, and Skyworks Solutions. While digital chipmakers are largely overvalued due to AI, analog/mixed-signal chip valuations are still below fair value estimates. These top picks are favored for their strong positions in automotive semis, leadership in silicon-carbide, expansion into new markets, and essential RF products for mobile devices.

title: Alphabet's First Dividend: What You Need to Know
summary: Alphabet has announced its first-ever quarterly dividend of $0.20 per share, payable on June 17 to shareholders of record as of June 10. While the initial dividend yield will be modest at approximately 0.5%, the company also authorized $70 billion in share repurchases. This move makes Alphabet one of the eight largest US companies by market capitalization to pay a quarterly dividend, alongside a significant share repurchase program.

title: Alphabet's First Dividend: What You Need to Know
summary: Alphabet announced its first-ever quarterly dividend of US$0.20 per share, following a similar move by Meta Platforms. This initial dividend will result in a modest yield of approximately 0.5% for Alphabet shares, significantly less than its historical buyback yield. While the new dividend rate represents only 12% of morningstar equity analyst's earnings per share forecast, leaving substantial room for future increases, share repurchases are expected to outweigh dividends in the near term.

title: AMD AI chip revenue forecast fails to impress, shares dive 7%
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares fell by about 7% after its forecast for AI chip sales for 2024, at roughly $4 billion, failed to meet Wall Street's expectations, despite being an increase from its prior estimate. The company faces stiff competition from Nvidia in the booming AI server semiconductor market and is experiencing weakness in traditional server, gaming, and embedded segments. AMD also reported first-quarter revenue that slightly beat estimates and provided a second-quarter revenue forecast in line with analyst expectations.

title: Consider This Award-Winning Disruptive Tech ETF
summary: The article highlights the Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX), an award-winning actively managed fund providing exposure to disruptive tech companies. FDTX recently won the Best New U.S. Equity ETF award at the 2024 etf.com Awards and targets companies in areas like big data, cybersecurity, and AI. The fund's top holdings include Nvidia, Salesforce, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing.

title: The 3 Best ETFs to Beat the S&P 500 Through 2030
summary: This article identifies three ETFs poised to outperform the S&P 500 by 2030, emphasizing their low expense ratios, strong historical performance, and alignment with emerging trends. The recommended ETFs are the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH), Invesco S&P 500 Quality ETF (SPHQ), and Invesco S&P MidCap Momentum ETF (XMMO), each offering unique advantages for investors seeking growth and stability.

title: NVIDIA and Alphabet’s Intrinsic Put Next-Gen Robotics Within Grasp
summary: NVIDIA and Alphabet's Intrinsic are collaborating to advance autonomous robotic manipulation through the integration of NVIDIA AI and Isaac platform technologies. They are showcasing their work at Automate in Chicago, focusing on robotic grasping and industrial scalability using foundation models enabled by NVIDIA Isaac Manipulator. This partnership aims to make complex robotics tasks more manageable, reduce development costs, and increase flexibility for end-users, demonstrating the impact of foundation models in industrial automation.

title: Can Palantir Stock be the Next NVIDIA, and Is It Worth Buying?
summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR) has seen its shares rise due to military contracts and expanding commercial AI demand, prompting comparisons to NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA). Despite strong Q1 earnings and increased revenue guidance, the stock's high valuation and potential headwinds like government spending cuts and tariffs raise concerns. Analysts suggest caution, with Palantir currently holding a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) compared to NVIDIA's Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).

title: 2 Great Large-Cap ETFs
summary: This article recommends two large-cap ETFs, T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF) and Vanguard High Dividend Yield ETF (VYM), as excellent portfolio building blocks. Russel Kinnel explains his rationale for owning both, highlighting TCAF's skilled manager David Giroux and VYM's value tilt for diversification.

title: Amdocs Accelerates Generative AI Performance and Lowers Costs with NVIDIA NIM | NVIDIA Technical Blog
summary: Amdocs is leveraging NVIDIA DGX Cloud and NVIDIA NIM to build and deploy enterprise-grade generative AI applications for telcos, specifically focusing on a billing Q&A system. By fine-tuning LLMs like Llama2 and Mixtral, Amdocs achieved a 20-30% accuracy improvement and a 60% reduction in token consumption. Deploying these models with NVIDIA NIM resulted in 4-6x faster inference and an 80% reduction in latency compared to managed LLM services, alongside significant cost reductions.

title: The market's attention is focused after Stanley Druckenmiller, a Wall Street billionaire investor, b..
summary: Billionaire investor Stanley Druckenmiller has drawn market attention by buying shares in Argentine companies while reducing his stake in Nvidia. Druckenmiller, known for his investment acumen, believes AI-related stocks like Nvidia are currently overvalued but will rise in the long run. He invested in Argentine stocks due to the country's recent capitalist reforms, which have led to a 26% increase in the Argentine ETF this year.

title: Roundhill Reaches $1B AUM Milestone
summary: Roundhill Investments, a themes-focused ETF issuer, announced it has reached $1 billion in assets under management, driven largely by the rapid growth of its A.I.-focused funds. This milestone comes shortly after Dave Mazza assumed the CEO role, with the firm emphasizing a strategy of quality over quantity in new fund launches and exploring diversification into new themes like weight loss medications. Key contributors to this growth include the Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF (MAGS) and the Roundhill Generative AI and Technology ETF (CHAT).

title: The 3 Best ETFs to Buy in May 2024
summary: Despite the "Sell in May and Go Away" adage, May presents an opportunity to invest in top ETFs at a discount due to market volatility. The article recommends three specific ETFs: iShares U.S. Medical Devices ETF (IHI) for healthcare innovation, iShares 0-5 Year High Yield Corporate Bond ETF (SHYG) for income generation in a high-rate environment, and iShares Global Tech ETF (IXN) for diversified global technology exposure beyond U.S. stocks. These choices offer long-term upside and diversification, addressing the concentration risks prevalent in major indices.

title: Should You Buy Nvidia Stock Before the AI Chipmaker Reports Earnings on May 22?
summary: Nvidia's stock has seen a significant surge due to demand for its GPUs driven by generative AI. With first-quarter earnings approaching on May 22nd, analysts have high expectations for the chipmaker. Investors are advised to be cautious due to the stock's current pricey valuation, despite its strong market position and growth potential in the AI economy.

title: Nvidia's next-generation GPU revealed: integrating eight HBM 4, TSMC N3 process
summary: Nvidia's upcoming R100 AI chip is expected to enter mass production in Q4 2025, utilizing TSMC's N3 process and integrating eight HBM4s. The company is also focusing on improving energy consumption alongside AI computing power in its next-generation chips. This aggressive roadmap reflects Nvidia's strategy to accelerate product release cycles to maintain market leadership against competitors like AMD.

title: CaLLM, Cool and Connected: Cerence Uses Generative AI to Transform the In-Car Experience
summary: Cerence is collaborating with NVIDIA to integrate generative AI into automotive experiences, launching the Cerence Automotive Large Language Model (CaLLM) as the foundation for its next-gen in-car computing platform. This platform, running on NVIDIA DRIVE, aims to redefine in-car interaction by enabling vehicles to comprehend and respond to human language with remarkable accuracy. Cerence leverages NVIDIA DGX Cloud on Microsoft Azure to train its AI models, aspiring to transform vehicles into intelligent companions and make driving a personalized, connected, and safer experience.

title: Autonomous Operations Could Threaten Intuitive Surgical's Moat in Robotic Surgery
summary: This article examines how the rise of autonomous operations and advanced AI in robotics could pose a significant threat to Intuitive Surgical's dominant position in the robotic surgery market despite its current strong moat. While Intuitive Surgical boasts impressive financials and a well-established product (da Vinci system), the author warns that newer, more technologically advanced competitors offering fully autonomous or deeply AI-assisted services could disrupt its long-term competitive advantage. The article advises that Intuitive Surgical must strategically adapt by focusing more on machine learning and software development to maintain its market leadership.

title: NVIDIA, Teradyne and Siemens Gather in the ‘City of Robotics’ to Discuss Autonomous Machines and AI
summary: Senior executives from NVIDIA, Siemens, and Teradyne Robotics gathered in Odense, Denmark, to celebrate the launch of Teradyne Robotics’ new headquarters and discuss the future of AI and autonomous machines. The discussion highlighted the transformative impact of generative AI, simulation, and digital twin technology on robotics, emphasizing collaboration as key to innovation in the rapidly growing global robotics market. Panelists discussed how physical AI is enhancing robot capabilities, improving navigation, and increasing safety across industries, particularly in manufacturing.

title: NetApp and Lenovo Offer Converged Infrastructure Solution Optimized for GenAI
summary: NetApp and Lenovo have introduced NetApp AIPod with Lenovo ThinkSystem servers for NVIDIA OVX, a converged infrastructure solution optimized for generative AI. This solution is designed to make AI more accessible and affordable for enterprises by enabling AI inference and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) using private data, addressing challenges of cost and integration complexity. The partnership aims to simplify AI deployment and maximize the value of enterprise data, with the solution becoming available by summer 2024.

title: SoundHound AI Spotlights Voice AI Innovation at 2024 Viva Technology Conference
summary: SoundHound AI will showcase its voice AI solutions, including Dynamic Drive Thru and SoundHound Chat AI Automotive, at the 2024 Viva Technology conference in Paris. The company will demonstrate its advanced AI-driven voice technology for restaurant ordering and in-vehicle experiences, including the global debut of Vehicle Intelligence. Pedram Faghfouri, Senior Director of Product, Automotive & IoT for SoundHound AI, will also speak about the company's voice AI use cases.

title: Every Company to Be an ‘Intelligence Manufacturer,’ Declares NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang at Dell Technologies World
summary: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang announced at Dell Technologies World that every company is fundamentally an "intelligence manufacturer," emphasizing generative AI's transformative potential. He highlighted updates to the Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA, including new hardware and software tools aimed at simplifying AI deployment and accelerating AI application development. Huang also likened data centers to "AI factories" that convert data and electricity into valuable digital intelligence.

title: Liqid composability tech aims to turn Dell servers into GPU powerhouses
summary: Liqid's composability technology aims to transform Dell servers into powerful AI model training systems by enabling a single Dell R760 server to access up to 30 NVIDIA L40S GPUs. This UltraStack configuration, developed with Dell and NVIDIA, promises significant reductions in capital and operational expenses while boosting AI performance, efficiency, and sustainability. Liqid's SmartStack technology also allows efficient allocation of GPU resources to multiple clients or modular server nodes, supporting various Dell PowerEdge systems.

title: Advanced Micro Devices to set up an R&D center in Taiwan, ministry says
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has applied to establish a research and development (R&D) center in Taiwan under the government's "A+ Industrial Innovative R&D Program." The investment is estimated at NT$5 billion (US$155 million), with the ministry setting conditions such as collaborating with Taiwanese IC designers and recruiting foreign talent. This move is part of Taiwan's broader strategy to become a global R&D hub, attracting major tech companies like ASML, Lam Research, Applied Materials, and Nvidia.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for First Quarter Fiscal 2025
summary: NVIDIA reported record quarterly revenue of $26.0 billion for Q1 FY25, a 262% increase year-over-year, driven by strong demand for AI in its Data Center segment. The company also announced a ten-for-one forward stock split and a 150% increase in its quarterly cash dividend. NVIDIA outlined significant platform advancements, including the Blackwell platform and Spectrum-X, positioning itself for continued growth in the AI market.

title: This Nvidia-heavy investing strategy has been outperforming the S&P 500
summary: An investing strategy focusing on an Nvidia-heavy ETF, the Invesco S&P 500 Momentum ETF (SPMO), has consistently outperformed the S&P 500. This low-cost index strategy tracks stocks with the highest risk-weighted returns within the S&P 500 and has performed well during a period of high inflation and strong leadership in the technology sector. The fund, which rebalances twice a year, holds 99 S&P 500 companies with high momentum scores.

title: Applied Materials scales AI chips as revenue stagnates
summary: Applied Materials is expanding its production of advanced AI-powering chips, particularly focusing on its gate-all-around transistor design, to counter stagnating revenue. The company aims to double revenue from this technology to $5 billion by 2025, despite U.S. sanctions potentially impacting its significant business in China. Applied Materials is also heavily investing in R&D to accelerate customer integration of its AI chip technology.

title: With the rise of Ethernet, Nvidia Infiniband is being encroached upon
summary: Nvidia's InfiniBand sales are being encroached upon by the growing demand for Ethernet in data centers, particularly from hyperscale enterprises and cloud builders. While InfiniBand still accounts for a large portion of Nvidia's network sales, the company is actively pushing its Spectrum X Ethernet products, expecting them to become a multi-billion dollar product line. Despite this internal cannibalization, Nvidia anticipates continued strong growth, with CEO Jensen Huang emphasizing the company's commitment to both InfiniBand and Ethernet as computing structures, alongside NVLink.

title: When You Should Consider Fundamentally Weighted ETFs
summary: This article discusses fundamentally weighted ETFs as a contrarian investment strategy, comparing them to market-cap-weighted value ETFs. It explains how these ETFs use metrics like operating cash flow, sales, and book value to size positions instead of market capitalization, thereby reflecting a company's economic footprint. The article highlights the "buy-low, sell-high" mechanism of fundamentally weighted ETFs and how it limits exposure to richly valued stocks while tilting towards cheaper, quality stocks.

title: The Newest Diabetes Stock That’s Running!
summary: The article discusses the significant spike in ReShape LifeSciences Inc. (NASDAQ: RSLS) stock, which surged 175% due to the allowance of its U.S. patent application for an intragastric device treating obesity. The author highlights how small-cap stocks like RSLS offer substantial profit opportunities for small-account traders, especially when news leads to volatility. It also notes a bullish trend in diabetes and weight loss stocks, citing Hims & Hers Health Inc. (NYSE: HIMS) as another example.

title: The NVIDIA Spider Web, Pt. 1: Applied Materials and Lam Research
summary: This article initiates "The NVIDIA Spider Web" series, focusing on semiconductor equipment providers Applied Materials (AMAT) and Lam Research (LRCX). It analyzes their individual financial performance, strategic positions, and growth drivers, as well as their crucial roles in supporting NVIDIA's expansion. The author highlights their attractiveness as investments due to their industry leadership, technological advancements, and strong correlation with NVIDIA's growth.

title: Why Investing Guru Jeremy Grantham’s New ETF Shuns Nvidia and Tesla Stock
summary: Legendary investor Jeremy Grantham's new ETF, GMO’s U.S. Quality ETF, is outperforming the stock market despite intentionally excluding high-momentum stocks like Nvidia and Tesla. The ETF instead focuses on defensive stocks such as Coca-Cola, alongside five of the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks. This strategy highlights a preference for quality and value over pure momentum plays.

title: Why Investing Guru Jeremy Grantham’s New ETF Shuns Nvidia and Tesla Stock
summary: Legendary value investor Jeremy Grantham's new GMO’s U.S. Quality ETF is outperforming the stock market despite shunning high-momentum stocks like Nvidia and Tesla. The ETF opts for more defensive stocks such as Coca-Cola, while still holding five of the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks. This strategy highlights a focus on quality and value over pure momentum plays.

title: TCW Transform 500 ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (VOTE)
summary: The TCW Transform 500 ETF (VOTE) has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" and an aggregate price target of $80.22 based on analyst ratings for its underlying holdings. The ETF's portfolio includes major companies like NVIDIA, Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon, with a significant portion of the portfolio composed of companies covered by 861 analyst ratings in the past year. These ratings and price targets are derived by MarketBeat from individual stock ratings within the ETF's holdings.

title: ‘Accelerate Everything,’ NVIDIA CEO Says Ahead of COMPUTEX
summary: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang, speaking ahead of COMPUTEX, emphasized a "major shift in computing" driven by AI and accelerated computing, detailing new semiconductors, software, and systems. Huang announced a one-year rhythm for new semiconductors, including the upcoming Rubin platform, and highlighted accelerated computing as sustainable, driving down costs. He also showcased strong industry adoption of NVIDIA technologies for AI factories, next-generation networking with Spectrum-X, and the transformation of generative AI development with NVIDIA NIM, alongside the integration of AI assistants into RTX AI PCs and the adoption of NVIDIA Robotics for industrial digitization.

title: Computer Industry Joins NVIDIA to Build AI Factories and Data Centers for the Next Industrial Revolution
summary: NVIDIA, in collaboration with top computer manufacturers, unveiled a new array of NVIDIA Blackwell architecture-powered systems, featuring Grace CPUs and NVIDIA networking, designed for building AI factories and data centers. These systems aim to drive the next wave of generative AI breakthroughs, with offerings ranging from single to multi-GPUs and various cooling technologies. Key industry players like ASRock Rack, ASUS, GIGABYTE, and Supermicro are among those delivering these advanced AI systems.

title: AMD-Nvidia ETFs in Focus Amid New Chip Introductions
summary: AMD and Nvidia are at the forefront of AI chip development, with both companies introducing new generations of AI processors to meet surging demand. AMD announced its MI325X accelerator and future MI350 and MI400 series, while Nvidia unveiled its Rubin platform, committing to annual chip releases. The intense competition and rapid advancements in AI semiconductor technology are drawing significant investor interest, with several ETFs offering exposure to both chipmakers.

title: AMD announces new AI chips amid intensifying competition with Nvidia, Intel
summary: AMD announced new AI chips at the Computex tech conference in Taipei, emphasizing AI as its top priority and a transformative force in the computing market. This move intensifies its competition with rivals Nvidia and Intel, both of whom are also rapidly introducing new AI-focused processors. AMD plans to release new AI chip technology annually, outlining a roadmap for Instinct accelerators and EPYC server processors through 2026.

title: Cisco Live Day 1 news brings together networking and security
summary: Cisco Live's 2024 event highlights the company's focus on integrating networking and security, especially in the context of AI's growing influence. Cisco announced innovations like Nexus HyperFabric with Nvidia and Nutanix, and advancements in its Security Cloud, aiming to simplify operations and enhance threat protection across its installed base. The company emphasizes a strategy of "melting security into the network" to leverage its heritage and address the evolving tech landscape.

title: 5 things you need to know before nvidia's stock split.
summary: This article details five crucial points regarding NVIDIA's upcoming 1:10 stock split, outlining what a stock split is, its impact on investors and options, historical stock performance post-split, and potential broader market effects. It explains how the split lowers the per-share price to attract more investors and could lead to increased liquidity, while also discussing the proportional adjustment of option contracts. The article also touches upon the "Nvidia Effect" on related stocks and the potential for NVIDIA's split to trigger a wave of similar actions in the US stock market among other high-priced S&P 500 constituents.

title: Nvidia surpasses Apple to become the second-largest public company in the US
summary: Nvidia's market capitalization has soared to $3.019 trillion, making it the second-largest publicly traded company in the US, surpassing Apple and trailing only Microsoft. The chipmaker has been a major beneficiary of the AI boom, with its stock up 147% this year. Nvidia also announced a 10-for-1 stock split to make shares more accessible to individual investors.

title: Nvidia overtakes Apple as No. 2 most valuable company
summary: Nvidia's valuation has surpassed $3 trillion, making it the world's second most valuable company, overtaking Apple. The AI chipmaker's stock surge is attributed to high demand for its processors among tech giants building AI capabilities. This shift highlights Nvidia's dominance in the current AI landscape, while Apple faces challenges with iPhone demand and AI integration.

title: Arista releases Etherlink platforms for AI networking focused on large clusters
summary: Arista Networks Inc. announced the launch of its Arista Etherlink AI platforms, designed to improve network performance for AI workloads by supporting large AI clusters with efficient topologies and advanced monitoring. The new platforms, including the 7060X6 AI Leaf, 7800R4 AI Spine, and 7700R4 AI Distributed Etherlink Switch, offer non-blocking throughput and scalability. These developments coincide with Arista's 10th anniversary as a publicly traded company and address the increasing demands of AI networking.

title: Mitigate Concentration Risk With Equal Weight ETF EQL
summary: The article discusses how the ALPS Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL) can help investors mitigate concentration risk in their portfolios, especially given the market's heavy reliance on a few large tech companies. EQL achieves this by equally weighting sectors rather than individual stocks, tracking the NYSE Select Sector Equal Weight Index. This strategy has led to significant returns and provides a defensive allocation option against various market uncertainties.

title: S&P 500: If you didn't bet on US stocks, 'then you look like a moron'
summary: Investors who followed traditional diversification strategies are significantly underperforming those who simply invested in the S&P 500, leading to frustration and psychological pressure. The U.S. stock index has outperformed diversified funds in 13 of the last 15 years, presenting a "bear market in diversification" fueled by Corporate America's consistent profits and the recent AI-driven equity rally. Financial experts acknowledge the long-term benefits of diversification for risk management, but admit it’s a difficult conversation with clients eager to chase high U.S. stock returns.

title: What Does Nvidia’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Nvidia's 10-for-1 stock split has been completed, making shares more accessible to individual investors, although it does not change the company's overall value or Morningstar's rating. The split occurred amidst Nvidia's significant AI-driven boom, with strong first-quarter earnings and a positive outlook for data center revenue. Analyst Brian Colello maintains a fair value estimate of $105 post-split and sees no immediate signs of AI demand slowing.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 06/09/2024
South Korean AI chip developers Rebellions and Sapeon to merge
summary: South Korean AI chip developers Rebellions Inc and Sapeon Korea Inc are merging to challenge global AI chip leader Nvidia. The consolidation, driven by Sapeon parent SK Telecom, aims to secure a strong position in the global AI semiconductor market within the next two to three years, with the merged company expected to launch by the end of the year. Rebellions will manage the merged entity, focusing on neural processing units (NPUs).

title: Trade the AI Trend With This Pair of Leveraged ETFs
summary: This article discusses how investors can capitalize on the booming artificial intelligence (AI) trend using leveraged ETFs. It highlights companies like Nvidia and Apple as key players in the AI space and introduces two Direxion leveraged ETFs, AIBU and AIBD, which offer 200% exposure to the Solactive US AI & Big Data Index for both upside and inverse plays. These ETFs provide traders with flexible options to express short-term convictions in the AI-big data sector.

title: SK Hynix patents-owned Mimir IP files complaint against Micron
summary: Mimir IP, a patent management company that acquired 1,500 chip-related patents from SK Hynix, has filed a complaint against Micron Technology Inc. for patent infringement. The lawsuit, also targeting Tesla, Dell, HP, and Lenovo, was filed in the US District Court for the Eastern District of Texas and the US International Trade Commission. This case highlights a growing trend of patent infringement disputes involving non-practicing entities (NPEs) in the competitive chip industry, with potential damages reaching $480 million.

title: Nvidia becomes world’s most valuable company amid AI boom
summary: Nvidia has become the world's most valuable company, surpassing Microsoft and Apple, with its market capitalization reaching $3.34 trillion. This surge is driven by high demand for its chips, which are central to the booming artificial intelligence industry. The company's exponential growth has also significantly increased CEO Jensen Huang's net worth and boosted the broader stock market.

title: Nvidia surpasses Microsoft to become the world’s most valuable company
summary: Nvidia Corp. has surpassed Microsoft Corp. to become the world's most valuable publicly traded company, reaching a market capitalization of $3.34 trillion. This milestone follows a surge in Nvidia's stock, driven by its dominance in the AI chip market, particularly with its GPUs essential for generative AI development. The company's exceptional growth contrasts with Microsoft and Apple, which have also benefited from AI but not to the same extent, solidifying Nvidia's unique position in the tech landscape.

title: Nvidia beats Microsoft to become world's most valuable company
summary: Nvidia has surpassed Microsoft to become the world's most valuable company with a market capitalization of $3.34tn, driven by its dominance in AI chips. Its stock has nearly doubled this year, reflecting explosive growth fueled by demand for its technology, though some analysts are cautious about future gains amid increasing competition.

title: Nvidia becomes world’s most valuable company, dethroning Microsoft
summary: Nvidia has dethroned Microsoft to become the world's most valuable company, with its market capitalization reaching $3.335 trillion. The chipmaker's stock price surged by 3.5 percent to $135.58, driven by the strong demand for its GPUs essential for artificial intelligence development. This milestone follows Nvidia's consistent rise, fueled by its dominant market share in AI chips and strategic investments by CEO Jensen Huang.

title: Not all semiconductor ETFs are the same. What investors need to know before betting on Nvidia and other chip stocks.
summary: This article highlights that semiconductor ETFs are not uniform and that varying weighting schemes can lead to different investor returns. It emphasizes the surging performance of chip ETFs, driven by Nvidia's stock, and offers investors insights into what to consider before investing in this sector.

title: Not all semiconductor ETFs are the same. What investors need to know before betting on Nvidia and other chip stocks.
summary: This article discusses the nuances of semiconductor ETFs, highlighting that not all are structured the same. It aims to inform investors about different weighting schemes that could impact returns, especially in the context of Nvidia's strong performance. The piece emphasizes the importance of understanding these differences before investing in chip stocks through ETFs.

title: 3 Vegan Stocks to Buy Now: June 2024
summary: The article highlights three promising investment opportunities in the growing vegan market for June 2024, citing the significant increase in plant-based food consumption and market projections. It examines Oatly (OTLY) and Laird Superfood (LSF) as individual stock picks, detailing their recent financial performance and analyst ratings. Additionally, it suggests the U.S. Vegan Climate ETF (VEGN) for diversified exposure to environmentally and animal-friendly companies.

title: IWF Is a Great Choice for Most, But I Like VUG ETF Better
summary: This article compares the iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) and the Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG), both popular growth stock ETFs. While IWF is suitable for most, the author prefers VUG due to its lower expense ratio and historically better returns. The article details their holdings, costs, and performance differences, recommending VUG for investors seeking enhanced growth exposure.

title: AOSL is a new GB200 supplier, leading beneficiaries of NVIDIA's process certification changes
summary: Alpha and Omega Semiconductor Ltd (AOSL) is expected to become a new supplier for NVIDIA's GB200 AI servers, benefiting from NVIDIA's accelerated supplier certification process. This change allows suppliers with existing HGX/DGX H100 certifications to more easily qualify for GB200, leading AOSL to potentially gain market share from competitors by the end of 2024. Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo highlights this as a significant investment focus for the second half of the year.

title: Nvidia ETFS NVD, NVDQ Jump as Chipmaker Weighs Down QQQ, USD, SHOC
summary: Nvidia's stock decline is impacting technology ETFs like QQQ, USD, and SHOC, with the chipmaker approaching a correction after a significant rally. However, inverse single-stock ETFs such as NVDQ and NVD are experiencing gains. The market is also closely watching upcoming inflation data for clues on potential Fed rate cuts.

title: DIGIASIA's Digi Tech Secures 5,120 NVIDIA H200 GPUs for AI Solutions
summary: DIGIASIA's subsidiary, Digi Tech, has secured an initial allocation of 5,120 NVIDIA H200 GPUs, with an option for an additional 10,240, to develop advanced AI enterprise solutions across fintech, telecom, and government sectors. This significant investment, valued over US$400m initially, will expand DIGIASIA's FaaS ecosystem and leverage NVIDIA's cutting-edge hardware, primarily operating out of the Dubai International Finance Centre. The move also extends NVIDIA's footprint in the MEA region following its recent designation as the world's most valuable company.

title: Intel Demonstrates First Fully Integrated Optical I/O Chiplet
summary: Intel Corporation's Integrated Photonics Solutions (IPS) Group has demonstrated the industry's first fully integrated bidirectional optical compute interconnect (OCI) chiplet, co-packaged with an Intel CPU and running live data. This OCI chiplet is designed to enhance AI infrastructure for data centers and high-performance computing by providing higher bandwidth, lower power consumption, and longer reach than traditional electrical or pluggable optical solutions. This breakthrough is expected to revolutionize high-speed data processing for AI, enabling greater scalability and more efficient resource utilization.

title: What Exactly Does NVIDIA Do, and Why Should You Care?
summary: This article provides an introduction to NVIDIA, highlighting its transformation from a GPU manufacturer to a systems company offering hardware and an ecosystem for developers. It delves into the factors driving NVIDIA's success, its significant impact on the customer experience market through AI, and key partnerships with companies like Cisco, SAP, and ServiceNow. The piece emphasizes NVIDIA's role in advancing AI for personalized and intelligent customer interactions across various sectors.

title: A Shakeup for Technology ETFs
summary: The Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) recently underwent a significant rebalance, swapping a large position in Apple for Nvidia. This rebalance highlights the complexities of index rules, particularly the RIC diversification test, and its impact on ETF holdings. The article discusses how passive indexing can sometimes appear active due to various exceptions and weighting methodologies, influencing ETF performance and investor perceptions.

title: What’s the Secret Sauce in this High-Income Fund?
