title: Wall Street’s hottest stock, Palantir, only employs 3,892 people
summary: Palantir (PLTR) has become the S&P 500's best-performing stock, reaching a $150 billion market capitalization despite having fewer than 4,000 employees. The company's shares surged after strong third-quarter earnings, driven by demand for its AI platform, and a planned move to Nasdaq. This remarkable valuation highlights a growing trend in AI-adjacent stocks where market cap per employee is a significant metric.

title: The Smartest Megacap Growth ETF to Buy With $500 Right Now
summary: This article recommends the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) as a top investment for those seeking exposure to leading growth stocks, especially in technology and other high-potential industries, for as little as $500. The ETF has significantly outperformed the S&P 500 in both the short and long term, boasting a low expense ratio and diversified holdings including Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft. It highlights the benefits of ETFs for easy diversification and access to market-leading companies without requiring extensive individual stock research.

title: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA)-Makes Big Beat on Earnings, But Stock May Need Santa to Propel to New All Time High
summary: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) reported strong third-quarter earnings, surpassing Wall Street expectations and easing concerns about AI-related valuations, with CEO Jensen Huang emphasizing a foundational transformation in computing. While the beat indicates strong momentum, the stock might remain range-bound in the near term between $190 and $212. A "Santa Claus rally" or positive macro data, alongside sustained demand and successful platform rollouts, could propel the stock to new highs.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Third Quarter Fiscal 2025
summary: NVIDIA reported record quarterly revenue of $35.1 billion for the third quarter of fiscal 2025, a 94% increase year-over-year, driven by strong growth in Data Center revenue which reached $30.8 billion. The company highlighted the ongoing impact of AI across industries and revised its outlook for the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025 with expected revenue of $37.5 billion.

title: VOOG vs. SCHG: Which Is the Better Growth Stock ETF?
summary: This article compares two popular growth ETFs, the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOOG) and the Schwab U.S. Large Cap Growth ETF (SCHG). While both are strong performers with similar portfolios of top growth stocks like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, SCHG consistently outperforms VOOG in 3, 5, and 10-year returns and boasts a significantly lower expense ratio. The analysis concludes that SCHG is the better choice due to its superior performance and lower costs.

title: Under the Hood of Fidelity’s Blue Chip Growth ETF
summary: The Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG) is an actively managed U.S. equity growth strategy that has significantly outperformed its benchmark, the Russel 1000 Growth index. The fund employs bottom-up fundamental analysis to identify blue chip companies with sustainable business models, high returns on equity, and strong earnings growth, including both mega-cap and emerging companies. FBCG's active management and investment strategy have led to attractive returns for investors.

title: Under the Hood of Fidelity’s Blue Chip Growth
summary: The Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG) is an active U.S. equity growth strategy with a large-cap bias that has outperformed its benchmark, the Russel 1000 Growth index. The fund focuses on identifying blue chip companies with sustainable business models, high returns on equity, and strong revenue and earnings growth through bottom-up fundamental analysis. FBCG's portfolio includes both mega-cap companies and smaller emerging growers, aiming for consistent +10% annual EPS growth.

title: The 2025 Investment Outlook for Financial Advisors
summary: Morningstar's 2025 Investment Outlook for Financial Advisors discusses key investment themes for the coming year, including opportunities outside the US due to high valuations in American stocks, strategies for generating returns in a falling rate environment, and considerations for investing in private assets. The outlook also details the evolving impact of AI on both investment portfolios and financial advisor practices. It aims to help advisors navigate challenges and opportunities for their clients in 2025.

title: Wells Fargo Sticks to Their Buy Rating for CoreWeave (CRWV)
summary: Wells Fargo analyst Michael Turrin maintained a Buy rating for CoreWeave (CRWV) with a price target of $150.00, despite negative corporate insider sentiment surrounding the stock. CoreWeave reported quarterly revenue of $1.36 billion and a GAAP net loss of $110.12 million for the quarter ending September 30. Other analysts have varying ratings, including a Buy from Compass Point and a Hold from TR | OpenAI – 4o.

title: BSTZ: Technology Growth Fund Yields 12% And (Still) Trades At Wide Discount To NAV
summary: The article recommends investing in BlackRock Science and Technology Term Trust (BSTZ) for high-yield income, highlighting its top holdings in NVIDIA and other growth tech stocks. BSTZ offers a 12.3% yield at a -9.8% discount to NAV, with a liquidation event scheduled for 2031. Despite macroeconomic risks, the fund's strategy including private investments and covered calls, along with its high distribution rate, makes it a Buy.

title: Palantir and Nvidia rank high on list of companies with rising sales estimates
summary: This article identifies 15 stocks, including Palantir and Nvidia, whose sales estimates have increased the most during the current earnings season. It highlights that despite warnings about high stock valuations, the market, exemplified by the S&P 500 and Nvidia, continues to rise. The analysis also notes that the forward P/E ratio for the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust is currently higher than its five and ten-year averages.

title: Palantir and Nvidia rank high on list of companies with rising sales estimates
summary: This article highlights 15 stocks, including Palantir and Nvidia, that have seen the largest increases in sales estimates during the current earnings season. Despite warnings about high stock valuations, exemplified by the S&P 500 and Nvidia, these companies demonstrate strong upward revisions in future revenue projections. The article notes the current forward P/E ratio of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust is significantly higher than its historical averages.

title: Amazon.com (AMZN) Invests $4B in Anthropic: A Strategic Move to Challenge NVIDIA in AI
summary: Amazon.com (AMZN) has invested $4 billion in AI startup Anthropic, aiming to challenge NVIDIA's dominance in the AI chip market. This strategic move is intended to make Amazon's Neuron SDK more appealing by having Anthropic teams work directly with AWS personnel to facilitate customer transitions from NVIDIA. The article also touches upon the broader adoption of AI in manufacturing and its observed benefits like increased efficiency and productivity.

title: Vertiv Holdings' Philip O' Doherty sells $40.1 million in stock
summary: Philip O' Doherty, Managing Director of E+I at Vertiv Holdings Co, sold 285,965 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $40.1 million. Despite the sale, O'Doherty retains a significant indirect stake in the company. The company has also shown strong financial growth and received positive analyst ratings, with an updated five-year plan anticipating $14.4 billion in sales by 2029 and a 25% margin target.

title: Three Reasons to Avoid Corning and One Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article analyzes why investors should be cautious with Corning (GLW) despite its recent stock performance. The author highlights three main reasons: sluggish long-term revenue growth, stalled EPS growth, and low return on invested capital. Instead, the article recommends considering ServiceNow and other "Strong Momentum Stocks" for the upcoming bull run.

title: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Faces Competition as Chinese Chips from Zhaoxin Close the Gap in AI Race
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is facing increasing competition in the AI chip market from Chinese manufacturers like Zhaoxin, despite US export restrictions. While Chinese chips are improving, they still lag behind American technology. The article notes that AMD ranks 6th on a list of AI stocks, but suggests other AI stocks may offer higher returns.

title: Top KingWin (WAI) Stock Price, News & Analysis
summary: Top KingWin (WAI) is a financial services company based in China, specializing in capital market education, support, and advisory services. The stock currently has a "Sell" consensus rating from analysts, a low MarketRank™ score, and does not pay a dividend. Recent news includes a 1-for-25 reverse share split in September 2025 and an earlier Nasdaq delisting notice due to stock price non-compliance.

title: nVent collaborates with Nvidia on AI-ready liquid cooling solutions
summary: nVent announced its collaboration with Nvidia to deploy liquid cooling solutions for hyperscale and high-performance computing data centers, specifically for the Nvidia GB200 NVL72 and next-generation platforms. This partnership aims to enhance performance and energy efficiency using nVent's customized cooling technology, which includes coolant distribution units, liquid-to-air heat exchangers, and manifold products. The collaboration also extends to delivering solutions for the Open Compute Project (OCP) community to address demand and improve reliability in data centers.

title: European AI infra company Nebius nabs $700M from Nvidia, Accel, others
summary: Nebius, a European AI infrastructure company formerly known as Yandex N.V., has raised $700 million from investors including Nvidia, Accel, and Orbis, to fund its U.S. expansion. The company plans to use the capital to build out its data center footprint, employing a hybrid approach with co-location facilities and greenfield sites. This funding, combined with existing capital, brings Nebius's total available funds to build infrastructure to around $3 billion, with further capital raises anticipated, and the company projects an annualized run rate of $750 million to $1 billion by the end of 2025.

title: Should iShares S&P 500 Growth ETF (IVW) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: The iShares S&P 500 Growth ETF (IVW) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Growth segment of the US equity market, with significant holdings in Information Technology, and top positions in Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. With an expense ratio of 0.18% and a "Buy" rating from Zacks, it presents a compelling option for investors seeking growth, despite the inherent volatility of growth stocks. The fund has shown strong performance, up about 34.84% year-to-date and 40% over the last year.

title: ZJK Industrial up 172% on NVIDIA cooling components deal, enhanced collaboration
summary: ZJK Industrial's shares surged 172% after announcing an expanded collaboration with NVIDIA Corp to provide liquid cooling systems for NVIDIA's AI infrastructure. ZJK, which previously supplied metal fasteners to NVIDIA, is creating a specialized team for this new endeavor. The Chinese company, which recently completed its IPO, also counts BYD, DJI, GoerTek, Samsung, and Garmin among its clients.

title: Why Momentum Stocks & ETFs Are Crushing the Market
summary: Momentum stocks and ETFs are significantly outperforming the broader market this year, with factor investing in momentum demonstrating strong returns over the past decade. The Invesco S&P 500 Momentum ETF (SPMO) and iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (MTUM) have seen substantial gains due to the continued investor interest in high-performing stocks. Companies like Amazon, NVIDIA, Meta Platforms, Berkshire Hathaway, and Eli Lilly are key holdings driving the performance of these momentum-focused ETFs.

title: ZJK Stock Skyrockets Following NVIDIA Partnership News
summary: ZJK Industrial’s stock surged over 170% after announcing a collaboration with NVIDIA to produce liquid cooling components for next-generation AI servers. This partnership positions ZJK as a key supplier for NVIDIA, highlighting its engineering capabilities and commitment to innovation. However, the stock’s limited float, lack of analyst coverage, and speculative valuation warrant caution for investors despite the positive development.

title: Why Penguin Solutions Could Be the AI Sleeper Stock of 2025
summary: The article discusses Penguin Solutions (NASDAQ: PENG), formerly SMART Global Holdings, as a potential AI sleeper stock due to its focus on AI and high-performance computing (HPC) and its low forward P/E multiple. It details Penguin's business segments, particularly its Advanced Computing segment and a recent collaboration with Dell, while acknowledging recent revenue declines and the cyclical nature of the semiconductor industry. The author suggests that as the AI revolution progresses, Penguin's "nice-to-have" offerings could become essentials, making it a company to watch.

title: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) Selects ZJK Industrial for Advanced Liquid Cooling Manifold Project
summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) has chosen China-based ZJK Industrial for an advanced liquid cooling manifold project, reinforcing ZJK's status as an approved vendor for NVIDIA's essential liquid cooling systems. This announcement comes amid new US government restrictions targeting the chip industry in China, aimed at limiting Chinese access to advanced AI-critical chips for military applications. The article also notes NVIDIA's prominent ranking among AI news and ratings that Wall Street is watching, despite the recent geopolitical developments.

title: Nvidia Could See Competition From Magnificent Seven Peer
summary: Nvidia, a leading AI chipmaker, could face significant competition from Amazon, another Magnificent Seven peer, which is developing its own AI chip called "Trainium." This new chip, expected in 2025, aims to challenge Nvidia's market dominance in AI model training. The article discusses how Amazon's entry could provide a viable alternative to Nvidia's offerings and its potential impact on the chip market.

title: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Challenges NVIDIA with Faster, Cheaper AI Chip Alternatives
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is emerging as a credible alternative to NVIDIA in the AI chip market, offering faster speeds at lower prices, according to industry analysts. This development comes amid new U.S. government curbs on chip exports to China, aiming to limit Chinese access to advanced AI technology. While AMD shows promise, the article suggests other AI stocks might offer higher returns in a shorter timeframe.

title: AI's growth is just getting started, BlackRock's thematic ETF head says
summary: BlackRock's U.S. head of thematic and active ETFs, Jay Jacobs, believes the AI boom is still in its early stages, highlighting infrastructure and cybersecurity as key areas for growth in 2025. He emphasizes that the theme extends beyond megacap tech to include various semiconductor, data center, and software companies. Jacobs also points out the need for physical infrastructure, including energy, materials, and real estate, to support AI's expansion.

title: Pelican-2 & 36 SuperDoves Arrived in Vandenberg, California For Launch
summary: Planet Labs PBC announced that its new high-resolution satellite, Pelican-2, and 36 SuperDoves have arrived at Vandenberg Space Force Base for a launch in early 2025. Pelican-2 is equipped with the NVIDIA Jetson platform for edge AI and NASA CSP Satellite-to-Satellite Communications, aiming to accelerate data delivery. These satellites will expand Planet's Earth observation capabilities.

title: CoreWeave and Dell Technologies Extend Relationship to Deliver AI at Scale
summary: Dell Technologies and CoreWeave are expanding their strategic relationship to deliver AI at scale, with CoreWeave being the first to ship Dell PowerEdge XE9712 server racks with NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 to support its Cloud Services Platform. This collaboration integrates Dell's infrastructure and services with NVIDIA's accelerated computing, networking, and AI software to meet the growing demand for high-performance cloud environments for generative AI developments. CoreWeave will leverage Dell's fully integrated and validated rack systems and professional services to accelerate implementation and enhance its specialized AI cloud services platform.

title: Monolithic Power Systems: Big Growth At A Reasonable Price (NASDAQ:MPWR)
summary: This article advocates for a risk-neutral portfolio strategy comprising short-term U.S. Treasuries, gold, and low-risk dividend equities, suitable for wealth preservation. Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) is presented as a growth opportunity with an estimated 15% CAGR over five years, driven by its robust fabless model and strong market presence, despite potential risks from its reliance on TSMC and Nvidia. A valuation model shows a 7% margin of safety and a December 2029 EV estimate of $54.34B for MPWR, positioning it as a viable addition to growth-oriented portfolios.

title: Silver Lake Sells $12.9 Million Dell Technologies Stake Amid 83% Stock Surge
summary: Silver Lake, a major shareholder in Dell Technologies, recently sold $12.9 million worth of Dell's Class C Common Stock following an 83% stock surge over the past year. Despite the sale, Silver Lake maintains a significant indirect holding in Dell. The transaction occurred as Dell reported strong third-quarter revenue driven by AI-based server demand, with earnings and cash dividends increasing.

title: Should You Invest in the Fidelity MSCI Information Technology Index ETF (FTEC)?
summary: This article evaluates the Fidelity MSCI Information Technology Index ETF (FTEC) as an investment option for broad exposure to the Technology - Broad sector. It highlights FTEC's passive management, low expense ratio (0.08%), and strong year-to-date performance (up 31.10%). The piece also details its top holdings, risk profile, and compares it with alternative technology ETFs like XLK and VGT, ultimately giving FTEC a "Strong Buy" Zacks ETF Rank.

title: Nvidia Steps Up Hiring in China to Focus on AI-Driven Cars
summary: Nvidia Corp. has expanded its workforce in China significantly this year, adding hundreds of staff to bolster research capabilities, particularly in autonomous driving technologies. The company increased its total headcount in China from approximately 3,000 to 4,000, with a key focus on adding about 200 researchers in Beijing for self-driving initiatives. This move underscores Nvidia's commitment to developing AI-driven car technology within the Chinese market.

title: Broadcom ETFs Surge on Strong AI Demand
summary: Broadcom's shares surged by 20% following strong earnings and optimistic projections for its AI business, pushing its market cap past $1 trillion. This surge significantly boosted ETFs with large Broadcom holdings, such as the Defiance Daily Target 2X Long AVGO ETF (AVGX) and the iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX). The demand for Broadcom's custom AI chips, favored by major tech companies like Alphabet, Meta, and Apple, is seen as a key driver for its continued growth.

title: Broadcom's AI Chip Leadership Puts Pressure on Nvidia and Marvell, Analysts Say
summary: Broadcom's stock surged after reporting strong Q4 adjusted EPS results and raising its dividend, driven by its leadership in AI custom Application-Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs). Analysts upgraded Broadcom's price targets, highlighting its expanding AI opportunities and advanced 3nm silicon technology, which puts it ahead of competitors like Nvidia and Marvell. The company anticipates significant growth in its AI revenues, expecting to reach $30 billion by calendar 2027 based on strong demand from hyperscalers.

title: A decade ago, she took over a struggling chipmaker—now she's worth $1 billion: 'Everything takes time'
summary: Lisa Su took over Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) a decade ago when the company was struggling, with its stock at $3 per share and significant staff cuts. Under her leadership, AMD's market cap has grown to over $205 billion and her net worth has reached $1.3 billion. Su, named Time's CEO of the Year for 2024, attributes her success to a long-term strategy focused on high-quality products, customer trust, and simplified operations, emphasizing that "everything takes time."

title: Microchip Expands FPGA Lineup for Medical Imaging, Smart Robotics
summary: Microchip Technology Inc. has introduced new PolarFire FPGA and SoC solution stacks designed for smart robotics and medical imaging applications. These solutions aim to accelerate product development and simplify processes for power and thermally constrained intelligent edge devices, offering features like AI-assisted computer vision, diverse sensor interfaces, and integrated hardware for high-speed Ethernet. The stacks leverage Microchip's power-efficient and secure FPGAs, providing customizable hardware and software for secure and functionally safe industrial automation and portable medical imaging.

title: Why is Palo Alto Networks stock price so ‘low’ today? Don’t worry. It just split
summary: Palo Alto Networks (Nasdaq: PANW) completed a 2-for-1 stock split, causing its share price to appear to drop significantly. The article explains that this is an artificial adjustment and the company's overall market capitalization remains stable. Stock splits are often done to make shares more accessible to a wider range of investors without affecting the company's fundamental value.

title: Mag 7 ETFs Look Unstoppable Heading Into 2025
summary: The "Magnificent Seven" stocks have significantly driven the S&P 500 rally by leveraging the AI boom and benefiting from reduced interest rates. With their market capitalization exceeding $18 trillion and comprising 31% of the S&P 500, these companies are projected for continued growth in 2025 due to strong fundamentals and potential defensive play in market uncertainty. Investors can gain exposure through ETFs like Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF (MAGS) and others focusing on mega-cap growth and top S&P 500 companies.

title: Palantir’s high valuation paints a stark picture of the S&P 500’s priciest picks
summary: This article examines the high valuation of Palantir and other expensive stocks in the S&P 500. It suggests that a closer look at these companies' expected financial performance can reveal significant differences. Understanding these differences can help investors make informed decisions and potentially avoid losses.

title: 3 Contrarian Investments for 2025
summary: This article outlines three contrarian investment ideas for 2025 based on Morningstar's outlook, suggesting opportunities beyond richly priced US stocks. It recommends looking globally, especially towards Europe and emerging markets like China, and considering smaller US companies and traditional industries as alternatives to large growth and tech. Additionally, the article advises not neglecting bonds, particularly longer-maturity bonds, given forecasts of falling interest rates.

title: Nvidia's Blackwell chip could push the company into a new stratosphere as the AI revolution continues
summary: Nvidia's Blackwell chip is poised to further propel the company's growth in the AI sector, with analysts calling it a "beast" and an "exponential leap forward." Despite potential future competition in inference workloads, Blackwell is expected to dominate the AI training market and contribute significantly to Nvidia's record sales, even as demand continues to outstrip supply for several quarters.

title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Leads AI Investment in 2024, Purchasing 485,000 Nvidia GPUs to Power AI Infrastructure
summary: Microsoft Corporation is leading AI investment in 2024 by acquiring 485,000 Nvidia Hopper GPUs, significantly outpacing rivals. This massive investment powers Microsoft's AI infrastructure, including its Azure cloud platform and AI services, reflecting the increasing demand for specialized hardware in the AI sector. The article also highlights the resource-intensive nature of AI, requiring substantial energy and materials, and discusses the broader implications for infrastructure and climate.

title: Rigetti Computing Surges 692% in a Month: Is There More Room to Jump?
summary: Rigetti Computing (RGTI) shares have surged by 691.9% in the past month, outperforming peers due to expanding clientele and advancements in quantum computing, including key partnerships and technological developments like the Novera QPU and Ankaa-2 system. Despite this growth, the company faces challenges such as declining revenues and gross margins due to macroeconomic uncertainties and intense competition, leading to a "Hold" rating from Zacks.

title: Is Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) Using Too Much Debt?
summary: This article analyzes Microchip Technology's debt situation, noting its net debt of US$6.14b as of September 2024. While the company has substantial liabilities, its market capitalization of US$30.1b suggests it could manage potential issues. The analysis concludes that while debt makes MCHP somewhat risky, its ability to convert EBIT to free cash flow is a positive factor.

title: Broadcom CEO Hock Tan claims he has no interest in buying Intel
summary: Broadcom CEO Hock Tan has stated he is not interested in acquiring Intel Corp., focusing instead on making Broadcom an AI powerhouse. Tan cited his company's efforts to increase market share in the AI chip sector and his reluctance to pursue hostile takeovers after a past failed attempt with Qualcomm. This news comes as Broadcom's market capitalization has soared due to AI enthusiasm, while Intel's value has significantly declined.

title: Apple approaches $4 trillion valuation as investors bet on AI momentum
summary: Apple is nearing a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by investor enthusiasm for its AI enhancements, which are expected to boost iPhone sales. The company has outpaced Nvidia and Microsoft in this race, with a roughly 16% share jump since November adding about $500 billion to its market cap. Analysts anticipate a rebound in iPhone revenue in 2025 as Apple integrates generative AI technology across its devices.

title: Ulta’s generative AI hair try-on tool helps shoppers experiment with styles
summary: Ulta Beauty has launched a new generative AI-powered hair try-on tool called GLAMlab Hair Try-On, available on its website and mobile app. This tool, utilizing Nvidia's advanced AI technology, allows shoppers to virtually experiment with different hair colors and styles before making a purchase. Ulta reports strong engagement with the tool and notes that users are more likely to buy products, contributing to the retailer's overall digital growth and sales.

title: Royal Turf Club of Thailand Launches RTC AI Data Centre for Global Projects
summary: The Royal Turf Club of Thailand has announced the establishment of the RTC AI Data Centre in partnership with Power-All Network Co., Ltd. (a FOXCONN subsidiary) to support the "RTC x CTG Prop Trade" project, which aims to train up to 300 million individual accounts in high-skill careers. Additionally, the Royal Turf Club of Thailand, in consortium with Greenpro Capital Corp. (NASDAQ: GRNQ) and Capital Trust Group Ltd. (CTG), is driving the Thailand Entertainment Complex project, valued at US$6 billion. CTG issued a US$6 billion Digital Bond to invest in this complex, accepting only USD Telegraphic Transfer (USTT) Stablecoin, with the Royal Turf Club ensuring transparency through co-signing and real-time public access to the account balance.

title: MicroStrategy Wants to Massively Dilute Shareholders to Fund Its Bitcoin Dreams
summary: MicroStrategy is seeking shareholder approval to significantly increase its outstanding shares to fund further Bitcoin purchases, a move that would massively dilute existing investors. CEO Michael Saylor aims to transform the company into a "Bitcoin Treasury Company" despite a declining underlying business and recent stock volatility. While MSTR has outpaced Bitcoin's gains this year, the proposed dilution and potential Bitcoin correction pose significant risks to shareholders.

title: Investing pros think these stock-market losers are set to rebound in 2025
summary: Investing professionals anticipate a rebound in certain stock-market losers in 2025, with strategists at Evercore ISI specifically pointing to Nike's stock. The article also touches upon related financial topics like technical analysis for Nvidia, MicroStrategy's cash burn, and student loan tips for the upcoming year. It mentions the common year-end practice of tax-loss harvesting.

title: Investing pros think these stock-market losers are set to rebound in 2025
summary: Investing professionals are predicting a rebound for certain stock-market losers in 2025. MarketWatch highlights strategists from Evercore ISI who believe Nike's stock, after a significant 2024 decline, is poised for recovery. The article also touches on other financial topics for the upcoming year including technical analysis for Nvidia and tips for student loan holders.

title: Gaxos.ai Inc. (GXAI) Launches Meshy 4 Update to Revolutionize 3D Modeling Workflows for Game Developers
summary: Gaxos.ai Inc. (GXAI) has released Meshy 4, an update to its Gaxos Labs platform, designed to enhance 3D modeling for game developers using AI-driven generative geometry. This update allows for dynamic mesh topology, polycount management, and improved geometry quality, aiming to accelerate asset creation. The generative AI market is projected to reach $1.3 trillion by 2032, driven by demand for AI products and infrastructure, with significant impact on various industries including gaming.

title: Nvidia Supplier Ibiden Weighs Faster Expansion for AI Demand
summary: Ibiden Co., a key supplier of chip package substrates for Nvidia, is considering accelerating its production capacity expansion due to robust demand from the AI sector. CEO Koji Kawashima indicated that current expansion plans might not be sufficient to meet customer needs, prompting discussions for further investment. This expansion comes as Ibiden's shares rose and despite past reliance on Intel, the company is seeing increased demand driven by AI chips used by Nvidia and potentially other chipmakers.

title: Returns On Capital Signal Tricky Times Ahead For Intchains Group (NASDAQ:ICG)
summary: Intchains Group (NASDAQ:ICG) shows a declining Return on Capital Employed (ROCE), currently at 3.8% which is below the Semiconductor industry average. While the company's revenue and assets are growing, suggesting reinvestment for future growth, the ROCE has fallen significantly from 17% four years ago. The stock has also decreased by 25% over the last year, indicating potential opportunities for astute investors despite the challenging ROCE trend.

title: Jim Cramer Says ‘Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Is A Buy, And I Think It Will Continue To Perform Well’
summary: Jim Cramer has endorsed Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) as a strong buy, citing its performance and strategic positioning in AI. The article highlights Amazon's role across the AI stack, its partnership with Anthropic, and discusses Cramer's investment tips for 2025 including avoiding "pigs get slaughtered" mentality, holding through tough markets, and staging buys.

title: Corsair Gaming Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial Results
summary: Corsair Gaming announced its financial results for Q4 and full year 2024, reporting solid Q4 revenue and adjusted EBITDA driven by strong growth in the Gamer and Creator Peripherals segment. The company provided its 2025 outlook, anticipating revenue between $1.4 billion and $1.6 billion and adjusted EBITDA of $80 million to $100 million, expecting growth due to new high-performance GPU cards and strategic acquisitions like Fanatec.

title: Experts Think a Broadcom Stock Split Is Coming in 2025. Should You Buy AVGO Now?
summary: Experts anticipate another Broadcom (AVGO) stock split in 2025 following a significant rally in 2024 driven by its AI and semiconductor performance. Broadcom's strong fundamentals, including impressive revenue and earnings growth, high free cash flow, and strategic advancements in AI and edge computing, reinforce its appeal. Analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating for AVGO stock, signaling confidence in its continued growth trajectory.

title: Sustainable and Successful: 3 Climate ETFs Beating the Market
summary: This article highlights three climate-focused ETFs—iShares Climate Conscious & Transition MSCI USA ETF (USCL), Xtrackers MSCI USA Climate Action Equity ETF (USCA), and SPDR MSCI USA Climate Paris Aligned ETF (NZUS)—that have outperformed the S&P 500. These ETFs offer investors ways to support companies mitigating climate change while also achieving strong financial returns. The article details each ETF's approach to sustainable investing, their expense ratios, asset bases, and recent performance.

title: Schwab Trading Activity Index™: December Score Edges Higher for Third Consecutive Month
summary: The Schwab Trading Activity Index™ (STAX) increased to 51.16 in December, marking its third consecutive monthly rise. Schwab clients net bought equities, adding exposure in Health Care and Energy sectors, while selling Information Technology and Communication Services. The report highlights market volatility, key economic data releases, and popular stocks bought and sold by Schwab clients throughout December and the entirety of 2024.

title: Intel Extends Leadership in AI PCs and Edge Computing at CES 2025
summary: At CES 2025, Intel unveiled new Intel Core Ultra (Series 2) processors, including the 200V series with Intel vPro for businesses, and 200HX and H series for creators and gamers, all featuring cutting-edge AI enhancements and performance improvements. Intel also introduced a new suite of processors for edge computing, showcasing significant performance gains in AI workloads compared to previous generations and competitors. The availability of these new systems is set to begin in January and February 2025, with further releases planned for the first half of the year.

title: Best and worst performing ETFs of 2024
summary: The article reviews the best and worst-performing ETFs of 2024, highlighting that trends from the previous year, particularly the strong performance of tech and blockchain ETFs, largely continued. Tech ETFs benefited from outperforming earnings and the rise of AI, while blockchain ETFs were boosted by interest rate cuts, spot bitcoin ETF approvals, and crypto advocacy. Conversely, clean energy and Brazil ETFs were among the worst performers, with the former continuing a slump and the latter impacted by fiscal concerns and currency depreciation.

title: Where to find the best value opportunities at start of 2025
summary: As 2025 begins, investors are questioning whether to seek value beyond robust US equities. Experts suggest diversifying into areas like gilts, Asian equities, UK smaller companies, and even undervalued US smaller companies and Chinese markets, emphasizing active management and broad diversification. The article highlights specific funds and trusts for these opportunities.

title: This AI ETF Has Favorable 2025 Setup
summary: The WisdomTree Artificial Intelligence and Innovation Fund (WTAI) is poised for a favorable 2025 setup due to projected elevated AI spending, building on its impressive 2024 performance. While benefiting from its significant allocation to semiconductor stocks, the ETF's diverse holdings, including software and cloud computing names, position it to capture broader AI-driven growth. Experts suggest a shift from hardware to software benefits as generative AI matures, aligning with WTAI's diversified strategy.

title: 주가 떨어지면 매수…고수들, 아이온큐·엔비디아 사모았다
summary: 국내 투자수익률 상위 1%의 초고수들이 최근 주가가 급락한 양자 컴퓨터 기업 아이온큐와 엔비디아 주식을 집중 매수했다. 이는 젠슨 황 엔비디아 CEO의 양자 컴퓨터 개발 전망 발언과 CES 기조연설 이후 주가 하락을 저가 매수 기회로 판단한 것으로 보인다. 반면 테슬라와 인튜이티브 머신스, 사운드하운드AI 등은 차익 실현 또는 주가 고평가 우려로 순매도 상위에 올랐다.

title: 3 Stocks To Consider Buying For 'UPtober'
summary: The article discusses three stocks, Nvidia, Amphenol Corporation, and Bank of America, that are historically strong performers in October and November ("UPtober"). It highlights their seasonal patterns, recent performance, and target prices, offering trading strategies for each. The author emphasizes the reliability of these patterns, especially outside of the 2018 outlier year.

title: NVIDIA Statement on the Biden Administration’s Misguided ‘AI Diffusion’ Rule
summary: NVIDIA expresses strong disapproval of the Biden Administration's new "AI Diffusion" rule, arguing it will stifle innovation and economic growth by restricting mainstream computing applications. The company contends that this overreach undermines America's technological leadership and global competitiveness, advocating for policies that promote innovation and open competition instead.

title: AI Enables Major Healthcare Advances At JP Morgan Event
summary: The JP Morgan Healthcare Conference is increasingly focusing on AI's transformative role in medicine. Nvidia is a key player, powering digital healthcare devices and collaborating with institutions like Mayo Clinic and IQVIA to drive AI-driven diagnostics and genomic insights. The article posits that AI will revolutionize healthcare, particularly in eradicating diseases like cancer, by leveraging vast clinical data to develop personalized medicine.

title: Supermicro Empowers AI-driven Capabilities for Enterprise, Retail, and Edge Server Solutions
summary: Supermicro is showcasing its latest AI server, storage, and edge computing solutions for the retail industry at the National Retail Federation (NRF) annual show, in collaboration with NVIDIA. These solutions aim to enhance retail operations, security, and efficiency by leveraging generative AI for personalized shopping, logistical automation, and shrinkage prevention. Supermicro highlights its broad portfolio of edge AI solutions and various server systems designed to deliver high-end performance at retail locations, demonstrating use cases like digital human customer service, AI shopping assistants, and video search for loss prevention.

title: Although Quantum is ‘Decades’ Away For NVIDIA, The Company is Investing in Quantum Talent Today
summary: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang believes practical quantum computing is still 15-30 years away, but the company is actively investing in quantum technologies and workforce development. Through strategic hires in areas like quantum error correction and algorithm engineering, NVIDIA is preparing for a hybrid quantum-classical future where quantum accelerators complement classical supercomputers. This proactive investment aims to position NVIDIA as a key player in the evolving quantum ecosystem, much like its role with AI accelerators.

title: T Stamp Inc. (IDAI): AI Identity Verification Under $2 Billion Market Cap
summary: T Stamp Inc. (NASDAQ:IDAI), specializing in AI-powered identity authentication, is featured among AI companies under a $2 billion market cap. The article discusses general market concerns about AI, including potential overreliance on key players and shifts in demand. It highlights IDAI's recent strategic partnership with Qenta Inc., involving a 10% stake in a new subsidiary and a $1 million licensing fee, projecting a significant net cash inflow for Trust Stamp.

title: Blaize Holdings, Inc. (BZAI): AI Hardware for Edge Computing
summary: This article analyzes Blaize Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:BZAI) as an AI hardware company specializing in edge computing, assessing its position against other AI companies under a $2 billion market cap. It highlights the general market concerns regarding AI stock valuations and risks, while also outlining Blaize's recent IPO and its solutions for real-time data processing. The article concludes by ranking BZAI 13th among 59 AI companies and suggests other promising AI stocks.

title: Top ETFs That Beat the Market in 2024 and Could Do It Again
summary: 2024 was a record-breaking year for ETFs, with investors pouring $1.1 trillion into these funds. This article highlights three ETFs—Invesco S&P 500 Momentum ETF (SPMO), American Century Focused Dynamic Growth ETF (FDG), and Hartford Large Cap Growth ETF (HFGO)—that significantly outperformed the market in 2024 and are poised for continued success. It details their investment strategies, performance, and expense ratios, offering insights for investors considering these funds for 2025.

title: 3 Fidelity ETFs You Can Buy and Hold Forever to Generate $100,000 in Yearly Dividend Income, Starting in 2025
summary: This article examines three Fidelity ETFs that could generate significant dividend income. It details the Fidelity International Value Factor ETF (FIVA), the Fidelity International High Dividend ETF (FIDI), and the Fidelity Yield Enhanced Equity ETF (FYEE), outlining their dividend yields, expense ratios, holdings, and potential risks. The piece calculates the approximate investment needed in each ETF to achieve $100,000 in annual dividend income.

title: CHAT: Generative AI Stocks Still Look Relatively Attractive
summary: The Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT) has seen a significant rise of +13.60% since October 2024, outperforming the S&P 500. The ETF maintains a diversified portfolio with key holdings in NVIDIA, Alphabet, Microsoft, and Meta Platforms. While previously rated a "Strong Buy," the rating has been revised to "Buy" due to macroeconomic uncertainties, even as it appears between fair value and "slightly undervalued."

title: Nvidia, Robinhood, Snowflake And A Basic Materials Stock On CNBC's 'Final Trades'
summary: CNBC's "Halftime Report Final Trades" featured investment picks for Nvidia, Robinhood, Snowflake, and CRH plc. Analysts maintained Overweight ratings for Nvidia and initiated coverage for Snowflake, while regulatory news affected Robinhood and a price target adjustment was made for CRH. The article also provides recent stock price actions for all four companies.

title: Mike Philbrick's Past Picks:Global X., Cambria Foreign Shareholder Yield ETF and Harvest Healthcare Leaders Income ETF – BNN Bloomberg
summary: Mike Philbrick, CEO of ReSolve Asset Management, discusses his past ETF picks: Global X., Cambria Foreign Shareholder Yield ETF, and Harvest Healthcare Leaders Income ETF. The article provides details on these specific investment vehicles.

title: Oracle surges, chip stocks rise as Trump unveils $500 bln AI plan
summary: Oracle's shares jumped nearly 9% after former President Donald Trump announced a $500 billion AI infrastructure investment plan, "Stargate," involving Oracle, OpenAI, and SoftBank to keep the U.S. competitive in the global AI race. Other technology partners and AI-related companies, including Nvidia, Microsoft, Arm, Vistra, Dell Technologies, Super Micro Computer, and Palantir Technologies, also saw their stock prices increase following the news. The plan includes an immediate $100 billion investment, with the remaining over the next four years, and construction of data centers already underway in Texas.

title: NVDY: Its 6-Month Outperformance Could Be Overturned Soon, A Complete Analysis
summary: This article analyzes the YieldMax NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF (NVDY), noting its current option portfolio distribution across bull puts, call credit spreads, and long naked calls. The analysis suggests that NVDY could start to underperform Nvidia stock (NVDA) if NVDA appreciates above $152 before February 21, 2025, and no additional profits are captured unless NVDY surpasses $163 by that date. Given analyst ratings and short-term market outlook predicting a continued upward trend for NVDA, NVDY's recent 6-month outperformance might soon be reversed.

title: NYSEARCA:NVDY: High-Yield Income ETF or Missed NVIDIA Gains?
summary: The YieldMax NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF (NYSEARCA:NVDY) offers an attractive 84% dividend yield through a covered call strategy on NVIDIA stock. While it provides high monthly income, this approach caps upside potential, leading to significant underperformance compared to NVIDIA's direct stock appreciation. Investors must weigh NVDY's income generation against its limited total return, dividend volatility, and specific risks like single-stock dependence and tax inefficiency.

title: 1 Market-Beating ETF That Doesn't Have Nvidia, Microsoft, or Apple Among Its Top 3 Holdings
summary: The American Century U.S. Quality Growth ETF (QGRO) offers a diversified approach to growth investing, outperforming the S&P 500 without heavy reliance on tech giants like Nvidia, Microsoft, or Apple. Its top holdings include Netflix, Booking Holdings, and TJX Companies, with no single stock accounting for more than 4% of the portfolio. This diversification makes it an attractive option for investors seeking growth while mitigating risks associated with an overconcentration in a few highly valued tech stocks.

title: Nvidia calls China’s DeepSeek R1 model ‘an excellent AI advancement’
summary: Nvidia praised China's DeepSeek R1 model as "an excellent AI advancement" despite concerns that it contributed to a 17% drop in Nvidia's stock. DeepSeek's open-source reasoning model reportedly outperformed leading U.S. models like OpenAI's, with significantly lower training costs. Nvidia views this breakthrough as a driver for more work for its GPUs, emphasizing "Test Time Scaling" as a new form of scaling law in AI development.

title: One reason Nvidia looks like a bargain stock following the DeepSeek news
summary: Following a 17% decline in Nvidia's stock and investor concerns about DeepSeek's low-cost generative AI development, the article suggests that Nvidia might be considered a bargain stock. Despite fears that the hardware build-out driving Nvidia's growth may slow, the author emphasizes that it is still very early in the analysis of the DeepSeek news. Other technology stocks like Micron, Super Micro, and Workday are also mentioned as trading at relatively low valuations.

title: Investors piled into leveraged ETFs tied to Nvidia. Then the stock crashed
summary: Leveraged single-stock ETFs heavily invested in Nvidia experienced significant plunges after the chip manufacturer's stock crashed, highlighting the amplified risks of these investment vehicles. Three prominent leveraged Nvidia ETFs saw their largest single-day losses, while inverse ETFs gained substantially. Experts warn that while these ETFs can magnify gains, they also magnify losses, making them suitable only for traders with high risk tolerance and not for long-term investors.

title: Technology in 2025: The Cycle Rolls On
summary: Goldman Sachs Asset Management foresees a broadening tech cycle in 2025 beyond the "Magnificent 7," driven by AI advancements. They anticipate significant investment opportunities in hyperscalers, software companies benefiting from AI, and ASIC semiconductor firms, emphasizing the role of active management to identify growth and manage risk. The article highlights sustained tech spending trends and optimism for ROI among hyperscalers despite large capital expenditures.

title: Trump Pauses Tariffs on Mexico; DJIA Closes Down Only 122 Pts; Nasdaq Still Lags with 1%+ Drop
summary: US President Donald Trump postponed new tariffs on Mexico for a month after reaching an agreement on border troops, which slowed but didn't halt a stock market decline. The DJIA closed down 122 points, while the S&P 500 slipped 0.8% and the Nasdaq saw the steepest decline at 1.2%. The iShares MSCI Mexico ETF (EWW.US) rebounded, and major tech stocks like Tesla, Nvidia, and Apple saw losses narrow slightly.

title: Supermicro Ramps Full Production of NVIDIA Blackwell Rack-Scale Solutions with NVIDIA HGX B200
summary: Supermicro has announced the full production availability of its end-to-end AI data center Building Block Solutions accelerated by the NVIDIA Blackwell platform, offering both air-cooled and liquid-cooled options. These new systems, featuring the NVIDIA HGX B200, provide significantly enhanced cooling capacities and increased GPU densities for demanding AI workloads. Supermicro emphasizes its commitment to delivering sustainable, cutting-edge solutions for AI innovation, including comprehensive rack-level integration and deployment services.

title: 1 Unstoppable BlackRock ETF With 40.6% of Its Portfolio Invested in Broadcom, Amazon, Nvidia, Microsoft, and Palantir
summary: The iShares U.S. Tech Independence Focused ETF (IETC), managed by BlackRock, reportedly has 40.6% of its portfolio invested in five major tech companies: Broadcom, Amazon, Nvidia, Microsoft, and Palantir. This ETF focuses on U.S.-based tech companies that develop most of their technology and generate most of their revenue domestically, often coinciding with the booming AI sector. The ETF significantly outperformed the S&P 500 in 2024, with a 37.4% return, driven by the strong performance of its top holdings, and has shown consistent outperformance since its inception in 2018.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 02/02/2025
summary: This article identifies the top-performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week ending February 2, 2025, detailing their returns and the key market drivers behind their performance. Highlights include ETFs inverse to natural gas and semiconductors, and leveraged ETFs tracking Alibaba, Meta, and Apple, driven by factors like weather forecasts, economic stimulus, AI advancements, and company earnings.

title: 3 Reasons Vanguard’s VGT ETF Belongs in Your Portfolio
summary: The Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) is presented as a strong option for investors seeking aggressive tech exposure, especially in the growing AI boom. The article highlights three key advantages: its superior focus on tech compared to the Nasdaq 100, its heavy concentration in leading tech giants like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, and its competitive low expense ratio of 0.09%. These factors position VGT as a viable choice for future-proofing portfolios despite concerns about an overextended AI trade.

title: Digihost to Develop High-Performance Computing and AI-Tier
summary: Digihost Technology Inc. announced the formation of US Data Centers, Inc., a new subsidiary dedicated to developing high-performance computing (HPC) and artificial intelligence (AI)-focused data centers. Their first project involves transforming an existing site in Columbiana, Alabama, into a 55 MW Tier 3 data center with an estimated total capital expenditure of $440 million, planned for completion by Q1 2027. This strategic investment aims to meet the escalating demand for AI-driven computing power and cloud services.

title: Supermicro forecasts crazy revenue growth for fiscal 2026, boosting its stock
summary: Super Micro Computer Inc. saw its stock jump 9% after forecasting at least $40 billion in revenue for fiscal 2026, driven by demand for its AI hardware and direct-liquid cooling technology. This ambitious projection significantly exceeded Wall Street expectations, despite the company also revising down its fiscal 2025 guidance and facing scrutiny over financial irregularities and an ongoing Justice Department probe. The company is actively working to finalize its financial results to meet a critical February 25 deadline set by financial regulators.

title: Schwab Expands 24-Hour Trading to All Retail Clients
summary: Charles Schwab is expanding its overnight trading services to all retail clients, allowing them to trade a wider range of securities 24 hours a day, five days a week. This move follows a successful pilot program and aims to meet the demand from investors keen to react to market-moving events promptly. The expansion includes trading in S&P 500 and Nasdaq-100 companies, as well as hundreds of ETFs.

title: Direxion Launches 2 Leveraged AMD ETFs Amid AI Chip Race
summary: Direxion has launched two new leveraged ETFs, Direxion Daily AMD Bull 2X Shares (AMUU) and Direxion Daily AMD Bear 1X Shares (AMDD), offering traders concentrated exposure to Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock. This move comes as AMD expands its presence in the artificial intelligence and data center markets, aiming to challenge Nvidia's dominance. The ETFs are designed for short-term trading due to their high-risk nature.

title: How Fidelity Growth Company’s Big Nvidia Bet Influences Its Rating
summary: Fidelity Growth Company's performance is heavily influenced by its significant investment in Nvidia, which constitutes about 16% of its assets. While lead manager Steve Wymer has an excellent track record and the fund has consistently outperformed, the high concentration in Nvidia introduces risk due to the stock's volatile history and reliance on the nascent AI GPU market. Despite the fund's large size limiting agility, its exceptional leadership and long-term performance continue to earn it a Silver Morningstar Medalist Rating.

title: Amphenol Corporation (APH) Surged due to Rapid Growth In Data Centre Construction
summary: Amphenol Corporation (NYSE: APH) experienced significant growth in 2024, attributed to the rapid expansion of data center construction, which accounts for approximately 20% of its sales. The company specializes in manufacturing electrical, electronic, and fiber optic connectors used across various industries. Despite its strong performance, Aoris Investment Management, while acknowledging Amphenol's potential, believes AI stocks offer higher and quicker returns for investors.

title: This Innovative ETF Lets You Follow Republican Politicians’ Trades | KRUZ ETF
summary: The Unusual Whales Subversive Republican Trading ETF (KRUZ) allows investors to track the stock trades of Republican members of Congress and their spouses, capitalizing on their statistically uncanny market outperformance. This innovative ETF, which has outperformed the S&P 500 by over 50% since its inception, suggests that politicians may be trading on insider knowledge despite denials. While there are ethical concerns and reporting lags, the KRUZ ETF provides a legal method for investors to potentially benefit from these informed trades, with top holdings including JPMorgan Chase, Comfort Systems USA, and Nvidia.

title: Data Center Demand Is Exploding Thanks to AI: 1 Stock and 2 ETFs to Profit From It
summary: The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence (AI) is causing an explosive growth in data center demand due to the massive computing power required. Investors looking to capitalize on this trend can consider Vistra (NYSE: VST) for its role in providing power, especially nuclear energy, to hyperscalers. Additionally, two ETFs, the Global X Data Center & Digital Infrastructure ETF (NASDAQ: DTCR) and the Global X MLP & Energy Infrastructure ETF (NYSEMKT: MLPX), offer diversified exposure to data center operators, digital infrastructure, and the energy sources powering them.

title: Roundhill Launches 5 Leveraged Weekly Income ETFs
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched five new WeeklyPay ETFs (NVW, TSW, AAPW, COIW, PLTW) on the Cboe Exchange, offering weekly distributions and leveraged exposure to specific single stocks like Nvidia, Tesla, and Apple. These actively managed funds aim to generate 1.2 times the weekly returns of their underlying companies, providing income-focused investors with amplified returns and potential tax advantages through return of capital distributions. This innovation expands Roundhill's portfolio of weekly income strategies, with plans for additional leveraged WeeklyPay ETFs covering other major companies.

title: 8 Best Quantum Computing Stocks to Buy in 2025
summary: Quantum computing, while still largely in an R&D phase, holds immense potential to revolutionize technology with its ability to accelerate computing speeds far beyond current capabilities. Despite a projected commercialization timeline closer to the mid-2040s, advancements in cloud computing are increasing accessibility for developers, making it a promising, albeit speculative, investment area. The article highlights key companies such as IonQ, Microsoft, Nvidia, Alphabet, Intel, Honeywell, IBM, and Rigetti Computing, suggesting that investors can gain exposure through these tech giants or specialized quantum computing ETFs.

title: Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) Reports Strong Q4 Earnings, Advances AI-Powered Real Estate Solutions
summary: Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) reported strong Q4 2024 earnings, with a 16% revenue increase and improved EPS. The company is actively integrating AI into its operations to boost productivity and efficiency within the real estate sector. The article also touches upon the broader AI investment landscape, highlighted by data center expansions and significant investment offers within the AI industry.

title: Foresight integrates NVIDIA Jetson Orin into its perception technologies
summary: Foresight Autonomous Holdings Ltd. has integrated NVIDIA Jetson Orin computing platforms into its 3D perception technologies, expanding its focus from autonomous vehicles to uncrewed aerial vehicles (UAVs). This collaboration utilizes both Jetson Orin Nano and Jetson AGX Orin to enhance performance, energy efficiency, and real-time data processing for diverse applications. The integration allows Foresight's systems to deliver advanced AI and GPU capabilities for improved environmental perception in challenging conditions.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2025
summary: NVIDIA reported record financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2025, driven by strong demand for its Data Center products, particularly for Blackwell AI supercomputers. The company announced record quarterly revenue of $39.3 billion and full-year revenue of $130.5 billion, with significant growth in Data Center revenue. NVIDIA also provided an optimistic outlook for the first quarter of fiscal 2026, highlighting continued advancements and partnerships across various sectors including AI, Gaming, Professional Visualization, Automotive, and Robotics.

title: US OPEN: Mixed Sentiment Before NVIDIA Quarterly Earnings
summary: US indices showed mixed performance ahead of NVIDIA's quarterly earnings, with some major indices declining while others posted modest gains. Several individual stocks, including Super Micro Computer, Axon Enterprise, Workday, and Intuit, saw significant surges based on positive financial reports and guidance. European markets also displayed divergence, with some indices leading gains and market uncertainty decreasing.

title: AI Hinges on Rapid Electrification
summary: The article discusses how the rapid growth of AI is leading to unprecedented demand for electricity and infrastructure, similar to how energy-efficient lightbulbs ultimately increased overall energy consumption. It highlights the significant power costs associated with training AI models, using AI applications, and manufacturing AI chips, putting immense pressure on the U.S. power grid. The author suggests that investments in grid modernization, power generation, and innovative energy solutions like small modular nuclear reactors (SMRs) are crucial to meet this surging demand.

title: STBX stock plunges to 52-week low of $0.19 amid market challenges
summary: Starbox Holdings (STBX) stock has plunged to a new 52-week low of $0.19, reflecting a 95.9% drop over the past year due to investor concerns and broad market headwinds. Despite its financial health being rated as "WEAK" by InvestingPro due to declining revenue, the stock appears undervalued at 0.22 times book value. The company recently announced an extraordinary general meeting and launched an AI tool, StarboxAI-IntelliCampaignOptimize, to enhance marketing performance.

title: What’s Happening With Palantir Stock?
summary: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) experienced a significant rally followed by a sharp decline, raising questions about its current valuation. Morningstar equity analyst Mark Giarelli views Palantir as having strong growth potential, especially given its leadership in AI technologies, and currently sees the stock as fairly valued despite its high volatility. Investors are cautioned to consider the stock's wide swings, the impact of potential government spending cutbacks, and the large but uncertain total addressable market for its analytical software.

title: PJT Stock: Price, Forecast, Financials & AI Analysis
summary: PJT Partners Inc. (PJT) is a global advisory-focused investment bank with a market capitalization of $4.00 billion. Wall Street analysts forecast its stock price to rise, with an average 1-year target of $172.67. The company recently reported strong financial results and is benefiting from increased M&A activity due to lower borrowing costs.

title: ServiceNow’s newest AI agents bring intelligent automation to telecommunications firms
summary: ServiceNow has introduced new AI agents at MWC25, developed with Nvidia, to bring intelligent automation to telecommunications firms. These agents aim to boost productivity for Communication Service Providers by autonomously solving problems in customer service and network operations, building upon the existing Now Assist for Telecommunications Service Management platform. The integrated system promises to enhance customer experiences, streamline billing, and free up human engineers for higher-level work.

title: Morgan Stanley sets $12 target for Aurora Innovation stock
summary: Morgan Stanley has initiated coverage of Aurora Innovation Inc. (NASDAQ: AUR) with an Overweight rating and a $12 price target, citing confidence in the company's autonomous trucking technology leadership. The firm's analysis highlights Aurora's strong market position, upcoming commercial driverless operation in April, and significant growth potential, although it also notes the stock's high market sensitivity and a slight overvaluation based on current InvestingPro data. This follows recent positive news including strong financial results, a partnership with Continental and Nvidia, and a maintained Overweight rating from Cantor Fitzgerald.

title: GE Healthcare stock hits 52-week low at $74.5 amid market challenges
summary: GE Healthcare (NASDAQ: GEHC) stock has dropped to a 52-week low of $74.5, reflecting a 16.48% decline over the past year despite being considered undervalued with oversold RSI conditions. Amid a challenging healthcare landscape, analysts maintain a positive outlook with price targets ranging from $74 to $115, and the company is actively innovating with new product launches and strategic partnerships. Recent developments include a cash dividend declaration, the introduction of the Revolution Vibe CT system, a collaboration with NVIDIA for AI-powered imaging, and the unveiling of the cloud-based Genesis portfolio.

title: Anthropic Stake for the Masses Is Latest ETF Industry Gambit
summary: KraneShares has acquired a direct stake in Anthropic, a privately held AI company and competitor to OpenAI, through one of its exchange-traded funds. This move combines the surging interest in artificial intelligence with the growing trend of offering private assets to a broader investment audience. Anthropic recently secured funding at a valuation exceeding $60 billion.

title: Semrush CEO Oleg Shchegolev sells $368,509 in company stock
summary: Oleg Shchegolev, CEO of SEMrush Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:SEMR), sold 32,932 shares totaling $368,509 to cover tax obligations from restricted stock units vesting. This was not a discretionary trade, and Shchegolev retains significant direct and indirect ownership in the company. Semrush reported strong Q4 2024 earnings and positive Q1 2025 guidance, and announced leadership changes with Bill Wagner becoming CEO and Shlagle transitioning to CTO.

title: Himax Technologies, Tata Electronics, and PSMC Sign MoU Boosting India’s Ultralow Power AI Sensing Market
summary: Himax Technologies, Tata Electronics, and PSMC have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to significantly boost India's ultralow power AI sensing and display semiconductor market. This collaboration, announced at the IESA Vision Summit 2025, aims to strengthen India's position in semiconductor manufacturing, aligning with the "Made in India" initiative. The partnership will involve Tata Electronics establishing a manufacturing unit, Himax contributing its WiseEye™ AI sensing technology, and PSMC providing fabrication expertise, fostering innovation, job creation, and economic growth in the sector.

title: YMAX ETF: Diversification Risk Hurts Income Prospect (NYSEARCA:YMAX)
summary: The YieldMax Universe Fund of Option Income ETFs (YMAX) offers a high yield of 57% by diversifying across other YieldMax income funds, but this strategy leads to Net Asset Value (NAV) decline. The fund's use of synthetic covered calls and the impact of underlying stock movements on its holdings cause NAV erosion, making it less ideal for stable income or total returns. Investors seeking better performance might consider individual YieldMax funds rather than the diversified YMAX.

title: Signs of AI Slowdown Could Be Evident in Nvidia, Palantir
summary: Recent price weakness in Nvidia and Palantir may indicate a potential slowdown in the AI market, despite continued integration of AI technology in various industries. This suggests that the initial AI hype might have already been priced into these stocks, leading to muted responses even to positive earnings reports. The article provides trading options for investors looking to capitalize on either bullish or bearish movements in these AI-related stocks.

title: Why FPA Global Equity ETF Is Worth Considering
summary: The FPA Global Equity ETF (FPAG) is highlighted as a promising active ETF that is essentially a carve-out of FPA Crescent's equity portfolio. Managed by Brian Selmo and Mark Landecker, it focuses on 30-50 value-oriented, quality-focused stocks, differing from its benchmark by being fully invested and sometimes overweighting sectors like communication services. While it has outperformed its prospectus benchmark and category benchmark since its December 2021 launch, its fully invested nature means higher volatility and less downside protection during downturns but better participation in rising markets.

title: Oracle Reports Lackluster Results, Damping Cloud Enthusiasm
summary: Oracle Corp. reported disappointing quarterly results and a lower-than-expected sales and profit forecast for the current quarter, causing its stock to fall. Despite this, the company projects significant revenue growth in the next two fiscal years driven by its expanding cloud infrastructure business and artificial intelligence partnerships. The report also highlighted substantial capital expenditures on data centers and continued strong demand in the AI sector.

title: Bank of America stock hits 52-week high at 53.64 USD
summary: Bank of America's stock reached a 52-week high of $53.64, driven by a 29.71% increase over the past year and strong investor confidence. This performance follows a solid third-quarter revenue report and increased adoption of its AI-powered financial tools. The bank also made significant executive appointments and its analysts commented on market-influencing investment deals.

title: Johnson & Johnson MedTech wins FDA nod for enhanced robotic-assisted bronchoscopy
summary: Johnson & Johnson MedTech received FDA clearance for its Monarch Quest technology, an enhanced robotic-assisted bronchoscopy system. This new iteration features AI-powered algorithms and integration with GE HealthCare's OEC 3D mobile CBCT imaging system, aiming to improve accuracy and speed in diagnosing lung cancer by better targeting suspicious lung nodules. The technology represents an advancement in minimally invasive access and visualization of airways for earlier and more definitive diagnoses.

title: Is it time to buy the Magnificent Seven?
summary: The "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks have experienced a significant selloff, making some of them appear undervalued according to Morningstar's fair value metrics. While Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, and Alphabet are now rated as buys, Nvidia and Tesla are fairly valued, and Apple remains overvalued. Morningstar strategists still recommend underweighting growth stocks overall, favoring value stocks due to market volatility and slowing economic growth.

title: Cerence Inc. Launches Cerence xUI, Innovative AI Assistant Platform for Next-Generation In-Vehicle User Experiences
summary: Cerence Inc. has launched Cerence xUI™, an AI assistant platform designed to enhance in-vehicle user experiences through conversational AI, leveraging both edge and cloud technologies. This platform, developed in collaboration with NVIDIA and Microsoft, utilizes the CaLLM™ family of large language models to offer personalized and engaging automotive voice interactions. Cerence xUI allows automakers flexible integration options for new and existing vehicles, promising advanced performance, reduced latency, enhanced privacy, and cost efficiency.

title: Tidal Trust II - STKd 100% SMCI & 100% NVDA ETF
summary: This article provides technical information for the Tidal Trust II - STKd 100% SMCI & 100% NVDA ETF (SPCY), including its current price and daily performance. It lists the ETF's ticker symbol and mentions its components, Super Micro Computer (SMCI) and NVIDIA (NVDA). The content also shows market data for major indices like the SPX, Dow 30, QQQ, and VIX.

title: OSRH Stock Plummets to 52-Week Low at $1.31 Amid Market Challenges
summary: Bellevue Life Sciences Acquisition Corp. (OSRH) stock has fallen to a new 52-week low of $1.31, reflecting tumultuous market conditions and an oversold RSI. The company’s market capitalization is now $25.6 million, with a one-year return of -86.51% and a YTD return of -87.55%. In other news, OSR Holdings secured an equity financing agreement with White Lion GBM Innovation Fund, allowing it to sell up to $80 million in common stock to White Lion to enhance its financial flexibility in the medical device industry.

title: NVIDIA Announces Isaac GR00T N1 — the World’s First Open Humanoid Robot Foundation Model — and Simulation Frameworks to Speed Robot Development
summary: NVIDIA announced Isaac GR00T N1, the world’s first open and customizable foundation model for humanoid robots, along with new simulation frameworks like the Isaac GR00T Blueprint and the Newton physics engine. These technologies are designed to accelerate humanoid robot development, making them more adaptable and capable of complex tasks. NVIDIA is collaborating with Google DeepMind and Disney Research on the Newton engine, and the GR00T N1 model is already being adopted by leading humanoid developers.

title: NVIDIA Blackwell Accelerates Computer-Aided Engineering Software by Orders of Magnitude for Real-Time Digital Twins
summary: NVIDIA announced that major computer-aided engineering (CAE) software vendors like Ansys, Altair, Cadence, Siemens, and Synopsys are leveraging the NVIDIA Blackwell platform to accelerate their simulation tools by up to 50x. This allows industries such as automotive and aerospace to significantly reduce product development time and costs through real-time digital twins. Companies like Cadence and Boom Supersonic are already demonstrating breakthroughs, with Cadence running multibillion cell simulations in under 24 hours and Boom Supersonic expanding design explorations for its supersonic airliner.

title: GE HealthCare, Nvidia working on autonomous imaging
summary: GE HealthCare is expanding its AI partnership with Nvidia to include autonomous X-ray and ultrasound applications, leveraging Nvidia’s Isaac for Healthcare platform. This collaboration aims to address radiology staff shortages and enhance efficiency by automating repetitive tasks and streamlining workflows in medical imaging. The initial focus will be on developing autonomous X-ray systems and later extending to ultrasound to reduce sonographer workload and improve patient care.

title: NVIDIA Teams Up with GE, Google, IBM, And CrowdStrike To Redefine AI And Quantum Technology
summary: NVIDIA is establishing the NVIDIA Accelerated Quantum Research Center (NVAQC) in Boston and announced multiple collaborations to advance AI and quantum computing. Partnerships include Google for AI initiatives across various industries, GE HealthCare for autonomous medical imaging, IBM for enterprise AI capabilities, and CrowdStrike for AI-driven cybersecurity. Additionally, NVIDIA is working with General Motors on AI-powered vehicles and Yum! Brands to revolutionize AI in the restaurant industry.

title: Trump tally: J&J plans $55 billion investment to expand U.S. manufacturing
summary: Johnson & Johnson announced a $55 billion investment over the next four years to expand U.S. manufacturing, research, and technology. This move aligns with President Trump's goal of boosting domestic manufacturing and will include new facilities and expansions to existing sites. J&J's investment is part of a larger trend of major U.S. companies pledging significant spending to expand U.S. operations.

title: ACV Auctions CEO George Chamoun sells $5.37 million in stock
summary: George Chamoun, CEO of ACV Auctions Inc. (NASDAQ: ACVA), sold 350,000 shares of Class A Common Stock worth approximately $5.37 million across two transactions on March 19 and 20. The sales were conducted under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan established in December 2024. Following these sales, Chamoun retains 2,821,193 shares.

title: 4 Best Leveraged ETFs of Last Week
summary: Last week, the stock market saw moderate gains across major indices, driven by the Fed's decision to hold interest rates steady, NVIDIA's GTC event, and mixed retail sales data. Against this backdrop, several leveraged ETFs performed well, including those focused on energy, uranium, Brazilian stocks, and financials. These ETFs capitalized on the week's market movements, with MicroSectors Energy 3X Leveraged ETNs, Defiance Daily Target 2x Long Uranium ETF, ProShares Ultra MSCI Brazil Capped, and Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3X Shares showing significant gains.

title: SentinelOne CEO Tomer Weingarten sells $1.17 million in stock
summary: SentinelOne (NYSE: S) CEO Tomer Weingarten recently sold 60,864 shares of the company's Class A common stock for approximately $1.17 million. This transaction was executed under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan, leaving his direct ownership at 920,297 shares, despite also acquiring shares through conversions and exercised options without cash exchange. The sale comes amid varied analyst responses to SentinelOne's Q4 results and future guidance, leading to adjusted price targets from several firms.

title: Advanced Micro Devices Can Double in Price: Here’s Why
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is projected to double in price due to its increasing market share against NVIDIA in GPU and CPU markets, driven by lower-cost, better-performing products. Insider transactions, strong institutional buying, and an undervalued stock price relative to its growth potential support this optimistic outlook. The company is actively addressing its software infrastructure gap to further compete with NVIDIA.

title: Stock market today: Nasdaq, S&P 500 dive, snap 3-day win streak as Trump preps auto tariffs
summary: US stocks closed lower on Wednesday, snapping a three-day win streak, as President Trump prepared to announce new tariffs on auto imports. The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite led the losses, falling over 2%, with Nvidia and Tesla shares down more than 5%. The looming tariffs also fueled a surge in copper prices amidst reports of accelerated plans for copper levies.

title: Accelerating Japan's growth with AI - Microsoft Stories Asia
summary: Microsoft is making a significant $2.9 billion investment in Japan to expand its cloud infrastructure and boost AI capabilities by 2025, including the introduction of Azure High Performance Computing with NVIDIA GPUs. This initiative aims to accelerate Japan's AI transformation across various industries, enhance cybersecurity, and equip millions with AI skills through new programs like "CyberSmart AI" and partnerships with academic institutions. The investment underscores Microsoft's commitment to supporting Japan's economic growth and innovation in the AI era.

title: Is This the Best Artificial Intelligence ETF On the Market You Should Be Buying?
summary: This article evaluates the Global X Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AIQ) as a top investment option for gaining diversified exposure to the AI megatrend. It highlights AIQ's broad reach across the AI ecosystem, its 15.8% annualized return since 2018, and its holdings beyond just chip manufacturers to include software and data companies like ServiceNow and Snowflake. The ETF is presented as a calculated play on AI's future growth, offering opportunities with less individual stock risk.

title: CoreWeave Stock Treads Water After Scaled-Back IPO
summary: CoreWeave, an AI-focused cloud computing company, had a lukewarm IPO, with its stock ending the day at its IPO price of $40 per share, despite initial stumbling. The scaled-back IPO and initial trading performance raise questions about investor appetite for AI stocks amidst a broader tech slump and concerns about CoreWeave's concentrated sales and significant debt. The company's debut is seen as a litmus test for the AI market after Nvidia's recent decline.

title: SOXL stock: More chaos to come ahead of ‘Liberation Day’?
summary: The Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bull 3X Shares (SOXL) ETF has notably declined due to macroeconomic uncertainties and anxiety over President Trump’s tariff agenda. Investors are monitoring April 2, dubbed "Liberation Day," for new tariff announcements that could further impact semiconductor demand, even if the sector avoids direct tariffs, particularly through collateral damage to chip-consuming industries like automotive. The future of the CHIPS Act also remains a wildcard, despite bipartisan support.

title: USC Viterbi School Announces Keynote Speakers for 2025 Commencement Ceremonies
summary: The USC Viterbi School of Engineering and USC School of Advanced Computing have announced their keynote speakers for the 2025 commencement ceremonies, scheduled for May 12-16, 2025. The speakers include NVIDIA executive Azita Martin, Axonics co-founder Guangqiang (Jay) Jiang, and AI pioneer Kevin Knight, who will address over 4,800 graduating engineering students across various undergraduate and master's ceremonies. These diverse speakers bring expertise from industry, entrepreneurship, and academia to inspire the graduating class.

title: Twilio CEO Shipchandler sells stock worth over $1.15 million
summary: Twilio Inc. CEO, Khozema Shipchandler, recently sold 12,056 shares of the company's Class A common stock for approximately $1.15 million, primarily to cover tax withholding obligations. Despite this sale, Shipchandler retains 295,134 shares, and Twilio's stock has seen strong performance with a 61% return over the past year. The company maintains a strong financial position, is considered slightly undervalued by InvestingPro, and has received positive outlooks from several analyst firms.

title: Super Micro Computer, Inc. - Industry's First-to-Market Supermicro NVIDIA HGX™ B200 Systems Demonstrate AI Performance Leadership on MLPerf® Inference v5.0 Results
