summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. announced leading performance on MLPerf Inference v5.0 benchmarks using their NVIDIA HGX B200 8-GPU systems, demonstrating over three times the token generation per second for Llama2-70B and Llama3.1-405B compared to previous generations. Both liquid-cooled and air-cooled systems achieved top results, showcasing Supermicro's innovation and collaboration with NVIDIA in AI workloads. The company's optimized systems were operational and available to customers before the benchmark start date, with results validated by MLCommons as reproducible.

title: MongoDB CEO Dev Ittycheria sells $3.2 million in stock
summary: MongoDB CEO Dev Ittycheria sold 18,512 shares of Class A common stock for approximately $3.2 million to cover tax withholding obligations. This transaction occurred amidst a 13% decline in MongoDB's stock price over the past week, though analysis suggests the stock is currently undervalued. Despite a recent strong Q4 performance, the company's FY26 guidance fell short, impacting its shares.

title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai sells $5.15 million in company stock
summary: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai recently sold approximately $5.15 million in company stock through a pre-established trading plan. The sales occurred while Alphabet's stock traded near its 52-week low, though Wall Street maintains a bullish outlook. Pichai's remaining direct holdings in Alphabet amount to over 2.7 million shares.

title: Got $2,000? These High-Yield ETFs Could Turn Into Passive Income Superstars
summary: This article identifies four high-yield ETFs that could serve as passive income superstars for investors with as little as $2,000 to invest. It highlights ETFs focused on Dividend Aristocrats, general dividend equity, Bitcoin options, and leveraged NVIDIA performance, detailing their characteristics, dividend yields, and historical performance. The piece emphasizes diversification and the potential to mitigate market volatility through income-generating investments.

title: Tigress Financial raises Intel stock price target to $52 on AI growth
summary: Tigress Financial Partners has increased its price target for Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) to $52, maintaining a Buy rating due to the company's AI innovation, strategic partnerships, and manufacturing expansion. Intel's return to profitability in Q3, driven by AI accelerator demand and an improved product mix, plus supportive U.S. policies, are expected to fuel multiyear growth. The stock has seen a 75.4% return over the past year and trades at a P/E ratio of 842.35, with 11 analysts revising earnings upwards for the upcoming period.

title: Monolithic Power Systems’ Surge: What’s Driving It?
summary: Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) stock has surged by 9.58% following an upward revision of its Q1 revenue outlook to $630M-$640M and ambitious growth plans for 2025-2027. Despite positive financial health, the company faces analyst price target adjustments from Wells Fargo and TD Cowen, and heightened scrutiny due to a securities lawsuit related to product performance issues with major clients like Nvidia. The article highlights the interplay of financial performance, analyst sentiment, and market narratives in driving MPWR's current stock dynamics.

title: NVIDIA to Manufacture American-Made AI Supercomputers in US for First Time
summary: NVIDIA is collaborating with manufacturing partners to produce AI supercomputers entirely within the U.S. for the first time. The company is commissioning over a million square feet of manufacturing space in Arizona and Texas to build and test NVIDIA Blackwell chips and AI supercomputers, aiming to complete up to half a trillion dollars of AI infrastructure in the US within four years. This initiative is expected to create hundreds of thousands of jobs and enhance supply chain resiliency while meeting the growing demand for AI technology.

title: NVIDIA Blackwell GeForce RTX Arrives for Every Gamer, Starting at $299
summary: NVIDIA announced the GeForce RTX 5060 family of GPUs, including the RTX 5060 Ti and RTX 5060, starting at $299. These new graphics cards feature the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture, DLSS 4, full ray tracing, and neural rendering, aiming to deliver next-generation performance and AI-enhanced visuals for both gamers and creators. The release also extends to GeForce RTX 5060 Laptop GPUs, offering enhanced capabilities for portable devices.

title: AMD: Lowering Our Fair Value Estimate Due to China Restrictions and PC Concerns
summary: Morningstar has lowered its fair value estimate for AMD to $120 per share from $140 due to new U.S. restrictions on AI chip exports to China and concerns about PC market performance. These factors led to reduced revenue estimates for AMD's AI GPU and PC CPU segments in 2025 and 2029, even though shares appear undervalued and AMD is expected to remain a winner in PC CPUs and gain some AI market share.

title: Lyft, Hertz Global, Prologis
summary: This article details stock movements on Wall Street, noting a slide in major indices led by chipmakers due to Nvidia's warning about US export restrictions to China. It highlights top percentage gainers and losers across the S&P 500, NYSE, and Nasdaq, and provides specific company news affecting stock performance, including Lyft's European expansion plans and Hertz Global's stock increase after Pershing Square built stakes. Oil companies saw gains due to potential US-China talks and Iraq's output cut plan.

title: Top Performing Leveraged/Inverse ETFs: 04/13/2025
summary: This article details the top-performing leveraged and inverse ETFs for the week ending April 13, 2025. Gold miners leveraged ETFs like MicroSectors Gold Miners 3X Leveraged ETN and Direxion Daily Gold Miners Index Bull 2x Shares led the gains, driven by rising gold prices. Other strong performers included NVIDIA-focused leveraged ETFs and those in the aerospace & defense, semiconductor sectors, and uranium.

title: GenAI spending can unlock ‘co-working’ potential in financial sector: Moody’s
summary: Moody's reports that investment in generative AI (GenAI) is rapidly increasing within the financial services industry, enabling "co-working" potential and transformative changes. After initial regulatory uncertainties, the sector is now embracing GenAI to enhance efficiency, customer experiences, and revenue growth opportunities, with spending projected to reach US$126.4 billion by 2028.

title: Why Fidelity’s Dividend ETF (FDVV) Is a Safe Haven in Today’s Market
summary: The Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV) offers investors a blend of safety and income through exposure to diversified large-cap dividend-paying businesses. Its significant yield of 3.28% and relative resilience make it attractive for those seeking compounding opportunities and portfolio growth, especially in uncertain economic times. With a low expense ratio of 0.16%, FDVV provides a cost-effective way to invest in established companies that can withstand market volatility.

title: Fujitsu expands strategic collaboration with Supermicro to offer total generative AI platform
summary: Fujitsu Limited and Super Micro Computer, Inc. are deepening their strategic collaboration in AI computing, announcing the launch of the PRIMERGY GX2570 M8s, a Supermicro OEM server with high-performance GPUs, along with maintenance and management services. Starting July 2025, Fujitsu will combine these offerings with its Takane large language model (LLM) to provide a managed service for building generative AI infrastructure. This comprehensive offering aims to enable secure and efficient generative AI utilization for enterprises without requiring asset ownership.

title: Why Fidelity Blue Chip Growth Fund Is Built for the Long Haul
summary: The Fidelity Blue Chip Growth Fund (FBGRX) has demonstrated strong long-term performance despite recent volatility due to its significant semiconductor holdings. Managed by Sonu Kalra, the fund embraces high-growth, volatile stocks, positioning it for exceptional returns during market rallies but leading to underperformance when value stocks are in favor. Its large asset base presents challenges for investing in smaller-cap prospects, but Kalra's gradual approach and strong analytical support help maintain its execution.

title: The Magnificent Seven receives another ETF focused on covered calls
summary: Roundhill Investments has launched a new exchange-traded fund, the Roundhill Magnificent Seven Covered Call ETF (MAGY), which focuses on covered calls for the mega-cap tech stocks known as the Magnificent Seven. This actively managed ETF is the latest financial product inspired by the strong performance of these prominent technology companies.

title: IBM unveils $150B U.S. investment in tech manufacturing, quantum computers
summary: IBM announced a plan to invest at least $150 billion over the next five years in American manufacturing to advance its mainframe and quantum computer systems. This investment aims to fuel the U.S. economy and strengthen the country's position as a global computing leader. The announcement follows IBM's better-than-expected first-quarter revenue of $14.54 billion.

title: Sam Altman’s World Officially Launches in the U.S., Inks Partnerships with Visa, Stripe, and Match Group
summary: Sam Altman's company, Tools for Humanity, officially launched World in the U.S. with the goal of creating a "human-first identity and financial network" that verifies users as human online, especially in an age of pervasive AI. The service, which provides 16 Worldcoin (WLD) to new users in exchange for an iris scan, has secured partnerships with Visa, Stripe, and Match Group for various financial and verification services. Despite regulatory hurdles and privacy concerns, the company is focusing on expanding its network and plans to monetize through app charges, transaction fees, and mini-apps within the World platform.

title: Star Tribune - Earnings To Watch: L.B. Foster (FSTR) Reports Q1 Results Tomorrow
summary: L.B. Foster (NASDAQ: FSTR) is set to announce its Q1 earnings before market hours tomorrow. Analysts anticipate an 8% year-on-year revenue decline to $114.4 million and adjusted earnings of $0.03 per share, following a previous quarter where the company missed revenue, EBITDA, and EPS estimates. Despite past misses, analysts have reconfirmed their estimates, and the stock has seen positive sentiment in the general industrial machinery segment, with shares up 10.7% over the last month.

title: As Investors Brace for Volatility, Look to Dividend ETF FDVV
summary: Given current market uncertainties like sticky inflation, high interest rates, and geopolitical tensions, many investors anticipate continued volatility. Dividend ETFs, such as the Fidelity High Dividend ETF (FDVV), offer a potential solution for stability and income generation. FDVV invests in large- and mid-cap dividend-paying companies and can provide diversification benefits, offering a consistent revenue stream that can help offset market volatility.

title: Chipmakers AMD, GlobalFoundries and Cirrus Logic post solid earnings and guidance, easing tariff fears
summary: U.S. chipmakers AMD, GlobalFoundries, and Cirrus Logic reported strong quarterly earnings and optimistic guidance, easing concerns about the impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs. Despite challenges like new export regulations for AI chips to China affecting AMD, and a slowdown in the smartphone market for GlobalFoundries, all three companies expressed confidence in their ability to navigate current market conditions. GlobalFoundries, in particular, anticipates benefiting from tariffs on foreign-made chips, projecting increased demand for its U.S.-manufactured products.

title: T. ROWE PRICE RELEASES NEWEST EPISODE OF PODCAST SERIES FEATURING JENSEN HUANG, FOUNDER AND CEO OF NVIDIA
summary: T. Rowe Price released a new episode of its investment-themed podcast, "The Angle," featuring Jensen Huang, founder and CEO of NVIDIA. Huang discusses the AI revolution with host Eric Veiel, focusing on the future of AI, its convergence with robotics, and energy efficiency. This episode is part of the podcast's fourth season, which also includes interviews with other prominent CEOs.

title: International Diversification Benefits Shining in 2025
summary: International equities and related funds are demonstrating significant diversification benefits in 2025, outperforming the S&P 500 after a decade of lagging performance. Factors like the end of deflation in Europe and Japan, along with U.S. policy changes, are driving this momentum. ETFs like the WisdomTree International Equity Fund (DWM) are experiencing strong gains, highlighting the value of unhedged international allocations in portfolios.

title: Earnings call transcript: Aeye Inc faces challenges amid Q1 2025 results
summary: Aeye Inc (LIDR) reported a challenging Q1 2025 with significant net losses and a stock drop, but emphasized cost-cutting measures, strategic partnerships, and the launch of its Apollo LiDAR solution for automotive and other sectors. Despite projected ongoing cash burn and negative EPS forecasts, the company highlights its capital-light model and initial contract wins in non-automotive markets as paths toward future profitability.

title: GTA 6 release date confirmed: Is it game on for the Take Two Interactive Software stock?
summary: Grand Theft Auto 6 (GTA 6) is now confirmed to launch on May 26, 2026, a delay from the previously anticipated autumn 2025. This highly anticipated release is expected to significantly boost Take Two Interactive Software (NASDAQ: TTWO) and potentially the broader gaming industry, despite concerns from analysts about development costs and market headwinds. Investors are closely watching for the game's impact on TTWO's stock and the gaming sector's resurgence.

title: Beamr Issues Q1-2025 CEO Letter to Shareholders: Experiencing Rising Demand for Our Technology Across Key Verticals
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. issued its Q1-2025 CEO Letter to Shareholders, highlighting expanded sales pipelines, growing traction from large-scale prospects, and continued innovation in cloud and product offerings. The company reported a 55% year-over-year revenue increase to $0.63M in Q1 2025 and anticipates significant revenue growth for the full year 2025, driven by market validation and strategic partnerships, including joining the AWS ISV Accelerate program and winning an NAB Show Product of the Year award.

title: Supermicro Stock Jumps as Raymond James Kicks Off Coverage With Bullish Rating
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) shares surged after Raymond James initiated coverage with an "outperform" rating and a $41 price target, citing Supermicro's emergence as a market leader in AI-optimized infrastructure. Despite the recent gains, the stock is still more than 50% below its value a year ago, following recent analyst price target cuts, sales outlook reductions, and concerns over accounting practices. Raymond James analysts believe Supermicro, which holds 9% of the $145 billion AI platform market, is well-positioned for future growth.

title: PTC Q1 Earnings Call: Revenue Tops Estimates, Cautious Tone on Macro Uncertainty
summary: PTC reported better-than-expected Q1 CY2025 revenue and adjusted EPS, driven by strong demand for its software offerings and early success in its go-to-market transformation. While the company raised its full-year guidance, management expressed caution regarding macroeconomic uncertainties that might lead customers to phase or delay purchases. Despite potential headwinds, PTC's subscription model, AI-driven enhancements, and focus on cost control are expected to support future performance.

title: AGM Group announces 50-for-1 share consolidation
summary: AGM Group Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: AGMH) announced a 50-for-1 share consolidation, effective June 3, 2025, to meet Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement. The company's stock price has declined significantly, but InvestingPro analysis suggests potential undervaluation, trading at 0.17 times book value. This consolidation reduces authorized shares to 8 million and aims to maintain their Nasdaq listing.

title: Supermicro's Revolutionary Data Center Building Block Solutions® (DCBBS) Simplify and Shorten Global-Scale Buildouts of AI/IT Liquid-Cooled Data Centers
summary: Supermicro introduces its Data Center Building Block Solutions (DCBBS) to simplify and accelerate the deployment of liquid-cooled AI/IT data centers globally. This solution is designed to overcome the complexities of outfitting AI factories by providing pre-validated scalable units, comprehensive services, and customized options. DCBBS aims to reduce costs, improve quality, and offer significant power and footprint savings, leading to a 20% lower Total Cost of Ownership (TCO).

title: Breakthrough: Ekso Bionics Partners With NVIDIA to Create Revolutionary AI-Powered Rehabilitation Technology
summary: Ekso Bionics has been accepted into the NVIDIA Connect program, initiating a strategic move to develop the world's first foundation model for human motion in physical rehabilitation. Leveraging NVIDIA's resources, including specialized training and GPU platforms, Ekso Bionics aims to integrate new AI capabilities across its device portfolio. CEO Scott Davis highlights this collaboration as the beginning of their AI journey to enhance exoskeleton technology and improve patient outcomes through personalized rehabilitation.

title: Just Four Days Till Microchip Technology Incorporated (NASDAQ:MCHP) Will Be Trading Ex-Dividend
summary: Microchip Technology Incorporated (NASDAQ:MCHP) is set to trade ex-dividend in four days, with a dividend payment of US$0.455 per share scheduled for June 5th. The company paid a total of US$1.82 last year, resulting in a 3.0% trailing yield on its current stock price of US$61.21. Despite being unprofitable last year, Microchip Technology has shown improving income over the past five years and has consistently increased its dividend by approximately 9.8% annually over the last decade.

title: NVIDIA RTX PRO Servers Speed Trillion-Dollar Enterprise IT Industry Transition to AI Factories
summary: NVIDIA announced its RTX PRO Servers and a new Enterprise AI Factory validated design to accelerate the trillion-dollar IT industry's transition to AI factories. These servers, built with NVIDIA RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Server Edition GPUs, offer universal acceleration for AI, design, engineering, and business applications. Companies like Cadence, Foxconn, and Lilly are already planning to adopt this infrastructure, with global system makers and consulting firms supporting the deployment.

title: Spotlight: Perfect Corp. Delivers Personalized Digital Beauty Experiences Using NVIDIA TensorRT and NVENC
summary: Perfect Corp. is leveraging NVIDIA TensorRT and NVENC to provide hyperpersonalized digital beauty experiences through augmented reality (AR) and AI. These technologies enable real-time skin analysis, AI-generated hairstyles, and accelerated video processing for features like AI Video Face Swap. This enhances realism, accuracy, and performance in their applications, making digital shopping more engaging and efficient.

title: ESG Investing, Explained: 10 Top Socially Responsible Stocks
summary: The article explains ESG investing and provides a list of 10 top socially responsible stocks for beginners. It highlights companies like Microsoft, Levi Strauss, Teladoc Health, Home Depot, NextEra Energy, Intuit, and NVIDIA, along with ESG-focused index funds and ETFs, detailing their commitment to environmental, social, and governance factors. This guide aims to help new investors build an ESG-based portfolio with diversified and ethical choices.

title: Is iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU) a Strong ETF Right Now?
summary: The iShares Paris-Aligned Climate MSCI USA ETF (PABU), launched on April 8, 2022, is a smart beta ETF focused on the Style Box - All Cap Blend category, aiming to align with Paris Agreement objectives through decarbonization and reduced climate-related risks. With over $2.12 billion in assets and a low expense ratio of 0.10%, PABU primarily invests in Information Technology, with Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft as top holdings. The ETF has shown strong performance, up 13.72% over the last year, offering a diversified option for investors in climate-aligned strategies.

title: Stock Of The Day Quanta Services Near Buy Point As Energy Appetite Expands Backlog
summary: Quanta Services is highlighted as the Stock Of The Day, nearing a buy point with a handle valid after Tuesday at $348.42. The company's backlog is expanding significantly due to the AI-spurred demand for power projects, leading to a strong Composite Rating of 97/99. Several heavy construction stocks, including Quanta Services, are seeing increased activity and approaching buy zones amidst this energy appetite.

title: Asset Management Giant GraniteShares Launches Two ETFs Involving Bitcoin and Nvidia
summary: GraniteShares, a prominent asset management firm, has introduced two new exchange-traded funds (ETFs): the GraniteShares YieldBOOST NVDA ETF (NVYY) and the GraniteShares YieldBOOST Bitcoin ETF (XBTY). The Bitcoin ETF is designed to generate income using an options strategy tied to a 2x long Bitcoin daily ETF. This development follows the company's previous filings for leveraged ETF applications related to crypto firms such as MicroStrategy.

title: BlackRock doubles down on AI stocks with $160 billion model portfolios
summary: BlackRock is increasing its investment in AI stocks while reducing its overall US stock exposure in its $160 billion model portfolios, citing concerns over tariffs. The firm injected $436 million into its iShares AI Innovation and Tech Active ETF (BAI), significantly expanding its size and focusing on AI leaders like Nvidia, Broadcom, and Meta. Concurrently, BlackRock is shifting funds towards global value stocks and short-term bonds, reflecting a strategic adaptation to global trade uncertainties without a diminished view of the US economy.

title: Oracle Corporation (ORCL) Plans $40 Billion Nvidia Chip Purchase for OpenAI Data Center Project, FT Says
summary: Oracle Corporation (ORCL) is reportedly planning to spend approximately $40 billion on Nvidia's GB200 chips to support OpenAI's new data center in Abilene, Texas, as part of the US Stargate Project. This initiative aims to bolster the nation's AI capabilities and reduce OpenAI's dependency on Microsoft's computing resources. The data center is expected to be operational by mid-2026, with Oracle leasing the computing power to OpenAI.

title: Monolithic Power Systems: Holding Steady, With AI Upside Still In Play
summary: Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) is recognized for its justified high valuation due to consistent growth and strong business model, offering real performance advantages and pricing power. The article suggests investing in MPWR through long-term positions or during valuation dips, maintaining a strong conviction in its long-term thesis despite market volatility. This continued belief is reinforced, especially after the latest earnings report, highlighting potential AI upside.

title: NVDY: Attractive Into Nvidia's Q1 Report, With Stock +50% From The April Low
summary: This article reiterates a buy rating on the YieldMax NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF (NVDY), citing its high option income potential. Despite underperforming NVDA and having a high expense ratio, NVDY's yield, sourced from call option selling, is compelling given NVIDIA's valuation and upcoming Q1 results. The author suggests NVDY offers an attractive risk/reward for income-focused investors, especially as NVIDIA approaches its earnings report.

title: Semiconductor ETF options show caution ahead of Nvidia results
summary: Traders in the options market are showing caution ahead of Nvidia's earnings report, with significant defensive options contracts being traded on the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH). This reflects concerns about potential industry-wide volatility, even as options activity on Nvidia itself is more mixed, with some investors selling calls to monetize elevated premiums. The heightened activity underscores investor interest and some apprehension following an earlier strong market run.

title: Semiconductor ETF options show caution ahead of Nvidia results
summary: Options traders are showing caution ahead of Nvidia's earnings report, with significant defensive trading seen in the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH). Put options on the SMH ETF have been heavily traded, suggesting concerns about sector-wide volatility. While some investors are hedging in SMH, others are selling Nvidia options to capitalize on heightened volatility expectations.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for First Quarter Fiscal 2026
summary: NVIDIA reported strong first-quarter fiscal 2026 results with revenue of $44.1 billion, up 69% year-over-year, despite incurring a $4.5 billion charge due to new H20 export licensing requirements for China. The company's Data Center revenue surged to $39.1 billion, driven by robust demand for its AI infrastructure, including the Blackwell NVL72 AI supercomputer. NVIDIA also provided an optimistic outlook for Q2 fiscal 2026, anticipating $45.0 billion in revenue, even with an estimated $8.0 billion loss in H20 revenue.

title: REX Financial launches covered call Nvidia ETF hours before earnings release
summary: REX Financial has launched the REX NVDA Growth & Income ETF, a single-stock exchange-traded fund tied to Nvidia, just hours before Nvidia's earnings release. This covered call ETF uses option strategies to generate income and offers investors exposure to a portion of Nvidia's stock price upside, aiming to provide a balance of growth and income. The move targets self-directed individual investors seeking alternative income-generating products.

title: Will the MAG 7 Stocks Continue to Lead the Stock Market?
summary: The article discusses the continued influence of the "Magnificent Seven" (MAG 7) stocks—Microsoft, NVIDIA, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Tesla—on the US stock market. It highlights their market capitalization leadership and their resilience following a market correction caused by tariff fears. The author suggests that the MAGS ETF offers a diversified way to invest in these leading technology companies and expects them to maintain their market leadership.

title: FDG: A High Volatility, Premium Valuation Growth ETF (NYSEARCA:FDG)
summary: The American Century Focused Dynamic Growth ETF (FDG) is characterized as a high-volatility, premium-valuation growth ETF with a concentrated portfolio focused on mega-cap tech, consumer discretionary, and healthcare. Despite its strong performance in bull markets, the fund exhibits limited diversification, higher costs, and lower liquidity compared to competitors, leading to underperformance and steeper drawdowns in downturns. The author maintains a neutral rating on FDG due to its elevated risk, premium valuation (28.8x earnings), and inconsistent long-term returns.

title: The Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF Starts Trading Today. Should You Buy the IVES ETF Now?
summary: Wedbush senior analyst Dan Ives has launched the "Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF" (ticker: IVES) to offer investors targeted exposure to his top 30 AI stock picks, including Nvidia and Tesla. Ives describes the ETF as a "living organism" that will be reconfigured quarterly to adapt to the evolving AI landscape. The fund aims to capitalize on the ongoing AI revolution, which Ives believes is still in its early stages and expanding beyond chips into software and consumer applications.

title: REX Launches 3 New Growth & Income Covered Call ETFs
summary: REX Financial has introduced three new "Growth & Income Covered Call ETFs" (COII, MSII, TSII) targeting Coinbase, MicroStrategy, and Tesla, respectively. These ETFs aim to provide growth potential and weekly income through a dual portfolio strategy, writing call options on approximately half of the portfolio while maintaining uncapped upside potential on the remainder. This launch expands on their recently released NVIDIA-focused fund, catering to investor demand for income-generating products tied to high-growth companies.

title: KraneShares Launches First Humanoid Robot ETF
summary: KraneShares has launched KOID, the first US-listed ETF specifically targeting humanoid robot companies. The fund tracks 50 companies across six categories, including prominent firms like Nvidia, Tesla, and Amphenol, using an equal-weighting strategy. KOID charges a 0.69% expense ratio after a fee waiver and aims to provide exposure to the global humanoid robotics opportunity.

title: Mag 7 ETFs Surge: Will the Rally Keep Rolling?
summary: The Magnificent Seven stocks saw a significant rally in May, collectively gaining over 13%, driven by strong earnings growth, the AI boom, and their defensive characteristics. This surge led to a 10% increase in the Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF (MAGS) over the past month. Despite the solid performance, challenges such as rising valuations and increased capital expenditures for AI infrastructure could impact future profitability.

title: New IVES ETF Uses Dan Ives’ Research Framework
summary: The Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF (IVES) has been launched by Wedbush Fund Advisors, leveraging the research framework of Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities' Managing Director and Global Head of Technology Research. The ETF provides concentrated exposure to AI companies, aiming for long-term returns through a tactically balanced portfolio that includes leaders like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Broadcom. IVES seeks to offer investors direct and meaningful access to the companies driving the AI revolution while mitigating individual company risk.

title: Nvidia Back in Focus and AI Infrastructure Acceleration
summary: This article analyzes Nvidia's recent earnings call, highlighting the accelerating pace of innovation and capital expenditure in the semiconductor and AI infrastructure sectors. It emphasizes the shift from Nvidia being the sole focus to a broader ecosystem including fabless designers and custom silicon, suggesting diversified exposure through ETFs like SMH and SMHX is crucial for investors. The continued surge in AI adoption and associated compute demand underscores the long-term potential of the semiconductor industry.

title: Nasdaq-listed Oblong jumps 12%, eyes $7.5M Bittensor TAO acquisition for Bitcoin-style treasury strategy
summary: Nasdaq-listed Oblong has announced plans to raise $7.5 million through a private stock sale to fund a new initiative focused on Bittensor's AI and digital asset treasury. This strategic move, which has already seen Oblong's shares jump 12%, aims to acquire TAO tokens and support the Bittensor AI marketplace, reflecting the company's belief in the transformative potential of decentralized AI. Oblong likens its approach to how institutional players adopted Bitcoin as a treasury asset, viewing TAO as a key asset for the future of AI-integrated crypto infrastructure.

title: Qualcomm acquires chip designer Alphawave for $2.4B
summary: Qualcomm Inc. is acquiring U.K.-based chip interconnect provider Alphawave IP Group plc for $2.4 billion, a deal intended to boost Qualcomm's share of the data center chip market. Alphawave's technology, including AresCORE and GammaCORE, will complement Qualcomm's Oryon CPU series and Hexagon NPUs, particularly in areas like co-packaged optics for data centers. The acquisition, expected to close in Q1 2026, aims to enhance Qualcomm's offerings for advanced computing performance in high-growth sectors.

title: Qualcomm to acquire Alphawave Semi for $2.4B
summary: Qualcomm has agreed to acquire Alphawave Semi for $2.4 billion, aiming to strengthen its position in the artificial intelligence and data center markets. This acquisition is part of Qualcomm's broader strategy to enhance its product capabilities for next-generation technologies and expand into new markets. The deal is expected to close in the first quarter of 2026 and will provide Qualcomm with Alphawave's high-speed connectivity and compute silicon assets.

title: BGM stock soars to 52-week high, touches $16.6 amid market rally
summary: BGM stock has reached a new 52-week high of $16.16, boasting a market capitalization of $2.96 billion, amidst a broader market rally. InvestingPro analysis indicates the stock is trading above its Fair Value with a "GREAT" financial health score despite negative earnings. The company recently announced several acquisitions to expand its AI capabilities and diversify its product ecosystem.

title: NVIDIA Partners With Novo Nordisk and DCAI to Advance Drug Discovery
summary: NVIDIA has announced a collaboration with Novo Nordisk and DCAI to advance drug discovery through innovative AI use cases, particularly leveraging the Gefion sovereign AI supercomputer. Novo Nordisk will utilize NVIDIA's AI platforms like BioNeMo, NIM, NeMo, and Omniverse to create customized AI models for early research, clinical development, and advanced simulation. This partnership aims to accelerate the development of new medicines, enhance research efficiency, and address complex R&D challenges in healthcare.

title: Supermicro Unveils Industry's Broadest Enterprise AI Solution Portfolio for NVIDIA Blackwell Architecture to Accelerate AI Factory Deployments in European Market
summary: Supermicro has unveiled an expanded portfolio of over 30 enterprise AI solutions designed for the NVIDIA Blackwell Architecture, targeting the European market. These solutions, including air and liquid-cooled NVIDIA HGX B200 and GB200 NVL72 systems, aim to accelerate AI factory deployments and reduce implementation timelines for European organizations. Supermicro emphasizes its first-to-market advantage, global manufacturing capabilities, and advanced liquid cooling technologies to bolster AI initiatives across the continent.

title: Oracle and NVIDIA Help Enterprises and Developers Accelerate AI Innovation
summary: Oracle has expanded its collaboration with NVIDIA to accelerate AI innovation, making NVIDIA AI Enterprise available natively through the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Console. This integration allows customers to easily access over 160 AI tools and leverage NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 systems on OCI Supercluster with up to 131,072 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs. Oracle is also one of the first hyperscalers to integrate with NVIDIA DGX Cloud Lepton, connecting developers with global GPU compute resources.

title: How to weigh up companies after a big share price fall
summary: This article explores how investors should evaluate companies after a significant share price decline, drawing on research by Michael Mauboussin. It highlights the frequency of major drawdowns and the low recovery rate for many stocks, while also providing six key questions investors should ask to identify potential winners and avoid losers in such scenarios.

title: Bernstein Maintains NVIDIA(NVDA.US) With Buy Rating, Maintains Target Price $185
summary: Bernstein analyst Stacy Rasgon has reiterated a "Buy" rating for NVIDIA (NVDA.US), maintaining the target price at $185. This assessment is based on TipRanks data, highlighting the analyst's historical success rate and average return. The information provided is for informational purposes and not an investment recommendation.

title: Solve the AI Stock-Picking Burden With This ETF
summary: The article highlights the Invesco Top QQQ ETF (QBIG) as a solution for investors seeking AI exposure without the burden of individual stock-picking. QBIG comprises the "Magnificent Seven" and Broadcom, offering viable AI ties and long-term growth potential. Morningstar analysis suggests that while all Magnificent Seven stocks are innovative, Alphabet (GOOGL) stands out as an undervalued option for AI investing within the fund.

title: SK, AWS to build South Korea’s largest, multibillion-dollar AI data center
summary: SK Group and Amazon Web Services (AWS) are collaborating to build South Korea's largest AI data center, a 103-megawatt facility in Ulsan, equipped with 60,000 GPUs. This multibillion-dollar project, involving various SK subsidiaries and a significant investment from AWS, aims to establish a leading AI hub in Northeast Asia. The strategic location near SK Gas's power plant ensures a reliable energy supply, highlighting the growing competition in the AI computing market despite strong local players.

title: Nvidia could become a nearly $5 trillion company. Here’s how.
summary: Barclays analysts have raised their price target for Nvidia to $200, suggesting the company's market capitalization could reach $4.9 trillion, up from its current $3.5 trillion. This optimistic outlook is driven by the anticipated ramp-up of Nvidia's Blackwell artificial-intelligence platform. Analysts believe Nvidia has the most significant potential upside within their coverage for the second half of the year.

title: Nvidia could become a nearly $5 trillion company. Here’s how.
summary: Barclays analysts have raised their price target for Nvidia to $200, indicating a potential 38% increase in its stock price and a market capitalization of nearly $5 trillion. This optimistic outlook is driven by the company's ramp-up of its Blackwell artificial-intelligence platform. Analysts believe Nvidia has the most upside potential among their coverage for the second half of the year.

title: Texas Instruments injects $60B into U.S. chip manufacturing
summary: Texas Instruments announced a $60 billion plan to bolster domestic semiconductor manufacturing across seven facilities in Utah and Texas, marking the largest effort by a single U.S. company. This investment aims to create a domestic supply chain for chips used in various electronics and is expected to generate 60,000 new U.S. jobs through partnerships with companies like Nvidia, Apple, Ford, and SpaceX. While the initiative is substantial for the semiconductor supply, industry analysts note that realizing gains from increased manufacturing will take time.

title: Texas Instruments commits $60B to domestic chip manufacturing
summary: Texas Instruments plans to invest over $60 billion in domestic chip manufacturing, building seven fabrication facilities across Texas and Utah. This initiative, supported by $1.6 billion in CHIPS Act funding, aims to produce foundational semiconductors for major tech and automotive companies like Apple, Ford, and Nvidia. The investment addresses rising compute demand driven by AI adoption and geopolitical considerations to boost U.S. chip production.

title: Forget Monthly Dividends, These 5 ETFs Pay Investors Every Week
summary: This article highlights several ETFs that offer weekly dividend payments, catering to investors seeking regular income. It details specific ETFs like AAPL WeeklyPay (AAPW), NVDA WeeklyPay (NVDW), PLTR WeeklyPay (PLTW), TSLA WeeklyPay (TSLW), and the Weekly T-Bill ETF (WEEK), outlining their expense ratios, distribution rates, and underlying investments, which often include swap agreements and major tech stocks. The article also mentions the YieldMax AI & Tech Portfolio Option Income ETF (GPTY) as another option for weekly income.

title: $1,000 in AGG Could Turn Into $4,200
summary: The iShares Core U.S. Aggregate Bond ETF (AGG) is a major bond ETF with over $126 billion in assets under management, offering broad exposure to U.S. investment-grade bonds. While its historical average annual return has been around 3.1%, the current higher interest rate environment suggests a potential yield to maturity of almost 4.8%, which could turn a $1,000 investment into over $4,200 in 30 years. Investing in AGG helps diversify portfolios, generate income, and reduce risk and volatility, making it a valuable component for a balanced investment strategy despite lower return potential compared to stocks.

title: Semiconductor Stocks Retreat as U.S. Plans to Revoke Export Waivers
summary: Semiconductor stocks declined after a report indicated the U.S. Commerce Department plans to revoke waivers for South Korean and Taiwanese chipmakers, impacting companies like Samsung, SK Hynix, and TSMC. This move aims to restrict China's technological advancements but risks straining U.S. relations with key allies and potentially disrupting global supply chains. The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index fell 0.8%, with companies like Lam Research, Nvidia, Intel, Broadcom, and Qualcomm seeing their shares trade lower.

title: QQQ Is a Great Choice for Most, but I Like VGT ETF Better
summary: This article compares two popular ETFs, Invesco QQQ (QQQ) and Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT), focusing on diversification, expense ratios, and historical returns. While QQQ offers broader diversification, VGT specializes in tech stocks with a lower expense ratio and historically higher returns. The author suggests VGT for investors prioritizing maximum returns, provided their overall portfolio is diversified, while QQQ is recommended for those seeking greater diversification and slightly lower risk.

title: Why Cathie Wood's Flagship Ark Innovation ETF Is Finally Booming Again.
summary: Cathie Wood's flagship ARK Innovation ETF (ARKK) has experienced a resurgence since last October, after struggling for years and missing out on the AI boom. This recent boom is attributed to holdings such as Circle, Robinhood, Palantir, and Tesla, indicating a shift in the ETF's performance drivers. The article highlights ARKK's underperformance compared to the S&P 500 in previous years despite the broader market's gains in AI and Nvidia.

title: Ault Alliance Announces that Sentinum, its Wholly Owned Subsidiary, has Mined 552 Bitcoin in 2024 and 2,894 Bitcoin Since Inception
summary: Ault Alliance's subsidiary, Sentinum, has mined 552 Bitcoin in 2024 and a total of 2,894 Bitcoin since its inception, solidifying its position in the cryptocurrency mining industry. The company plans to expand its data center operations in Michigan into a hyperscale facility and explore additional power availability in Montana, with a strategic refocus towards AI-driven data centers under the new name Hyperscale Data, Inc. Ault Alliance aims to provide regular updates on its Bitcoin mining results quarterly and emphasizes the long-term revenue potential of AI-driven data centers.

title: Double-Leverage Bitcoin's Rise With This Crypto Industry ETF
summary: The Direxion Daily Crypto Industry Bull 2X Shares (LMBO) ETF offers investors a way to capitalize on Bitcoin's bullish momentum by investing in companies within the crypto sphere. This fund focuses on businesses involved in distributed ledger and decentralized payment technology, including blockchain and DeFi, rather than directly holding cryptocurrencies. It provides a less volatile approach to cryptocurrency exposure with companies like Visa, Mastercard, AMD, and Nvidia as top holdings.

title: Supermicro’s stock falls hard on $2B convertible notes offering
summary: Super Micro Computer Inc. saw its stock drop by almost 10% after announcing a $2 billion convertible note offering maturing in 2030, despite the company's strong performance driven by AI growth. The offering is intended for general corporate purposes and business expansion, with $200 million earmarked for stock buybacks from note issuers. While the conversion could dilute existing shares, analysts view the offering as a bullish signal for Supermicro's belief in future growth.

title: Jeff Kagan: IBM is a quiet choice in quantum computing and watsonx AI
summary: Jeff Kagan discusses IBM's position as a leading contender in quantum computing, despite its past marketing challenges with Watson AI. He highlights IBM's long history of innovation and the company's efforts to reboot its AI offerings with watsonx, while also emphasizing the significant but often confusing potential of quantum computing for investors. Kagan advises investors to stay informed about both AI and quantum computing as leadership positions in these rapidly evolving fields may shift.

title: CFRA has upgraded AMD (AMD.US) rating due to optimism about its open-source AI software progress and potential return to the Chinese market.
summary: CFRA upgraded AMD's stock rating from "Buy" to "Strong Buy," significantly raising the target price to $165, due to optimism surrounding AMD's open-source AI software progress and potential return to the Chinese market. This upgrade is driven by anticipated shifts in the competitive landscape with NVIDIA, the upcoming MI400x AI accelerator, and AMD's expanding customer ecosystem with its ROCm framework. Analyst Angelo Zino also predicts a robust recovery in the GPU server market, further boosting AMD's medium to long-term prospects.

title: IonQ (NYSE:IONQ) Achieves Quantum Leap In Simulating Fundamental Physics With New Quantum Technique
summary: IonQ has made a significant breakthrough by simulating neutrinoless double-beta decay using its quantum computer, signaling new capabilities in fundamental physics. This achievement, alongside collaborations with AstraZeneca and NVIDIA, contributed to a 73% stock surge in the last quarter. While the company forecasts annual revenue growth of 41%, investors should monitor its volatile share price, insider selling, and profitability concerns.

title: eToro Group Ltd. (ETOR) Stock Is Very Popular Among Young People, Says Jim Cramer

title: How AI Factories Can Help Relieve Grid Stress
summary: Emerald AI, an NVIDIA Inception startup, is developing a software platform called Emerald Conductor that enables AI factories to reduce power consumption during peak grid demand while maintaining performance. This AI-powered system orchestrates workloads across data centers, allowing for flexible power usage, which can help bring new data centers online sooner by leveraging existing energy infrastructure and integrating renewable energy more effectively. The company recently demonstrated a 25% power reduction during a grid stress event in Phoenix, Arizona, and announced over $24 million in seed funding.

title: Nvidia shares come roaring back: 2 ASX ETFs to benefit from the resurgence of AI

The maker of autonomous industrial vehicles also recently entered a collaboration agreement with Nvidia (NVDA) and moved to a larger headquarters to meet increasing demand. Despite Wednesday's 12% advance, Cyngn's stock is still down nearly 90% in 2025.

Despite concerns, Deutsche Bank maintains a 'Buy' rating on Monolithic, and analysts remain optimistic about Nvidia's upcoming Q3 earnings report.

NetApp is also evolving its market focus to include data engineers and security leaders alongside traditional CIOs and storage administrators.

title: Nvidia briefly becomes the first $4 trillion company. How it beat Microsoft and Apple to the crown.
summary: Nvidia briefly achieved an intraday market capitalization of $4 trillion on Wednesday, making it the first U.S. company to reach this milestone. Although its stock pulled back to close just below the $4 trillion mark, Nvidia still set a new record for the highest closing market cap ever at $3.974 trillion, surpassing Apple's previous record. The company's stock touched $164.42 intraday but ended the day at $162.88, slightly below the $163.93 needed to close above the $4 trillion threshold.

title: Nvidia's $4 trillion milestone caps rise of stock market behemoth
summary: Nvidia Corp reached a $4 trillion market valuation, highlighting its significant importance in the stock market and the technology sector, driven by a massive surge in its stock price since late 2022. This milestone gives Nvidia the largest weight in the S&P 500 and reflects the growing influence of tech companies, which now comprise one-third of the S&P 500's market value. Other tech giants like Microsoft and Apple are also nearing or exceeding the $3 trillion mark, underscoring the dominance of technology in current market valuations.

title: A Practical Guide to AI ETFs
summary: Rene Reyna of Invesco discusses strategic investment in AI ETFs, emphasizing it as a satellite strategy (5-10% of a portfolio) to capitalize on AI's potential without overexposure. The article suggests this partnership could elevate Universal Robots further in the industrial automation market.

summary: Nvidia has achieved a record-breaking $4 trillion market capitalization, becoming the first company to reach this valuation thanks to the booming demand for AI hardware and software. Despite new competition, Morningstar analysts believe Nvidia will remain dominant in the AI market, with the company currently rated as fairly valued.

title: Nvidia says it will resume H20 AI chip sales to China 'soon,' following U.S. government assurances

title: AMD: Raising Fair Value Estimate as Ban on Firm’s Sales into China Will Be Reversed

This reversal allows AMD to compete in China's AI market alongside NVIDIA, leading to a reinsertion of $1.2 billion in 2025 revenue and $2.8 billion in 2029 AI GPU estimates for AMD. While AMD's shares appear modestly overvalued, the decision signals a potential shift in AI policy toward China, with implications for U.S. chipmakers.

title: Nvidia Boss Expects to Get First H20 China Export Licenses Soon
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expects to receive the first US licenses for exporting H20 AI chips to China soon, allowing the company to resume sales of these crucial components. Huang stated that US officials have assured Nvidia of rapid approval, emphasizing the company's eagerness to fulfill existing orders for the H20 chips. This development marks a significant step for Nvidia in navigating US export controls to its key semiconductor market in China.

(HUT), both holdings in the CoinShares Valkyrie Bitcoin Miners ETF (WGMI), are leveraging their computing competencies to offer AI-related services, with significant deals and partnerships demonstrating the success of this strategic shift. Torsten Sløk of Apollo Global Management notes that the top 10 S&P 500 companies are more overvalued now than during the 1990s IT bubble, suggesting a major market crash could be triggered if these inflated promises are not met. Other prominent figures like Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and billionaire Ray Dalio have also expressed similar concerns regarding a potential AI bubble.

Investors are advised to be cautious of macro risks and consider individual undervalued stocks over broad growth funds.

title: Super Micro Computer stock falls as much as 16% after quarterly results, profit forecast miss estimates

Despite the recent dip, shares were still up over 50% year-to-date as investors continue to flock to AI-themed stocks.

title: Trump demands resignation of Intel CEO over China ties

This demand comes amid Trump's broader pressure on the semiconductor industry, including a threat of a 100% tariff on imported chips, and follows concerns raised by Sen. Tom Cotton regarding Tan's investments in Chinese companies with links to the People's Liberation Army. Intel's stock dropped over 2% following the news, further complicating the company's efforts to catch up with competitors in the AI race.

The integration promotes unified workflows and empowers engineers to innovate faster and validate autonomous systems with greater speed and confidence.

title: Super Micro Stock Falls 23%: Falling Knife Or Buying Opportunity?
summary: Super Micro Computer stock (NASDAQ: SMCI) has dropped significantly after a tough Q4 2025 earnings report, missing estimates and showing margin contraction despite its strong position in AI servers. The company faces increasing competition from Dell, HPE, and Lenovo, which are impacting its revenue growth and profitability. Furthermore, SMCI has twice slashed its full-year revenue guidance and consistently missed earnings estimates, raising concerns about its valuation and corporate governance.

title: NVIDIA Options Spot-On: On August 13th, 2.35 Million Contracts Were Traded, With 19.79 Million Open Interest
summary: On August 13th, NVIDIA (NVDA.US) experienced significant options trading volume, with 2.35 million contracts traded. Call options constituted 64.02% of the total, and total open interest reached 19.79 million contracts, a 100.23% increase from the 30-day average. A notable trade involved 3,000 call options with a strike price of $115.00 expiring on September 19th, 2025, generating $20.18 million in turnover.

title: Leverage Shares launches 2x capped accelerated monthly ETFs - NVDO, PLOO, COIO, MSOO, TSLO: key trading takeaways
summary: Leverage Shares has introduced a new line of 2x capped accelerated monthly ETFs (NVDO, PLOO, COIO, MSOO, TSLO) designed to offer amplified exposure to underlying assets like Nvidia and Tesla, while incorporating monthly acceleration features and risk-management caps. These ETFs amplify volatility and are intended for short-term trading, as their leveraged and capped monthly structures can behave differently from standard ETFs due to compounding and reset mechanics. The launch presents opportunities for cross-market trading strategies, particularly in how these products could influence crypto sentiment and correlated assets such as Bitcoin and Ethereum.

title: $30M Cash Position: Digi Power X Achieves First Profitable Quarter, Plans NVIDIA B200 AI Infrastructure
summary: Digi Power X (NASDAQ: DGXX) reported a significant financial turnaround in Q2 2025, achieving its first profitable quarter with positive Adjusted EBITDA and eliminating its 'going concern' risk. The company strengthened its balance sheet with $30 million in cash, Bitcoin, and Ethereum, and plans to deploy its first NVIDIA B200 GPU cluster by Q1 2026 for AI infrastructure. This fiscal improvement positions Digi Power X for expanding into the AI market.

title: Applied Materials Falls After China Troubles Weigh on Forecast
summary: Applied Materials, a major American chipmaking equipment producer, saw its shares plunge after a disappointing sales and profit forecast, raising concerns about the impact of the U.S.-China trade dispute. The company cited reduced demand from China and delays in export approvals, along with large customers postponing purchases due to economic uncertainties. Despite the short-term issues, CEO Gary Dickerson expressed optimism about long-term demand for computing power and the new administration's focus on increasing semiconductor supply in the U.S.

title: Now We’re Talking: NVIDIA Releases Open Dataset, Models for Multilingual Speech AI
summary: NVIDIA has released a new open dataset called Granary, featuring approximately 1 million hours of audio, to address the scarcity of data for multilingual speech AI. This dataset was used to train high-accuracy and high-throughput AI models, NVIDIA Canary-1b-v2 and NVIDIA Parakeet-tdt-0.6b-v3, for audio transcription and translation across 25 European languages. These tools aim to help developers scale AI applications, support global users, and foster innovation in speech AI by providing essential resources, especially for underrepresented languages.

title: Applied Materials sinks 14% on weak guidance due to China demand
summary: Applied Materials shares plunged 14% after the semiconductor equipment maker issued weak guidance due to demand pressures in China, falling short of revenue and earnings per share estimates. This weakness is attributed to macroeconomic pressures, trade issues, and a slowdown in spending from China clients after a period of rapid manufacturing. Despite the weak guidance, the company did top its third-quarter earnings and revenue estimates.

title: AI Powered ETF AIEQ Might be a Rare Case of Artificial Intelligence Being Useless
summary: This article evaluates the AI-powered ETF AIEQ, questioning its effectiveness despite combining artificial intelligence with the ETF structure. The author argues that AIEQ largely mirrors the Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQ) in its portfolio holdings but underperforms it, generating "negative alpha." The analysis suggests that AIEQ's marketing as innovative doesn't translate into superior investment returns compared to established tech-laden ETFs.

title: Top Nvidia Shareholders
summary: This article details the top individual and institutional shareholders of Nvidia Corp. (NVDA), identifying founder Jensen Huang, Mark A. Stevens, and Tench Coxe as key individual shareholders, and Vanguard Group Inc., BlackRock Inc., and FMR LLC as leading institutional owners. It highlights Nvidia's significant growth and market capitalization, driven by its leadership in visual computing, AI, and gaming, and emphasizes the substantial stakes held by both insiders and major asset management firms.

title: SCHB vs SCHD: ETF Showdown at $62.15 vs $77.45 – Growth or Dividend Yield?
summary: This article compares two Schwab ETFs, SCHB and SCHD, highlighting their differing investment strategies: growth versus dividend yield. SCHB focuses on broad market growth with a heavy tech weighting, while SCHD prioritizes dividend-paying companies for stable income. The analysis covers their performance, volatility, sector allocation, and tax efficiencies, concluding with a "Buy" recommendation for SCHB and a "Hold" for SCHD based on current market conditions and investor goals.

title: Is Nvidia a Republican or a Democrat? These political ETFs have voted.
summary: This article explores how politically-focused ETFs characterize Nvidia. It notes that Nvidia, a leader in AI, is a significant holding in both the Unusual Whales Subversive Republican Trading ETF and the American Conservative Values ETF. The author questions the efficacy of mixing investing with partisan politics, suggesting these ETFs may not be a sound investment strategy.

title: Is Nvidia a Republican or a Democrat? These political ETFs have voted.
summary: This article discusses the emerging trend of politically focused ETFs and questions whether a company like Nvidia can be labeled as Republican or Democrat based on these investment vehicles. It highlights that Nvidia (NVDA) is a major holding in both the Unusual Whales Subversive Republican Trading ETF (GOP) and the American Conservative Values ETF (ACVF), suggesting these ETFs attempt to align investments with political ideologies. The author ultimately advises against combining investing and partisan politics.

title: Avoid Dividend Growth Disappointment
summary: This article discusses how the WisdomTree US Quality Dividend Growth ETF (DGRW) offers a potentially more rewarding dividend growth strategy compared to some traditional dividend growth indexes. It highlights that DGRW's emphasis on quality metrics and its exposure to technology and communication services stocks, including newer dividend payers like Alphabet and Meta, help it keep pace with the broader market and avoid the underperformance seen in other dividend growth indices.

title: Nvidia's Upcoming Earnings Report Puts Direxion's NVDA-Focused Bull And Bear Funds In The Limelight
summary: Nvidia's upcoming second-quarter earnings report on August 27th is highly anticipated due to the company's strong performance in AI, but also faces exceptionally high expectations. Direxion offers two ETFs, Direxion Daily NVDA Bull 2X Shares (NVDU) and Direxion Daily NVDA Bear 1X Shares (NVDD), that allow traders to bet on Nvidia's stock movement without using options, though they carry unique risks like increased volatility and potential value decay if held longer than one day. Analysts have varying outlooks, with some maintaining a "Buy" rating and a price target of $220, despite concerns about Nvidia's high price-to-sales ratio and near-term volatility.

title: Tuesday was a key day, as momentum plays flopped while value stocks rallied. But was it a shift or a blip?
summary: Tuesday witnessed a significant market shift where value stocks outperformed momentum plays, marking one of the largest such reversals in a year. Popular momentum stocks like Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices, Oracle, and Palantir struggled, while the iShares MSCI USA Value Factor ETF saw a substantial gain relative to its momentum counterpart. The market reacted not so much to overall index movement, but to this underlying change in investment trends.

title: Oracle Rides Major Deals With OpenAI, Nvidia to Turn Around Cloud Business
summary: Oracle's cloud computing business, once dismissed by chairman Larry Ellison, has become a significant driver of the company's success and Ellison's personal wealth. Major deals with companies like OpenAI and Nvidia have fueled the growth of Oracle's cloud infrastructure unit, leading to a substantial increase in its stock price. This turnaround highlights a dramatic shift in Oracle's strategy and market position in the cloud industry.

title: Nvidia’s Earnings Could Make Or Break Momentum ETFs - NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA)
summary: NVIDIA Corp.'s upcoming earnings report is poised to significantly impact momentum ETFs, such as the iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF (BATS: MTUM), which have shown volatile performance related to the AI trade in 2025. A recent decline in Goldman Sachs's High Beta Momentum basket, featuring stocks like Nvidia, suggests a potential reversal, with historical data indicating recoveries after steep drops. However, concerns about high valuations and profit-taking in AI leaders, coupled with China's competitive landscape, add risk to future rebounds, making Nvidia's report a critical determinant for these ETFs.

title: HPE Stock Surges Amidst AI Advancements
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) stock surged by 3.49% due to strategic advancements in AI, including new servers with NVIDIA GPUs and partnerships like the one with Subaru for AI-driven automotive safety. Deutsche Bank increased its price target for HPE shares to $26, boosted by the Juniper acquisition and a substantial UK court ruling awarding HPE $944M. The company's focus on AI and strategic collaborations positions it for potential future growth despite recent mixed financial results.

title: Nvidia is in talks with Trump administration about new chip for China, company’s CEO says
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced the company is discussing a new AI data center chip for China, potentially called "B30A," with the Trump administration. This chip would be less powerful than Nvidia's top models, adhering to U.S. national security restrictions, and follows the recent approval of H20 chips sales to China with a 15% tax. Nvidia is also addressing Chinese authorities' concerns about security backdoors in its chips.

title: Enterprise storage driven by HPE and Nvidia partnership
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. and Nvidia Corp. have expanded their partnership to focus on AI-optimized storage, aiming to reshape enterprise storage for the evolving AI world. This collaboration introduces data intelligence into the storage platform, enabling context-rich, AI-ready data integration and enhancing object storage capabilities for AI workloads. The initiative also seeks to drive operational efficiency with remote direct memory access transfers, significantly boosting performance for AI applications.

title: US to take 10% equity stake in Intel, in Trump's latest corporate move
summary: The U.S. government, under President Donald Trump, will acquire a 9.9% equity stake in Intel for $8.9 billion, converting government grants from the CHIPS Act and the Secure Enclave program into an ownership share. This move, aiming to bolster Intel's struggling foundry business and ensure domestic chip production, reflects a growing trend of unusual government intervention in corporate America. The deal comes after previous tensions between Trump and Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan, and analysts question if the cash infusion will be enough to help Intel catch up to competitors like TSMC and Nvidia.

title: Does Fed Rate Cut Hints Reinforce the Bull Case for Nelnet (NNI)?
summary: Shares of Nelnet (NNI), an education finance company, rose after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hinted at potential interest rate cuts. While lower rates could boost loan demand and investor sentiment, the article cautions that the news might not significantly alter short-term catalysts unless rate cuts materialize and benefit Nelnet's margins. Key risks like low return on equity and high valuation for NNI are still relevant.

title: NVIDIA Blackwell-Powered Jetson Thor Now Available, Accelerating the Age of General Robotics
summary: NVIDIA has announced the general availability of its NVIDIA Jetson AGX Thor developer kit and production modules, designed to power advanced robotics and physical AI. Powered by Blackwell GPUs, Jetson Thor delivers significantly higher AI compute and energy efficiency than its predecessor, enabling robots to have real-time, intelligent interactions. Industry leaders like Agility Robotics, Amazon Robotics, Boston Dynamics, and Figure are among the early adopters, praising its capabilities for running powerful AI models at the edge.

title: NVDA Earnings, AI Hype, and Cybersecurity Trends
summary: This article discusses key technology trends, including NVIDIA's upcoming earnings, the ongoing AI hype, and the growing importance of cybersecurity. It features insights from Ivana Delevska of Spear Invest, manager of the Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX), highlighting investments in AI, cybersecurity, and space technologies. The article touches on investor concerns about an AI bubble and the challenges of investing in the nascent space sector.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Was Dubbed 'Godfather of AI.' The Company Is Betting On These AI Stocks
summary: Nvidia, an AI chipmaking giant, also strategically invests in other AI companies, as revealed in its quarterly SEC Form 13-F filings. Key holdings include CoreWeave, an AI cloud computing provider, Arm Holdings, an AI chip designer, and Applied Digital among others. These investments highlight Nvidia's broader strategy within the artificial intelligence sector beyond its core chip manufacturing business.

title: Broadcom Inc. Partners with NVIDIA to Integrate Advanced AI Technology into VMware Cloud Foundation
summary: Broadcom Inc. announced a partnership with NVIDIA to integrate advanced AI technology, including NVIDIA Blackwell GPU architecture and high-speed networking, into VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF). This collaboration aims to empower enterprises and cloud providers to scale AI model development in private clouds while preserving VCF's operational reliability. Key benefits include support for latest GPUs and networking, enabling efficient processing of generative and physical AI applications, all while maintaining core VCF functionalities such as vMotion and High Availability.

title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Second Quarter Fiscal 2026
summary: NVIDIA reported strong second-quarter fiscal 2026 results with revenue of $46.7 billion, up 56% year-over-year, driven by record Data Center revenue of $41.1 billion. The company's Blackwell Data Center revenue significantly grew, and NVIDIA announced a new $60 billion share repurchase authorization. NVIDIA also provided an optimistic outlook for the third quarter, projecting revenue of $54.0 billion.

title: Nvidia Earnings Live: Results Come in Slightly Above Wall Street Expectations; Stock Slips in Extended Trading
summary: Nvidia reported Q2 results slightly above Wall Street expectations, with revenue soaring 56% to a record $46.7 billion, but data center revenue and lower-end guidance for the current quarter fell short of estimates, leading to a 3% stock dip in after-hours trading. Investors are closely watching CEO Jensen Huang's comments on the company's outlook, China business, and next-generation product pipeline, particularly the forthcoming Rubin platform and the potential $50 billion China market opportunity. Despite these mixed results and ongoing China trade policy headwinds, analysts remain overwhelmingly bullish on Nvidia's long-term prospects due to strong AI demand.

title: Nvidia Isn't the Only Way to Profit From the AI Boom
summary: While Nvidia has shown incredible growth and dominates the AI chip market, its stock is highly priced for perfection, requiring flawless performance each quarter. For investors seeking broad exposure to the AI boom without over-reliance on a single company, the Invesco PHLX Semiconductor ETF (SOXQ) offers diversification across 30 major semiconductor companies, including Nvidia, at a lower expense ratio. The insatiable demand for advanced semiconductors suggests the entire sector is a promising investment avenue, with many companies demonstrating strong performance and more attractive valuations than Nvidia.

title: Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, Snowflake
summary: This article details revised ratings and price targets from Wall Street securities analysts for various US-listed companies, including Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, and Snowflake. Key highlights show increased price targets for Nvidia and Snowflake, reflecting positive analyst sentiment. The report provides a comprehensive list of these revisions, offering insights into recent analyst actions across diverse sectors.

title: ProShares S&P 500 Dynamic Buffer ETF (FB) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the ProShares S&P 500 Dynamic Buffer ETF (FB), including its current stock price, dividend yield, and key holdings as of August 31, 2025. It highlights the ETF's top five holdings, which include NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms, and also presents various performance metrics and fundamental data.

title: Tech Valuations Surprisingly Accommodating
summary: Despite the significant returns of the Nasdaq-100 Index and the Magnificent Seven stocks, the overall tech sector currently trades at a slight discount to its long-term averages, supported by strong earnings power. The article highlights the potential for AI and cybersecurity to boost ETFs like QQQ and QQQM, with these ETFs offering exposure to both the Magnificent Seven and other promising tech companies. It further suggests that some companies outside the Magnificent Seven within these ETFs offer attractive valuations and long-term growth prospects.

title: Analog Devices Gandeng NVIDIA Jetson Thor untuk Robot Humanoid Generasi Baru
summary: Analog Devices (ADI) dan NVIDIA berkolaborasi untuk mempercepat pengembangan robot humanoid dan autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) menggunakan NVIDIA Jetson Thor. Kolaborasi ini menggabungkan kemampuan ADI dalam sensor, kontrol gerak, dan konektivitas dengan performa komputasi AI dari Jetson Thor. Tujuannya adalah untuk mendorong robot berbasis penalaran dari simulasi ke penerapan dunia nyata, mendefinisikan ulang standar robotika dengan kemampuan fisik dan penalaran yang lebih canggih.

title: Intel Ousted From Dow Jones By Rival Nvidia
summary: Intel, a microprocessor manufacturer with a significant presence in Oregon, has been removed from the Dow Jones Industrial Average after a 25-year run, replaced by rival Nvidia. This change reflects Intel's struggles in the AI-powered chipmaking market and its recent financial losses, while Nvidia's market value has surged due to demand for AI accelerator chips. The move by S&P Global aims to ensure the Dow Jones more accurately represents the semiconductor industry.

title: Nvidia backs $85M round for AI search startup Exa
summary: Exa Labs Inc., a startup specializing in an AI search engine, has successfully raised $85 million in a Series B funding round led by Benchmark, with participation from Nvidia Corp., Y Combinator, and Lightspeed. This investment, valuing Exa at $700 million, will be utilized to expand its hardware infrastructure, particularly its graphics card cluster, and to scale its indexing and processing capabilities. Exa's technology enables AI models to efficiently browse and extract information from the web, supporting various enterprise AI applications.

title: Nvidia Just Went Quantum—And ETFs Are Scrambling To Catch Up
summary: Nvidia made a significant quantum computing move by participating in a $600 million funding round for Quantinuum, a Honeywell-owned company, signaling strong confidence in quantum technology's commercial viability. This investment, alongside other major players, reinforces Nvidia's hardware development towards quantum-ready workloads. While pure-play quantum computing investments are scarce, ETFs like Defiance Quantum ETF (QTUM) and broader innovation funds offer investors indirect exposure to this evolving sector.

title: Guidance da Broadcom decepciona investidores apesar do crescimento em IA
summary: Broadcom's revenue forecast for the current period, despite significant growth in AI-related sales, failed to impress investors who anticipated a greater boost from the AI boom. The company projected fourth-quarter sales of approximately US$17.4 billion, slightly above analyst estimates but below some higher expectations. This conservative outlook comes after a period of strong stock performance and amid intensified competition in the AI semiconductor market.

title: Should Savvy Investors Be Watching the Dan Ives ETF in 2025?
summary: The article discusses the Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF (NYSEMKT: IVES), which invests in artificial intelligence stocks and is inspired by analyst Dan Ives' research. Launched in June, the ETF has appreciated by 11% and now manages over $500 million in assets, suggesting it could be a valuable addition to a savvy investor's portfolio in 2025 for broad AI exposure, especially for those who prefer ETFs over individual stock picking.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Technology Companies: Gitlab (GTLB) and Nvidia (NVDA)
summary: Analysts from Bank of America Securities and Phillip Securities have issued bullish ratings on Gitlab (GTLB) and Nvidia (NVDA) respectively. Gitlab received a Buy rating with a $72.00 price target, while Nvidia was also rated Buy with a $185.00 price target. The consensus for Gitlab is a Moderate Buy with a 25.6% upside, and for Nvidia, it's a Strong Buy with a 23.4% upside.

title: Is the iShares Semiconductor ETF Worth Investing in for the Long Haul?
summary: The iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) has outperformed the S&P 500 over the past five years, driven by its focus on leading semiconductor companies involved in AI. While providing access to top tech stocks with growth potential, the ETF is not highly diversified and carries significant volatility due to elevated valuations and a high beta. For growth-oriented investors comfortable with short-term volatility and a long-term outlook, SOXX could be a solid investment.

title: The U.S. government is taking a stake in Intel. It’s rare — and it has some risks
summary: The U.S. government, under the Trump administration, has taken a rare 10% equity stake in chipmaker Intel, converting previous grants into ownership. This unprecedented move outside of a direct economic crisis is driven by competition with China and the global race for artificial intelligence, aiming to bolster domestic high-end microchip manufacturing. While analysts see Intel (INTC) as the U.S.'s best bet in this sector, concerns remain about potential political pressures and inefficiencies stemming from government involvement.

title: Beamr to Demonstrate Live 4K Quality Enhancement with NVIDIA Holoscan for Media
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. will demonstrate real-time, AI-powered 4K quality enhancement for live events using NVIDIA Holoscan for Media at IBC 2025. This solution efficiently upscales low-resolution content to 4K and then optimizes it with Beamr's Content-Adaptive Bitrate technology, reducing CDN costs by up to 50% while preserving visual quality. The demonstration addresses the challenge broadcasters face in balancing premium quality with cost efficiency for live sports and music concerts.

title: 50% Cost Savings: Beamr's AI Tech Transforms Live 720p Sports to 4K Quality Using NVIDIA Holoscan
summary: Beamr (NASDAQ: BMR) announced a demonstration of its real-time AI-powered 4K quality enhancement solution at IBC 2025 in Amsterdam. This technology, integrated with NVIDIA Holoscan for Media, can upscale low-resolution content to live 4K while crucially reducing CDN costs by up to 50%. The solution combines NVIDIA RTX Video Super Resolution with Beamr's Content-Adaptive Bitrate technology for optimized and efficient distribution of enhanced streams.

title: NVIDIA Unveils Rubin CPX: A New Class of GPU Designed for Massive-Context Inference
summary: NVIDIA announced the Rubin CPX, a new class of GPU designed for massive-context inference, enabling AI systems to handle tasks like million-token coding and generative video. This GPU, part of the NVIDIA Vera Rubin NVL144 CPX platform, offers significant AI performance and memory bandwidth improvements, aiming to transform applications like AI coding assistants and video processing. Industry innovators like Cursor, Runway, and Magic are already exploring its potential for accelerating their AI applications.

title: Nvidia Unveils New Chip System for AI Video, Software Creation
summary: Nvidia, a key player in AI computing, announced a new product called Rubin CPX, designed for advanced tasks like video generation and software creation. This new chip system, set to debut in late 2026, will be available as cards for existing servers or as discrete computers for data centers. The announcement highlights Nvidia's continued innovation in powering the artificial intelligence boom.

title: ProShares Expands Lineup with ETFs Targeting 2x Daily Returns of Coinbase, Nvidia, Palantir, and Tesla
summary: ProShares has expanded its product lineup with new single stock ETFs designed to target 2x daily returns of Coinbase (COIA), NVIDIA (NVDB), Palantir (PLTA), and Tesla (TSLI). These new funds allow investors to magnify the daily returns of these transformative companies. ProShares, as the world's largest provider of geared ETFs, aims to provide strategic and tactical opportunities for investors.

title: Oracle salta 36%, “ganha” US$ 244 bi e tem melhor sessão de 1992 com ânimo sobre IA
summary: Oracle's shares soared 36%, adding US$244 billion to its market value and marking its best session since 1992, driven by an aggressive outlook for its cloud business and strong demand for AI infrastructure. The company is emerging as a key provider of computational capacity for AI, signing massive contracts including a commitment with OpenAI for 4.5 gigawatts of data center capacity. Oracle's CEO, Safra Catz, projects significant growth in its cloud infrastructure unit, despite high investment costs in data centers.

title: Super Micro Computer, Inc. - Supermicro Begins Volume Shipments of NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra Systems and Rack Plug-and-Play Data Center-Scale Solutions
summary: Supermicro announced the broad availability and volume shipments of its NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra solutions, including Plug-and-Play-ready NVIDIA HGX B300 systems and GB300 NVL72 racks. These pre-validated solutions are designed for rapid deployment of high-performance AI infrastructure for various AI applications, optimized for efficiency and performance at scale. Supermicro's Data Center Building Block Solutions (DCBBS) offer turn-key delivery and services to accelerate AI factory deployment, showcasing the company's commitment to cutting-edge AI technology.

title: Vanguard's VUG ETF: The Ultimate Growth ETF for Your Portfolio
