summary: The Vanguard Growth ETF (VUG) is highlighted as a premier investment for growth-oriented portfolios, driven by its focus on large-cap companies at the forefront of innovation, particularly in AI and technology. The article details its top holdings like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple, its consistent outperformance against benchmarks such as the S&P 500, and its exceptionally low expense ratio. VUG is presented as a stable, diversified, and cost-effective vehicle for long-term wealth building, offering broad exposure to dynamic companies shaping the global economy.

title: BioSig Technologies Rebrands to Streamex Corp.
summary: BioSig Technologies has rebranded to Streamex Corp., effective September 12, 2025, with the new Nasdaq ticker symbol 'STEX'. This change follows a merger with Streamex Exchange Corporation and aims to expand the company's business model by integrating tokenization technology, particularly in the commodities market. Despite this strategic move, an AI analyst from TipRanks classifies the stock as Underperform due to significant financial difficulties.

title: Newegg Stock Soars: Buy Now?
summary: Newegg Commerce Inc. (NASDAQ: NEGG) stock has soared by 18.53% due to positive investor response to strategic gains in the first half of 2025, including a narrower net loss and increased sales. The company introduced a "Gamer Zone" and saw significant growth in GMV and net sales, along with insider buying, indicating strong confidence in its future performance and a promising recovery path.

title: Hudson Global Announces New Share Repurchase Program
summary: Hudson Global, operating as Star Equity Holdings, announced modifications to its 2025 CEO/CAO Incentive Compensation Plan, reducing annual officer compensation by approximately $700,000. The company also completed a $5 million share repurchase program and authorized a new $3 million initiative, signaling confidence in its future. TipRanks' AI Analyst assigned a "Neutral" rating to the stock, citing strong earnings calls and corporate events balanced by ongoing profitability challenges.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights NVIDIA, Meta Platforms, Alibaba Group and Medalist Diversified REIT
summary: This Zacks Analyst Blog highlights recent research reports on NVIDIA, Meta Platforms, Alibaba Group, and micro-cap Medalist Diversified REIT. It provides insights into their recent performance, financial data, and future prospects, including factors driving growth and potential headwinds. The article also references Zacks' investment performance and invites readers to access further stock-picking strategies.

title: IWY ETF Price at $270.12: Outperformance Driven by Mega-Cap Tech
summary: The iShares Russell Top 200 Growth ETF (IWY) has climbed to $270.12, showcasing significant outperformance with a 25.34% yearly gain driven by its concentrated holdings in mega-cap tech giants like NVIDIA and Microsoft. The ETF is positioned to benefit from the AI capital expenditure supercycle and is projected to reach the $300-$310 range within the next year, despite its premium valuation. Its strategic weighting methodology balances concentration risk while leveraging strong growth prospects from its top holdings.

title: NVIDIA and United Kingdom Build Nation’s AI Infrastructure and Ecosystem to Fuel Innovation, Economic Growth and Jobs
summary: NVIDIA is collaborating with the United Kingdom to build the nation's AI infrastructure, involving partners like Nscale, CoreWeave, and Microsoft, and an investment of up to £11 billion. This initiative includes deploying hundreds of thousands of NVIDIA Grace Blackwell GPUs, establishing AI factories, and boosting quantum computing and AI/robotics ecosystems. The goal is to accelerate the AI industrial revolution in the UK, fostering innovation, economic growth, and job creation.

title: Jacobs CEO Bob Pragada Talks Data Centers and Growth on CNBC’s Mad Money
summary: Jacobs CEO Bob Pragada appeared on CNBC’s Mad Money to discuss the company's growth strategy, particularly focusing on its expanding work in next-generation data centers to meet the demand for digital infrastructure. He highlighted Jacobs' comprehensive capabilities in infrastructure, energy, and water to address complex power and cooling needs, as well as collaborations with technology leaders like NVIDIA and the use of digital twins for optimization. Pragada underscored Jacobs' commitment to delivering innovative and sustainable solutions for evolving infrastructure and technology challenges.

title: Quanterix CFO Sriram buys $19,878 in company stock
summary: Quanterix CFO Vandana Sriram purchased 4,150 shares of the company's common stock for $19,878 on September 12, 2025, according to an SEC filing. This transaction brings Sriram's direct ownership to 87,200 shares, including restricted stock units, and occurs as the stock trades below its Fair Value despite recent gains. The purchase follows Quanterix's Q2 2025 earnings miss and a downgrade by Canaccord Genuity, though the company recently expanded its biomarker research capabilities with a new clinical laboratory permit in New York.

title: Dell Technologies: Silver Lake Partners IV sells $76.2 million in stock
summary: Silver Lake Group and its affiliates sold $76.2 million worth of Dell Technologies (NYSE:DELL) Class C Common Stock on September 15, 2025, with shares trading between $126.63 and $127.7. The company's stock has surged 36.5% in the past six months and is currently valued at $87.6 billion. Dell recently reported significant earnings, including $8.2 billion in AI server revenue, and increased its fiscal 2026 outlook.

title: NVIDIA Announces £2 Billion Investment in the United Kingdom AI Startup Ecosystem
summary: NVIDIA has announced a £2 billion investment in the United Kingdom's AI startup ecosystem. This capital injection aims to foster economic growth, support new AI companies and jobs, and enhance the U.K.'s global competitiveness in the AI market, particularly focusing on key hubs like London, Oxford, Cambridge, and Manchester. The initiative, in collaboration with several venture capital firms, seeks to provide crucial capital and advanced AI infrastructure to overcome current scaling challenges for U.K. AI startups.

title: Nvidia to invest $5B in Intel as part of new chip partnership
summary: Nvidia Corp. announced a $5 billion investment in Intel Corp. as part of a new chip development partnership. This collaboration will focus on both data center and consumer segments, with Intel creating custom CPUs for Nvidia graphics cards and PC processors with Nvidia chiplets. The deal gives Nvidia a significant stake in Intel and aims to accelerate enterprise AI adoption and expand Nvidia's reach into the PC ecosystem.

title: What you need to know about the government’s 10% stake in Intel
summary: The U.S. government has taken a 10% stake in Intel, a move that experts believe raises questions about its influence on other businesses and markets. This investment, unlike previous government interventions, is not to prevent an immediate corporate failure but to secure the supply of critical computer chips amid national security concerns. The decision has garnered both support and criticism, with debates centering on its economic implications and potential for politicization.

title: Oracle shares climb on reports it could ink $20B cloud deal with Meta
summary: Oracle shares climbed 4% following reports it is negotiating a potential $20 billion cloud infrastructure deal with Meta Platforms Inc. for AI training and inference. This news comes after a previous agreement with OpenAI for data center capacity and highlights Oracle's growing role in meeting the surging demand for AI infrastructure, contributing to an over 80% rise in its stock this year. Meta may also consider incorporating its internally developed AI chips into the proposed cloud architecture.

title: Why Top Investors Are Buying NVIDIA Corp (NVDA)
summary: Institutional investors significantly increased their holdings in NVIDIA Corp (NVDA) according to their latest 13F filings, driven by strong conviction in AI-driven growth. Notable increases came from Bridgewater Associates, Point72 Asset Management, Appaloosa LP, and Third Point LLC, among others. These moves highlight Wall Street's belief in NVIDIA's continued role as a cornerstone of AI and computing growth.

title: OpenAI and NVIDIA Announce Strategic Partnership to Deploy 10 Gigawatts of NVIDIA Systems
summary: OpenAI and NVIDIA have announced a strategic partnership to deploy at least 10 gigawatts of NVIDIA systems for OpenAI's next-generation AI infrastructure, representing millions of GPUs. NVIDIA intends to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI as these new systems are deployed, with the first gigawatt expected to be online in the second half of 2026. This collaboration aims to advance AI breakthroughs and empower people and businesses with scaled AI capabilities.

title: Digital Brands Group Accepted into NVIDIA Connect Program via Technology Arm
summary: Digital Brands Group (NASDAQ:DBGI) announced that its technology arm, Open Daily Technologies Inc., has been accepted into the NVIDIA Connect Program. This acceptance provides DBG with access to NVIDIA's AI/ML resources, engineering expertise, and global ecosystem, aiming to strengthen data protection, intellectual property security, and AI-driven innovation across its brands. The company plans to leverage these resources to accelerate the development of advanced AI solutions in e-commerce.

title: Analyst Says Nvidia ‘Getting Into’ Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Business With Intel Deal
summary: An analyst suggests that Nvidia's $5 billion investment in Intel signals its entry into Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)'s business, focusing on integrating GPUs and CPUs for better gaming, AI laptops, and accelerated processing units. This move involves leveraging Intel for System on Chips, connecting GPUs with Nvidia’s NVLink. Macquarie Core Equity Fund also commented on AMD, projecting its increased market share in AI GPUs by 2027.

title: Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO) Top Holdings
summary: This article details the top holdings of the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), highlighting its market-cap weighted structure and heavy reliance on mega-cap technology companies like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple. It explains how this concentration drives returns while also pointing out the inherent risks and how VOO serves as a low-cost, broad-market investment vehicle. The article also provides a deep dive into the top three holdings, explaining their business models and contributions to VOO's performance.

title: Move Over, Nvidia—Micron's Rally Just Rewired The AI ETF Playbook
summary: Micron Technology Inc.'s strong fiscal Q4 earnings are attracting ETF investors seeking growth beyond Nvidia in the semiconductor market. As Nvidia faces overvaluation concerns, Micron is emerging as a key AI beneficiary, particularly in high-performance memory. This shift is reshaping AI and semiconductor ETF strategies, with leveraged and diversified options gaining traction.

title: P10 shareholder Williams sells $796k in stock
summary: P10 Inc. shareholder Williams Mel sold 66,218 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $796,271 on September 23, 2025. This sale occurred despite P10's strong financial health and positive analyst sentiment, with the stock being considered undervalued by InvestingPro. In other news, P10 exceeded Q2 2025 earnings expectations and announced a dual listing on NYSE Texas Inc.

title: 617,000 sq ft Dual-Purpose Facility: Hyperscale Data Launches Major AI Infrastructure Build for NVIDIA Blackwell
summary: Hyperscale Data (NYSE American: GPUS) has begun converting its 617,000-square-foot Michigan Data Center to support NVIDIA Blackwell AI systems while continuing Bitcoin mining operations. This strategic move leverages the 34.5-acre facility's 28 megawatts of power capacity to create a dual-purpose hub for both AI and blockchain workloads. The company aims to become a leading dual-use compute facility in the United States, ensuring uninterrupted revenue generation from Bitcoin mining during the AI infrastructure deployment.

title: REX Shares Launches Three New T-REX Single-Stock ETFs on BMNR, CRWV, and CRCL
summary: REX Shares has launched three new T-REX single-stock ETFs: BMNU (2x long BMNR), CORD (-2x inverse CRWV), and CRCD (-2x inverse CRCL). These ETFs provide leveraged and inverse daily exposure to BitMine Immersion Technologies, CoreWeave, and Circle Internet Financial, respectively. The funds aim to offer traders new ways to express views on emerging themes in AI and digital assets, expanding the T-REX suite to over 30 leveraged and inverse single-stock ETFs.

title: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article presents a bullish thesis on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), highlighting its potential for 12-25% returns in 12-18 months due to its transformation into a diversified GPU powerhouse and Nvidia's ongoing execution issues. It emphasizes AMD's strong Q2 2025 results, underappreciated GPU diversification, and the competitive window created by Nvidia's structural reliability problems. The thesis suggests AMD's diversified revenue streams and competitive GPUs support multiple expansion despite macro risks and existing market dominance by Nvidia.

title: How IREN is Building an AI Powerhouse on a Bitcoin Foundation
summary: IREN Limited (formerly Iris Energy Limited) has seen a dramatic increase in value, driven by its strategic pivot into the artificial intelligence sector. The company plans to significantly expand its AI Cloud fleet by procuring 23,000 GPUs, including NVIDIA's Blackwell series, aiming for over $500 million in annualized run-rate revenue from AI by Q1 2026. This expansion leverages its profitable Bitcoin mining operations and vertically integrated data center infrastructure, positioning IREN as a leading provider of high-performance computing for AI.

title: Nvidia, TSMC start making first 'Made in USA' Blackwell AI chips in Arizona
summary: Nvidia and TSMC have begun mass production of Nvidia's advanced Blackwell AI chips in the U.S., specifically in Arizona. This marks a significant milestone for onshore chip production in the U.S. and highlights TSMC's potential for further expansion in the country due to the ongoing AI boom.

title: 1st American made Blackwell wafer celebrated by NVIDIA, TSMC - KTAR News 92.3 FM
summary: Phoenix has achieved a significant milestone in domestic semiconductor manufacturing with NVIDIA and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) celebrating the completion of the first U.S.-made Blackwell wafer. This event signifies a strengthening partnership between the two companies, aiming to position the U.S. as a leader in AI through advanced chip manufacturing. NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang highlighted the importance of this development, stating that the entire supply chain necessary to build AI supercomputers is being brought to the United States.

title: NVDA Stock: Earnings Growth Supports the Rally - The Tradable
summary: NVIDIA's stock surge is underpinned by strong and consistent earnings per share (EPS) growth, which validates its valuation despite concerns of a market bubble. The company's EPS has shown significant quarterly increases, supporting its price momentum and technical chart patterns. NVIDIA benefits from its market dominance in AI chips and sustained institutional investment, suggesting further growth with a key resistance level at $200.

title: NVIDIA Loses Its 95% Market Share in China - It's 100% Out due to US Export Restrictions - Gizchina.com
summary: NVIDIA has lost its entire 95% market share in China's advanced chip market due to strict U.S. export restrictions that prevent the sale of its high-end chips. CEO Jensen Huang confirmed the company is "100 percent out of China," after even a downgraded chip failed to gain traction due to a Chinese security investigation. Huang views these restrictions as a "mistake" that could harm both nations and spur China's domestic AI chip industry.

title: Jensen Huang Just Announced Bad News for Nvidia's Rivals
summary: Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang announced a significant $5 billion investment in Intel stock, strengthening Nvidia's AI capabilities and PC market presence. This strategic move is seen as bad news for Nvidia's rivals, as it further solidifies Nvidia's leadership in the AI chip market by turning Intel into a partner rather than a direct competitor in some areas. Despite continued competition, Nvidia's innovation and strategic partnerships aim to maintain its dominance in the high-growth AI sector.

title: Jensen Huang Just Announced Bad News for Nvidia's Rivals - Mitrade
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced a significant partnership with Intel, where Nvidia will invest $5 billion in Intel stock. This collaboration involves integrating Intel CPUs into Nvidia's AI data center platforms and Nvidia GPU chiplets into Intel's PC systems, strengthening Nvidia's AI capabilities and expanding its presence in the PC market. This move reinforces Nvidia's leadership in the AI sector, making it more challenging for rivals like AMD and Broadcom to compete.

title: Top 25 Stocks in the S&P 500 by Index Weight for August 2025
summary: This article identifies the top 25 stocks in the S&P 500 by index weight for August 2025, explaining the S&P 500's market capitalization weighting and its significance. It details the criteria for inclusion in the index, lists the top sectors, and provides a table of the 25 most influential companies along with their percentage weights. The piece also discusses the importance of these top stocks in reflecting market and economic health, and various ways for investors to gain exposure to the index.

title: Vanguard’s Information Technology Index Fund ETF Shares (VGT) Top 25 Holdings
summary: This article details the top 25 holdings of Vanguard's Information Technology Index Fund ETF (VGT), a leading ETF for exposure to the U.S. tech sector. It highlights the significant weighting of NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple, which collectively account for nearly 45% of the portfolio. The article discusses how VGT provides investors with comprehensive exposure to key tech trends like AI, cloud computing, and semiconductors.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Position Cut by Barrett & Company Inc.
summary: Barrett & Company Inc. reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 20.7% in the second quarter, now holding 77,145 shares valued at $12.188 million. Despite this, other institutional investors increased their holdings. The article also provides a financial overview of NVIDIA, including its stock performance, earnings, and dividend information, alongside recent analyst ratings and price targets.

title: Prediction: Nvidia Stock Price Will Skyrocket to This Range in 5 Years
summary: This article predicts Nvidia's stock price will skyrocket to a range of $1,300 to $3,115 within five years, primarily driven by its dominance in the burgeoning AI infrastructure market. The estimation is based on leveraging data from Nvidia's CFO and CEO regarding expected AI infrastructure spend and Nvidia's share of that spend. The author presents both best-case and base-case scenarios, acknowledging potential competition and the upside from other market platforms like automotive.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA is AMF Tjanstepension AB's 2nd Largest Position
summary: AMF Tjanstepension AB has significantly increased its stake in NVIDIA Corporation, making it their second-largest position valued at $1.32 billion. NVIDIA recently surpassed analyst expectations with strong earnings and revenue growth. The company also shows a strong institutional investor presence and positive analyst sentiment with multiple price target upgrades.

title: Dow Jones Index Today: Nvidia Leads a Tech Stock Drop
summary: Nvidia's performance significantly impacted the Dow Jones Index today, leading to a drop in tech stocks. The article discusses how this affects the overall Dow Jones Index movement and provides strategies for investing in the index, such as buying shares of listed companies or exchange-traded funds (ETFs).

title: Nvidia Q2 Preview: 'Saying This Is The Most Important Stock In The World Is An Understatement' (CORRECTED)
summary: NVIDIA Corporation is set to report its second-quarter earnings, with analysts expecting record revenue and strong EPS. The company's performance is seen as a key indicator for the broader market, particularly the semiconductor and AI sectors, given its significant weighting in major ETFs. Key areas of focus for the earnings report include guidance, the impact of China export restrictions, and growth in its Data Center, Gaming & AI PC, and Automotive segments, with experts highlighting its pivotal role in the AI revolution.

title: Markets News, Sep. 18, 2025: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq Hit Record Highs as Tech Stocks Surge; Intel Jumps as Nvidia to Invest $5 Billion
summary: Major US stock indexes, including the S&P 500, Dow, and Nasdaq, reached record highs on September 18, 2025, driven by a surge in technology stocks. This boost followed news of Nvidia's $5 billion investment in Intel, causing Intel shares to soar. The market also reacted to a Federal Reserve interest rate cut and saw significant moves in other sectors like crypto ETFs, AI-powered shopping initiatives, and notable corporate earnings.

title: 1 No-Brainer Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETF to Confidently Buy With $50 Ahead of 2026
summary: This article recommends the iShares Future AI and Tech ETF (ARTY) as a "no-brainer" investment in artificial intelligence, especially for investors looking to capitalize on projected infrastructure spending in the AI sector. The ETF, priced under $50 per share, offers a concentrated portfolio of 48 global AI stocks, including market leaders like Nvidia and Palantir. Despite a higher expense ratio due to active management, the ETF has significantly outperformed the S&P 500 since its restructuring in August last year, suggesting continued strong performance into 2026.

title: Intel (INTC) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Intel reported a solid Q3 2025 with revenue, gross margin, and EPS above guidance, marking the fourth consecutive quarter of improved execution. The company significantly strengthened its cash position through accelerated government funding and investments from Nvidia and SoftBank, enabling greater operational flexibility. Intel is focusing on rebuilding its market position in the AI revolution, addressing supply constraints, and advancing its Foundry business with major process nodes like 18A and 14A.

title: Alphabet: Anthropic deal and Gemini momentum stand to deliver; Fair Value up 27%
summary: Morningstar has raised its fair value estimate for Alphabet to $300 per share from $237 due to an expected acceleration in cloud growth and improved long-term profitability. This adjustment follows Anthropic's significant expansion of its use of Alphabet's AI accelerators, a deal valued at tens of billions of dollars. The deal is seen as a strong vote of confidence in Alphabet's TPU technology and is projected to drive substantial growth in Google Cloud sales, with an anticipated $8 billion-$10 billion in annual sales from Anthropic's capacity in 2026.

title: Know what you own: Investors have more options than ever in active ETFs
summary: Active ETFs are rapidly growing in popularity and market share, offering investors more flexibility and growth potential compared to traditional passive ETFs. The article highlights how active management can better adhere to investment styles, especially in growth indices where passive strategies may "miss the mark" on style categorization, using the T. Rowe Price Blue Chip Growth ETF (TCHP) as a case study for outperformance. It emphasizes the importance of active managers during market volatility to stay true to fund style objectives through fundamental research and analysis.

title: Texas Wealth Firm Exits Goldman’s High-Yield Nasdaq ETF After Strong Run
summary: A Texas-based wealth advisory firm, B&D White Capital Company, LLC (operating as Coyle Capital), sold its entire stake of 351,699 shares in the Goldman Sachs Nasdaq-100 Premium Income ETF (GPIQ) for an estimated $17.5 million, marking a full exit from the fund. This move, which also included a similar liquidation from Goldman's S&P 500 Premium Income ETF (GPIX), suggests a strategic shift away from high-yield, options-based equity strategies and covered-call funds after a period of strong short-term gains, aligning with Coyle's long-term diversification philosophy rather than a bearish view on the ETF itself. GPIQ remains a new fund with assets nearing $1.9 billion, exposing investors to top Nasdaq names despite the rebalancing by Coyle.

title: 2 ETFs That Give You Exposure to the Latest Trends in Tech
summary: This article highlights two ETFs, the Robo Global Robotics and Automation Index ETF and the Defiance Quantum ETF, as effective ways to gain exposure to the latest technology trends without needing to pick individual stocks. It details the focus and holdings of each ETF, discussing their past performance and growth potential. The piece suggests these ETFs offer a simplified approach for investors interested in robotics, automation, and quantum computing.

title: Know what you own: Investors have more options than ever in active ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing popularity and advantages of active ETFs, highlighting their growth since 2020. It contrasts active ETFs with passive strategies, particularly in how they maintain fidelity to growth characteristics amidst index rebalancing. The T. Rowe Price Blue Chip Growth ETF (TCHP) is presented as a case study for outperformance compared to passive alternatives, emphasizing the role of active management in navigating market changes and upholding investment style.

title: Qualcomm lança chip para disputar liderança da Nvidia em IA
summary: Qualcomm has launched a new line of chips and servers, the AI200 series, aiming to challenge Nvidia's dominance in the artificial intelligence accelerator market. The move caused Qualcomm's shares to surge, and analysts see it as a promising start, though it's still early for Qualcomm to be considered a major rival to Nvidia. The company's strategy includes leveraging its expertise in mobile chip efficiency for high-power servers and diversifying its revenue streams beyond smartphones.

title: Traphagen Investment Advisors LLC Buys 1,361 Shares of NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA
summary: Traphagen Investment Advisors LLC increased its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 4.2%, acquiring an additional 1,361 shares and bringing its total holdings to 33,725 shares valued at $5.33 million. This makes NVIDIA the 23rd largest holding in Traphagen's portfolio. NVIDIA reported strong financial results with a 55.6% year-over-year revenue growth and $1.05 EPS, surpassing analyst expectations. The company also announced a quarterly dividend and analysts maintain a "Buy" rating with an average target price of $222.23.

title: NVIDIA Makes the World Robotaxi-Ready With Uber Partnership to Support Global Expansion
summary: NVIDIA has partnered with Uber to make the world "robotaxi-ready," leveraging NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Hyperion 10 to support Uber's global autonomous fleet expansion to 100,000 vehicles by 2027. The collaboration includes developing a joint AI data factory and expanding the Level 4 autonomous ecosystem with partners like Stellantis, Lucid, and Mercedes-Benz for passenger mobility, and Aurora, Volvo Autonomous Solutions, and Waabi for long-haul freight. NVIDIA also launched the Halos Certified Program to evaluate and certify physical AI safety for autonomous vehicles.

title: Ahead of Earnings, Is Nvidia Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Ahead of Nvidia's Q3 2026 earnings report, Morningstar analyst Brian Colello assesses the stock, assigning a 3-star rating, suggesting it is fairly valued at $225 per share. The article highlights Nvidia's wide economic moat due to its GPUs and Cuda software, outstanding financial health, but also notes a very high uncertainty rating given the nascent AI market. Bulls and bears present their arguments regarding AI infrastructure spending, customer diversification, and geopolitical risks.

title: Why These Wall Street Experts Expect Big Things From Nvidia's Earnings Report Next Week
summary: Wall Street experts from Jefferies and Wedbush expect Nvidia to "beat and raise" on its upcoming earnings report, driven by increasing AI spending from big tech companies. Despite market concerns about the sustainability of AI spending, analysts are optimistic, with Oppenheimer calling Nvidia "best positioned to win" in the AI sector. Nvidia's performance is crucial as it is the most valuable company and significantly impacts the AI sector.

title: Nvidia Faces Growing Pressure As Amazon, Microsoft Support Curbs On AI Chip Exports To China: Report (UPDATED)
summary: Amazon and Microsoft are reportedly supporting new U.S. legislation, the Gain AI Act, which aims to further restrict Nvidia's AI chip exports to China. This move creates a rare public split with Nvidia, which is aggressively lobbying against the bill, arguing it would interfere with the semiconductor market and invite additional restrictions, impacting its already shrinking China business. The legislation is being considered for attachment to the annual National Defense Authorization Act amidst broader concerns about tech stock performance and AI-related energy shortages.

title: Benzinga Bulls And Bears: Nvidia, CoreWeave, Oklo — And AI-Linked Stocks Keep Falling
summary: This article reviews the performance of several key stocks, particularly those linked to AI, over the past week, noting a significant downturn in AI-linked stocks led by Nvidia and Palantir despite strong earnings. It highlights both bullish outlooks for companies like Nvidia and CoreWeave due to strong growth and revenue, and bearish views for others such as Oklo and Rigetti Computing which reported wider losses or missed revenue estimates. The broader market saw investors rotate defensively as concerns about the AI boom's rapid pace increased.

title: Peter Thiel dumps entire Nvidia stake, slashes Tesla holdings amid bubble fears
summary: Billionaire investor Peter Thiel has sold his entire stake in Nvidia and significantly reduced his holdings in Tesla, citing growing concerns over an AI-fueled bubble in technology valuations. This divestment follows similar moves by SoftBank Group Corp. and Michael Burry, and comes after Thiel's previous warnings about stretched valuations in the tech sector, likening the current environment to the 1999-2000 Dotcom bubble. He also acquired shares in Apple Inc. and Microsoft Corporation, while exiting Vistra Energy Corp.

title: Morgan Stanley Bumps Up Nvidia Stock (NVDA) Price Target Ahead of Q3 Earnings
summary: Morgan Stanley raised its price target for Nvidia (NVDA) stock to $220 from $210, maintaining a Buy rating ahead of the company's Q3 earnings report. Analyst Joseph Moore anticipates strong Q3 results driven by accelerating demand for Nvidia's AI platforms, Blackwell and Vera Rubin. Despite recent underperformance, Wall Street analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus for NVDA with significant upside potential.

title: NVIDIA and RIKEN Advance Japan’s Scientific Frontiers With New Supercomputers for AI and Quantum Computing
summary: NVIDIA and RIKEN are collaborating to establish two new supercomputers in Japan, powered by NVIDIA GB200 systems and NVIDIA Quantum-X800 InfiniBand networking, to advance AI for science and quantum computing research. These systems will utilize 2,140 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs to support Japan's sovereign AI strategy and reinforce its leadership in science, industry, and technology. This initiative also involves the future development of FugakuNEXT, a successor to the Fugaku supercomputer, integrating Fujitsu's CPUs with NVIDIA technologies.

title: Nvidia Earnings Are The 'Super Bowl' For The Entire Market, Could Trigger A Massive Shift: 'You're Going To Be Able To Hear A Pin Drop' - NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA), SoftBank Group (OTC:SFTBF)
summary: Nvidia's upcoming earnings report is being called the "Super Bowl" for the entire market by analysts due to its potential to trigger a massive shift. Analysts like Dan Ives and Gene Munster believe Nvidia's dominance in AI chips is unmatched, with demand significantly outstripping supply. The company is expected to report strong Q3 revenue, and Wall Street may still be underestimating its future growth despite lofty expectations.

title: AMD, ARM, INTC, NVDA: Chip stock prices are falling across the board today. Here's the reason why
summary: Chip stocks, including Nvidia, Intel, AMD, and ARM, are experiencing widespread declines today due to growing fears of an AI bubble ahead of Nvidia's crucial third-quarter earnings report. Investors are taking profits and showing jitters as expectations for Nvidia's revenue are very high, and a miss could signal a broader AI market correction. This investor anxiety is impacting the entire chip sector and other AI-exposed tech companies.

title: Microsoft and Nvidia to invest up to $15 billion in AI company Anthropic
summary: Microsoft and Nvidia are set to invest up to $15 billion in AI company Anthropic, a developer of the Claude chatbot and a competitor to OpenAI. Microsoft will invest up to $5 billion, and Nvidia up to $10 billion, with Anthropic committing to purchase $30 billion in cloud computing services from Microsoft. This deal strengthens Anthropic's ties with two major industry players and establishes a deep technological partnership with Nvidia for optimizing AI models and architectures.

title: NVIDIA CORP SEC 10-Q Report
summary: NVIDIA CORP has released its Form 10-Q report for Q3 FY2026, showcasing impressive financial performance with $57,006 million in revenue, up 62% year-over-year, and a net income of $31,910 million. The growth is primarily driven by strong demand for its data center compute and networking platforms for accelerated computing and AI solutions. The company is also focused on expanding U.S.-based manufacturing and addresses operational challenges related to product transitions and complex system configurations.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang earnings call namechecked Saudi AI company Humain three times. Here’s why
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang name-checked Saudi AI company Humain three times during a recent earnings call, highlighting the six-month-old company's rapid emergence as a major player in AI infrastructure. Backed by Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund, Humain aims to supply 6% of the world's AI computing power by 2034 and has secured significant deals with Nvidia, Amazon, and xAI, as well as with competitors like AMD and Qualcomm, despite some U.S. national security concerns. The company is actively building data centers and developing its own AI models and hardware, positioning Saudi Arabia as a potential AI hub in the Middle East.

title: Four Indicted In Alleged Conspiracy To Smuggle Supercomputers and Nvidia Chips to China
summary: Four individuals in Florida, Alabama, and California have been indicted for allegedly conspiring to illegally ship supercomputers and hundreds of Nvidia GPUs to China. The defendants are accused of using a sham real estate company to acquire Nvidia chips and then re-selling them to Chinese companies, using doctored customs paperwork and shipping through Thailand and Malaysia. This action is part of a broader US government effort to curb the smuggling of advanced AI chips to China, which authorities fear could be used for military, surveillance, disinformation, and cybersecurity applications.

title: 2 Americans, 2 Chinese nationals accused of illegally exporting Nvidia GPUs to China
summary: Two Americans and two Chinese nationals have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia AI chips to China, using a Florida real estate company as a front. Prosecutors allege this plot threatened U.S. national security and aimed to circumvent export controls through third countries. The Department of Justice thwarted some shipments and highlighted China's goal of using AI for military modernization.

title: Nvidia's Stellar Quarter Fails to Quell Bears as AI Valuation Fears Deepen on Wall Street
summary: Despite Nvidia's stellar fiscal third-quarter earnings report, which surpassed expectations with $57 billion in revenue and strong Q4 guidance of $65 billion, its stock experienced a rapid reversal and closed down 3.15%. This market reaction, contributing to a 2.2% decline in the Nasdaq Composite, highlights growing investor anxiety about AI valuations and the sustainability of the AI boom. Pure-play AI software companies like C3.ai have been particularly affected, raising concerns about business models lacking established cash flows amidst stiff competition.

title: Trump Team Internally Floats Idea of Selling Nvidia H200 Chips to China
summary: US officials are reportedly engaged in preliminary discussions regarding the potential approval for Nvidia Corp. to sell its H200 artificial intelligence chips to China. These internal talks within President Donald Trump's team represent a contentious move that could significantly benefit Nvidia, the world's most valuable company. However, no final decision has been made, and such sales would require license approvals under existing export controls.

title: These under-the-radar chip stocks could deliver rapid sales growth for the next 2 years
summary: This article highlights that while Nvidia continues its strong revenue growth, investors looking for rapid growth in the chip sector should also consider lesser-known companies. Credo and Astera Labs are identified as under-the-radar chip stocks with promising revenue-growth prospects for the next two years, despite recent pressures on the artificial-intelligence trade.

title: Nvidia shares rise after strong results ease 'AI bubble' concerns
summary: Nvidia reported stronger-than-expected revenues, with sales for the three months to October jumping 62% to $57bn, driven by demand for its AI data centre chips. This performance has eased investor concerns about heavy artificial intelligence spending and the possibility of an "AI bubble," despite ongoing questions about AI stock valuations. CEO Jensen Huang highlighted "off the charts" sales for AI Blackwell systems and sold-out cloud GPUs, reaffirming the company's strong position in the AI market.

title: America arrests tech company CTO and three others for selling Nvidia's banned chips to China
summary: Four individuals, including a tech company CTO, have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork, using a shell company, and receiving over $3.89 million in wire transfers to circumvent U.S. export controls on high-end chips banned for sale to China. The U.S. government alleges these chips were intended for China's military modernization efforts and development of AI surveillance and weapons of mass destruction.

title: Nvidia: I’m Not Sweating A Drop After This Q3 Meltdown (NASDAQ:NVDA)
summary: The author is upgrading Nvidia to Strong Buy following Q3 FY26 results, which saw $57B revenue and a $65B Q4 guide, indicating robust AI demand despite a prior downgrade. Key drivers include B300 chips forming two-thirds of Blackwell revenue, the confirmation of Rubin for H2 2026, and $500B visibility into 2025 and 2026. China remains a significant risk due to regulatory issues affecting data center GPU revenue.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights NVIDIA, Advanced Micro Devices and Intel
summary: This article from Zacks highlights NVIDIA, Advanced Micro Devices, and Intel, focusing on NVIDIA's outstanding Q3 fiscal 2026 performance. NVIDIA reported a 62% year-over-year revenue increase, driven by strong demand for its Blackwell chips and cloud services, positioning it as a strong buy. The article also touches on NVIDIA's dominance in AI hardware and significant shareholder returns, recommending the stock with a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).

title: Nvidia Shares Drop on Report of Google Challenge in AI Chips
summary: Nvidia's stock dropped following a report that Meta Platforms is in talks to acquire AI chips from Google, indicating a growing challenge to Nvidia's dominance in the AI accelerator market. Meta's potential deal with Google for its tensor processing units (TPUs) suggests an increasing desire among tech giants to diversify their AI chip suppliers and reduce reliance on Nvidia. An agreement would significantly boost Google's position as an alternative AI chip provider, building on a previous deal with Anthropic PBC.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Nvidia's crown looks increasingly uneasy on its head
summary: Nvidia's position as the AI chip leader is being challenged by concerns over lofty valuations and competition from Google and Meta. While Nvidia asserts its chip superiority, the market is scrutinizing its responses to these growing pressures. Meanwhile, other market news includes U.S. stock gains, declining U.S. consumer confidence, and progress on a Ukraine peace plan.

title: Nvidia: Maintain $240 Fair Value Estimate Amid Reports of Meta’s Negotiations to Buy Google TPUs
summary: Morningstar maintains its $240 fair value estimate for Nvidia despite reports of Meta Platforms negotiating to buy Google's custom Tensor Processing Unit (TPU) chips for AI. Shares of Nvidia and AMD were down following these reports on November 25th. Morningstar analyst Brian Colello believes Nvidia remains in a dominant position as an AI infrastructure supplier.

title: Nvidia spat with Big Short investor Burry highlights AI bubble fears
summary: Michael Burry, the investor known from "The Big Short," is publicly challenging Nvidia's valuation and accounting practices, suggesting the AI sector is in a bubble due to overvalued stocks and questionable financing deals. Nvidia has countered Burry's claims through a memo to Wall Street analysts, defending the long-term profitability and market potential of AI technologies and the lifespan of GPUs. The debate underscores growing concerns about the sustainability of the AI boom amid massive datacenter investments and the financial structures supporting it.

title: Nvidia refutes ‘big short’ investor Michael Burry's claims as Cisco parallel fuels AI bubble uncertainty
summary: Nvidia has issued a seven-page response refuting claims made by "big short" investor Michael Burry, who argued that the AI investment boom mirrors the dot-com bubble's Cisco saga. Burry compared Nvidia to Cisco during the dot-com era, suggesting a potential bubble, while Nvidia defended its financial practices and the longevity of its GPU chips. The company addressed criticisms regarding stock-based compensation, share repurchases, and GPU depreciation.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Holdings Cut by KLCM Advisors Inc.
summary: KLCM Advisors Inc. reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 4.8% in Q2 2025, selling over 81,000 shares, though NVIDIA remains its largest holding. Despite this institutional selling, NVIDIA reported strong quarterly earnings, surpassing analyst expectations for both EPS and revenue. Analysts generally maintain a "Buy" rating for NVIDIA, with a consensus target price of $258.19.

title: NVIDIA and Micron Stand Out as Likely Profitable AI Winners for 2026
summary: This article identifies NVIDIA and Micron as top profitable AI stock picks for 2026 and beyond, based on their high net income ratios. The analysis emphasizes the importance of investing in profitable AI companies and outlines screening parameters used to identify these stocks, including a Zacks Rank #1, higher-than-industry sales and net income growth, a strong net income ratio, and a high percentage of Strong Buy ratings from brokers. The article highlights NVIDIA's 53% and Micron's 22.9% 12-month net profit margins as key indicators of their strong profitability.

title: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA): Our Calculation of Intrinsic Value
summary: This article presents a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis of NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) to determine its intrinsic value. Despite NVIDIA being a leader in AI and having strong financial performance, the analysis concludes that its current market price of approximately $180 per share is significantly over its calculated intrinsic value of $62 per share, suggesting a lack of margin of safety for investors even with its hypergrowth.

title: Is NVIDIA’s Recent 14.5% Pullback a Realignment with Its True Value?
summary: This article examines whether NVIDIA's recent 14.5% stock pullback brings its valuation in line with its true worth. It utilizes Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis and Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratios, along with "Narratives" for a more dynamic investment decision-making process. The analysis finds NVIDIA to be fairly valued by DCF and PE ratios, yet highlights significant divergence between optimistic "Bull Case" and cautious "Bear Case" future valuations.

title: Liberty All-Star® Equity Fund November 2025 Monthly Update
summary: The Liberty All-Star® Equity Fund (NYSE: USA) released its November 2025 Monthly Update, detailing its investment approach, top holdings, and performance metrics. The fund, which combines three value and two growth managers, reported a net asset value of $6.79 and a market price of $6.13 at month-end, trading at a 9.7% discount. Key sector allocations included Information Technology (25.3%) and Financials (18.9%), with Top 20 holdings featuring NVIDIA Corp., Microsoft Corp., and Alphabet, Inc.

title: Nvidia bulks up open source offerings with an acquisition and new open AI models
summary: Nvidia is expanding its open-source AI efforts through the acquisition of SchedMD, developers of the Slurm workload management system, and the release of its new Nemotron 3 family of open AI models. The acquisition aims to enhance Nvidia's position in high-performance computing and AI infrastructure, while the Nemotron 3 models are designed for efficient AI agent development. These moves reinforce Nvidia's commitment to open innovation and physical AI, supporting robotics and autonomous vehicle development.

title: V. M. Manning & CO. Inc. Purchases New Shares in NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA
summary: Investment firm V. M. Manning & CO. Inc. has acquired a significant new position in NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) during the second quarter, making it their largest holding. This acquisition of 260,222 shares, valued at approximately $45.4 million, now represents 51.1% of their investment portfolio. The news comes as NVIDIA reported strong Q3 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations with a 62.5% year-over-year revenue increase, despite recent insider share sales.

title: Analysis: Nvidia Nemotron-3 open models lead to more efficient agentic AI
summary: Nvidia has launched the Nemotron-3 family of open models, data, and tools, reinforcing its commitment to an open ecosystem for AI development. These models are designed to be highly efficient, accurate, and transparent, specifically addressing enterprise AI challenges such as the need for systems of models, specialization for "last-mile" applications, and managing the cost of "long thinking" computations. Nemotron-3 utilizes a hybrid Mamba-Transformer MoE architecture, offering improved performance, context length, and is backed by Nvidia's expanded commitment to open-source libraries, high-quality data sets, and enterprise blueprints.

title: Nvidia Stock Gains. This China Chip Company Jumps 700% as It Takes Aim at AI Leader.
summary: Nvidia stock rose in premarket trading despite increasing competition in the AI chip market. This comes as a Chinese chip company saw a significant surge in its stock, indicating growing challengers to Nvidia's dominance.

title: AI Chip Startup Mythic Raises $125 Million in Bid to Take on Nvidia
summary: AI chip startup Mythic Inc. has secured $125 million in a new funding round to compete with Nvidia in the artificial intelligence processor market. The investment, led by DCVC, includes contributions from firms like New Enterprise Associates, SoftBank, Honda Motor Co., and Lockheed Martin Corp. Mythic, now led by former Nvidia executive Taner Ozcelik, aims to use this capital to further its development in this competitive sector.

title: Nvidia picks Kiryat Tivon for large R&D campus, bringing tech jobs north
summary: US chip giant Nvidia announced plans to build a "multibillion-shekel" R&D campus in Kiryat Tivon, Israel, creating an estimated 10,000 jobs. This new 160,000-square-meter hub, set to begin construction in 2027 and complete by 2031, will double Nvidia's current workforce in Israel and become its eighth R&D center in the country. The initiative aims to transform the northern region, currently near Haifa, into a significant tech hub.

title: Now Generally Available, NVIDIA RTX PRO 5000 72GB Blackwell GPU Expands Memory Options for Desktop Agentic AI
summary: NVIDIA has made its RTX PRO 5000 72GB Blackwell GPU generally available, significantly expanding memory options for desktop agentic AI development. This new configuration, offering 72GB of GDDR7 memory, addresses the increasing demand for memory capacity in complex AI workflows, including large language models and multimodal agentic AI. The GPU provides substantial performance enhancements for AI development, generative AI benchmarks, and creative applications, enabling developers to train larger models locally with improved speed and efficiency.

title: 2 Tailwinds and 1 Red Flag to Consider with Nvidia Stock Right Now
summary: Nvidia is a leading AI stock due to its high-performance chips, with upcoming Rubin chips expected to significantly boost power. The company benefits from its dominant CUDA ecosystem, making it costly for clients to switch, but a potential red flag is whether mega-cap tech companies will eventually reduce AI spending as models mature, possibly impacting Nvidia's stronghold on the semiconductor market. Despite strong growth projections, the stock trades at 22x forward earnings, with its future tied to sustained AI infrastructure investment.

title: Nvidia stock gains on Trump chip export review, sparking rally in chipmakers
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) stock rose 3.6% after Reuters reported the Trump administration began its review of Nvidia H200 chip exports to China and U.S. antitrust agencies cleared Nvidia's investment into Intel (INTC). This news, seen as a sign of President Trump potentially following through on his promise to conditionally allow chip sales to China, spurred a broader rally among other chipmakers like AMD, Broadcom, and Micron. Despite potential hurdles concerning national security and China's willingness to accept the chips, the developments signal a potential expansion into a crucial market for Nvidia.

title: GuoLine Advisory Pte Ltd Invests $28.90 Million in NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA
summary: GuoLine Advisory Pte Ltd has invested $28.90 million in NVIDIA Corporation, establishing a new position of 154,900 shares, making it 2.9% of their holdings and their 15th largest position. NVIDIA reported strong earnings with $1.30 EPS and $57.01 billion in revenue, leading analysts to raise price targets, resulting in a consensus "Buy" rating. However, significant insider selling, totaling $396 million over the last three months, has been noted as a potential caution signal for investors.

title: Nvidia's Huang confirms plan to build new campus in Israel
summary: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, has confirmed plans to build a new campus in Israel, which he referred to as "our second home." This new facility is expected to double the number of Nvidia employees in Israel, accommodating more staff than initially estimated by industry executives. The announcement indicates a significant expansion of Nvidia's presence in the country.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA is Woodstock Corp's Largest Position
summary: Woodstock Corp has maintained NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) as its largest holding, despite selling 8.1% of its shares in the third quarter. NVIDIA now constitutes 9.6% of Woodstock Corp's portfolio, valued at $110.34 million. The company reported strong financial results, beating EPS and revenue estimates, and analysts generally hold a "Buy" rating with an average target price of $262.14.

title: Why Nvidia maintains its moat and Gemini won’t kill OpenAI
summary: This article argues against two prevailing market narratives: that Nvidia's competitive moat is eroding due to alternatives like TPUs, and that Google's Gemini AI model will dominate and ultimately surpass OpenAI. The authors contend that Nvidia's forthcoming products, like the GB300, will reset AI economics and reinforce its market leadership, while Google faces an innovator's dilemma with its ad-dependent search business that will challenge its ability to integrate AI chatbots profitably. OpenAI, despite challenges, is positioned to disrupt online experiences by focusing on trusted information over ads, maintaining a strong position alongside Nvidia in the AI era.

title: NVIDIA & 2 More Profitable S&P 500 Stocks to Buy Before 2026
summary: This article identifies NVIDIA (NVDA), Micron Technology (MU), and Seagate Technology Holdings (STX) as top S&P 500 stock picks for profitability before 2026. The selection is based on high net income ratios and additional criteria like a Zacks Rank of 1, higher-than-industry sales and net income growth, and a strong buy percentage rating. The piece highlights each company's 12-month net profit margin as a key indicator of financial health.

title: US lawmakers want disclosure of license reviews for Nvidia H200 chip sales to China
summary: Two senior Democratic lawmakers have requested that the U.S. Commerce Department disclose details and approvals of license reviews concerning potential sales of Nvidia's H200 AI chips to Chinese firms. This request comes after President Donald Trump's decision to allow these sales with a 25% fee, a policy shift from the Biden administration's ban due to national security concerns. The lawmakers are also seeking a briefing on the military potential of these chips and the reaction of allies before any approvals are issued.

title: nvidia and avago among market cap stock movers on Tuesday
summary: On Tuesday, Nvidia Corp (NVDA) and Avago Technologies (AVGO) experienced positive movement among mega-cap stocks, while Oracle Corp (ORCL) saw a decline. The article details various stock movers across mega-cap, large-cap, mid-cap, and small-cap categories, highlighting significant gains and losses for companies like Regencell Bioscience Holdings (RGC) and Starfighters Space (FJET).

title: Morgan Stanley Picks NVDA, AVGO, and ALAB as Top Chip Stocks for 2026
summary: Morgan Stanley analyst Joseph Moore identifies Nvidia (NVDA), Broadcom (AVGO), and Astera Labs (ALAB) as top chip stocks for 2026, driven by sustained demand from generative AI. Despite concerns about an AI bubble, Moore believes the strong growth in AI semiconductors, memory, and fab utilization will continue. He provides bullish ratings and price targets for all three companies, emphasizing their individual strengths in high-performance processing, custom ASICs, and specialized connectivity solutions for AI infrastructure.

title: Exclusive: Nvidia buying AI chip startup Groq for about $20 billion in its largest acquisition on record
summary: Nvidia is making its largest acquisition to date, purchasing assets from AI chip startup Groq for approximately $20 billion. Groq, founded by creators of Google's tensor processing unit, will enter a "non-exclusive licensing agreement" with Nvidia, with Groq's CEO and other senior leaders joining Nvidia while parts of Groq will continue as an independent company. This deal significantly bolsters Nvidia's position in the competitive AI chip market.

title: Nvidia to license AI chip challenger Groq’s tech and hire its CEO
summary: Nvidia has entered a non-exclusive licensing agreement with AI chip company Groq and will hire Groq's founder Jonathan Ross, president Sunny Madra, and other employees. Although not an acquisition of the entire company, reports suggest Nvidia is acquiring assets worth $20 billion, which would be its largest purchase yet. This move aims to further solidify Nvidia's dominance in chip manufacturing by integrating Groq's LPU technology, known for its speed and energy efficiency in running LLMs.

title: Democrats warn Trump greenlighting Nvidia AI chip sales could boost China’s military edge
summary: Congressional Democrats, led by Rep. Gregory Meeks and Sen. Elizabeth Warren, are raising alarms over the Trump administration's alleged decision to greenlight the sale of Nvidia's H200 AI chips to China. They argue this move, which reverses a previous ban, could significantly enhance China's military capabilities, contradicting U.S. national security policy. The lawmakers have demanded answers from Under Secretary for Industry and Security Jeffrey Kessler by January 12, 2026.

title: SoftBank Launches AI Computing Platform Featuring Liquid-Cooled NVIDIA GB200 NVL72
summary: SoftBank Corp. has launched a new AI computing platform powered by the NVIDIA GB200 NVL72, a significant boost to Japan's domestic AI infrastructure. This platform, featuring 1,224 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs and designed for expansion to over 4,000, will support dedicated NVIDIA GPU Resource Services and the development of Japan's "Sarashina" LLM. Utilizing direct-to-chip liquid cooling for optimal performance and power efficiency, the initiative aims to provide essential computational resources for Generative AI developers and has been certified by Japan’s METI as a "Cloud Program."

title: Nvidia-Groq deal is structured to keep 'fiction of competition alive,' analyst says
summary: Nvidia's reported $20 billion deal to acquire talent and license technology from Groq, structured as a non-exclusive licensing agreement, aims to circumvent rigorous antitrust scrutiny while expanding Nvidia's AI ecosystem dominance. This move, which has not been officially announced by Nvidia, is seen by analysts as a strategic way to widen its competitive moat in the AI market, particularly in the inference segment, preventing Groq's assets from falling into competitors' hands. The deal highlights a growing trend among tech giants to prioritize talent and technology acquisition through licensing to avoid regulatory hurdles associated with traditional mergers.

title: Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Analyst Updates & Stock Analysis
summary: Analysts maintain strong confidence in Nvidia (NVDA) due to its dominant position in AI, data centers, and high-performance computing, reaffirming "Buy" and "Outperform" ratings with price targets up to $300. The stock has been upgraded to a "Strong Buy" technical signal, reflecting improving momentum and renewed buying interest. This widespread optimism, coupled with a consensus "Strong Buy" rating and a $253 average price target, reinforces a constructive outlook for Nvidia shares, despite valuation discussions.

title: Nvidia Stock Climbs As The King Of AI Defends Its Throne
summary: Nvidia's stock is climbing following a strategic non-exclusive licensing agreement with Groq to bolster its AI inference market dominance and counter competition. The deal involves a talent transfer including Groq's founder Jonathan Ross joining Nvidia, and access to Groq's specialized LPU technology. This maneuver is seen by analysts at Rosenblatt Securities as a way to maintain market leadership and avoid regulatory scrutiny, leading them to reiterate a Buy rating and a $245 price target for NVDA.

title: Analysts Maintain Positive Outlook on AMD With China Demand as a Catalyst
summary: Analysts are maintaining a positive outlook on Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMD), citing potential revenue and EPS upside from the resumption of GPU sales to China. Raymond James reiterated an "Outperform" rating, estimating AMD could see $500-800M in revenue and $0.10-0.20 in non-GAAP EPS upside by 2026 if US export approvals continue. Wall Street analysts currently have a consensus "Buy" rating for AMD, with an average price target of $289.00.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Shares Sold by Beech Hill Advisors Inc.
summary: Beech Hill Advisors Inc. reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 14.1% in the third quarter, selling 3,305 shares and holding 20,194 shares valued at $3.77 million. Despite insider selling, NVIDIA's stock performance remains strong with a significant deal to license Groq’s inference technology, positive analyst upgrades, and strong financial results. The company recently declared a quarterly dividend and analysts maintain a "Buy" rating with a consensus target price of $262.14.

title: Nvidia Stock Had a Volatile 2025: What’s the 2026 Forecast?
summary: Nvidia's stock experienced significant volatility in 2025, largely influenced by a flurry of deals and ongoing uncertainty surrounding its China business due to US tariffs. Despite the challenges and a pull-back from its record high, analysts remain bullish on Nvidia's 2026 prospects, forecasting substantial revenue growth and a strong year ahead for the company, even if triple-digit annual returns are not expected perpetually. The company's valuation metrics also suggest it is still an attractive investment compared to some peers, despite concerns about a potential AI bubble and increasing competition.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid MGM and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article advises against investing in MGM Resorts International, citing three main reasons: disappointing long-term revenue growth, declining return on invested capital (ROIC) due to new investments failing to bear fruit, and high debt levels that increase financial risk. Instead, the author suggests considering high-quality stocks in the digital advertising platform sector or other market-beating stocks identified by StockStory.

title: 2 Cash-Producing Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 That Underwhelm
summary: This article identifies two cash-producing stocks, Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) and Wingstop (WING), as strong buys for long-term investors due to their growth, profitability, and market performance. Conversely, Honeywell (HON) is presented as a stock to sell, citing concerns about its lack of organic revenue growth, shrinking free cash flow margin, and declining returns on capital. The article emphasizes wise reinvestment of cash for company expansion.

title: Semiconductor Market Revalued as AI Drives Significant Growth
summary: Recent analyses by McKinsey and Gartner indicate a substantial revaluation of the semiconductor market, revealing it to be larger and growing faster than previously estimated, primarily due to the significant demand driven by AI components. McKinsey now projects the 2024 market value at $775 billion, while Gartner reports a 21% increase in global semiconductor revenue for 2025, reaching $793 billion, with AI-specific components accounting for nearly one-third of this total. NVIDIA emerged as the top semiconductor vendor in 2025, surpassing Samsung, underscoring the shift in market dynamics towards AI-focused chip development and manufacturing.

title: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) Oppenheimer Stays Bullish with $265 Target Forecast
summary: Oppenheimer analyst Rick Schafer has reiterated a "Buy" rating for Nvidia (NVDA) and set a 12-month price target of $265.00. This forecast highlights confidence in Nvidia's strong market position in semiconductors and AI, particularly its GPU technology. The analyst believes Nvidia will continue to grow and provide significant returns to investors, with potential capital gains of over 40% from current trading prices.

title: Nvidia, Apple, Netflix, AppLovin, 3M, Coinbase, Newmont, RAPT, Fastenal, and More Market Movers
summary: Stocks tumbled on Tuesday as investors reacted to President Donald Trump's plan to impose tariffs on eight NATO countries regarding the acquisition of Greenland. This report identifies several market movers, including Nvidia, Netflix, Intel, and Coinbase, among others. The article highlights the market's response to this political and economic development.

title: AI inference startup Baseten hits $5B valuation in $300M round backed by Nvidia
summary: AI inference startup Baseten Labs Inc. has secured $300 million in new funding, pushing its valuation to $5 billion. The round featured investments from Institutional Venture Partners LP, CapitalG LP (Google's growth fund), and a significant $150 million contribution from Nvidia Corp. Baseten specializes in providing AI inference infrastructure, enabling companies to quickly deploy and run machine learning models in production, with Nvidia's involvement highlighting its strategic interest in the AI inference sector.

title: Nvidia CEO Says AI Will Create Jobs For Electricians and Plumbers
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang believes that artificial intelligence will create new job opportunities, particularly for skilled vocational workers such as electricians, plumbers, and construction workers. He states that the demand for building data centers to run and train AI will lead to "six-figure salaries" for these professions, emphasizing that AI will necessitate one of the largest infrastructure buildouts in history. Huang made these remarks during an interview with BlackRock Inc. CEO Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

title: Dow's nearly 725-point rally highlighted by gains in NVIDIA Corp., Amgen stocks
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average experienced a significant rally, gaining nearly 725 points. This increase was notably driven by strong performances from NVIDIA Corp. and Amgen stocks, contributing to the overall positive movement in the index.

title: NVIDIA is the world’s most valuable company in 2026: Full list of top 10 tech giants; see where Apple and Microsoft stand
summary: In 2026, NVIDIA has become the world's most valuable tech company, surpassing giants like Apple and Microsoft, according to CompaniesMarketCap. This shift highlights a growing investor focus on companies building core technology infrastructure like AI, cloud computing, and semiconductor manufacturing. The rankings, based on market capitalization, indicate the rapid evolution of the tech industry where foundational technology providers are now leading the market.

title: New Century Financial Group LLC Has $1.57 Million Holdings in NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA
summary: New Century Financial Group LLC significantly reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 60.3% in the third quarter, now holding 8,420 shares valued at $1.57 million, which constitutes 2.8% of its portfolio. This reduction comes despite NVIDIA reporting strong quarterly earnings and receiving a consensus "Buy" rating from Wall Street analysts with an average price target of $263.41. However, the company faces near-term risks including substantial insider sales and potential operational delays for its H200 chip in China.

title: Nvidia director Persis Drell resigns with $26 million worth of stock after decade on board
summary: Nvidia board member Persis Drell, an engineering professor at Stanford, has resigned after over a decade on the chipmaker's board. Drell, 69, stepped down to pursue a "new professional opportunity" and holds nearly 143,000 Nvidia shares, valued at approximately $26 million. Her departure marks the first board member resignation since June, leaving the board with 10 directors including CEO Jensen Huang.

title: Nvidia Director Persis Drell Leaves Board for Other Opportunity
summary: Nvidia announced the departure of director Persis Drell from its board. Drell, a Stanford University professor, is leaving to pursue a new professional opportunity, as disclosed in a regulatory filing. Nvidia did not specify her new endeavor.

title: Nvidia director Persis Drell resigns from board, leaves with 1,43,000 shares and stock price gain of 22,000%
summary: Nvidia director Persis Drell has resigned from the company's board to pursue a new professional opportunity. She is leaving with approximately 143,000 Nvidia shares, valued at around $26 million, representing a 22,000% gain since she joined the board over a decade ago. Her departure is amicable, with no disagreements cited regarding company operations or practices.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA is Strategic Planning Group LLC's 3rd Largest Position
summary: Strategic Planning Group LLC has reduced its stake in NVIDIA (NVDA) by 6%, though it remains their third-largest holding, valued at approximately $34.37 million. Institutional ownership of NVIDIA stands at about 65.27%, with analysts maintaining a "Buy" rating and an average price target of $263. Insiders have sold a significant number of shares recently, while potential catalysts include a China reopening for H200 GPUs and a $150 million investment in Baseten, balanced against risks like rising memory costs.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA is Duncker Streett & Co. Inc.'s 4th Largest Position
summary: Duncker Streett & Co. Inc. recently reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) by 7.1%, making it their fourth-largest holding at approximately $21.69 million. Despite this, NVIDIA remains a strong "Buy" for Wall Street analysts with a consensus price target of $263.41, though corporate insiders have been net sellers in recent months. The article also highlights NVIDIA's financial performance, dividend announcement, and key news impacting its stock, including potential China market developments and AI investments.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Stake Lessened by Webster Bank N. A.
summary: Webster Bank N. A. recently reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) by 7.0% in the third quarter of 2025, now holding 229,357 shares valued at $42.8 million. This reduction comes amid ongoing insider selling and mixed market sentiment influenced by potential H200 GPU orders from China, NVIDIA's strategic investment in AI startup Baseten, and concerns over soaring memory costs affecting margins. Despite some recent analyst upgrades, the article highlights both positive and negative factors impacting the stock's performance.

title: Nvidia and HubSpot have been highlighted as Zacks Bull and Bear of the Day
summary: Zacks Investment Research has named Nvidia (NVDA) as its Bull of the Day due to its critical role in the AI revolution, powerful GPUs, and strong growth prospects, including a recent deal to sell AI chips in China. Conversely, HubSpot Inc. (HUBS) is designated as the Bear of the Day, facing challenges from AI disruption, potential cannibalization from its new low-cost offering, and noticeable relative weakness in its stock performance. The article also provides an analysis of Strategy Inc. (MSTR), discussing its Bitcoin-first strategy and its potential for a rebound despite recent stock volatility.

title: CRWV stock price: Why CoreWeave is getting a big boost from Nvidia today
summary: Nvidia has invested an additional $2 billion in CoreWeave, a cloud computing platform specializing in AI, to accelerate the development of over five gigawatts of AI factories by 2030. This new investment comes on top of a previous $3.3 billion, demonstrating Nvidia's confidence in CoreWeave's growth strategy and leading to a significant increase in CoreWeave's stock (CRWV). The collaboration aims to meet the escalating demand for AI infrastructure, with CoreWeave gaining early access to Nvidia's new CPU and other products.

title: Rep. Nancy Pelosi Sells Off Shares of NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA)
summary: Representative Nancy Pelosi recently sold between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000 worth of NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock on December 24th, 2025, while also making additional tech purchases in January 2026, including more NVDA. Despite this sale and insider selling by company directors, NVIDIA's outlook remains bullish with a consensus "Buy" rating, strong quarterly results, and strategic investments. The company's stock currently trades at $189.20, with a fifty-day moving average of $183.37.

title: China gives green light to importing first batch of Nvidia's H200 AI chips, sources say: Reuters
summary: China has reportedly approved the import of its first batch of Nvidia's H200 artificial intelligence chips, according to sources familiar with the matter. This approval, covering several hundred thousand chips, occurred during Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's recent visit to China and indicates a strategic move by China to balance its AI development with domestic innovation. The initial allocation is primarily for three major Chinese internet companies, with others now awaiting subsequent approvals.

title: NVIDIA Sets Conference Call for Fourth-Quarter Financial Results
summary: NVIDIA announced it will host a conference call on Wednesday, February 25, at 2 p.m. PT (5 p.m. ET) to discuss its financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2026. Prior to the call, written commentary from CFO Colette Kress regarding the results will be posted on investor.nvidia.com. The webcast will be live, and a replay will be available until the first quarter of fiscal year 2027 earnings call.

title: NVIDIA Sets Conference Call for Fourth-Quarter Financial Results
summary: NVIDIA announced it will host a conference call on Wednesday, February 25, at 2 p.m. PT to discuss its financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2026, which ended January 25, 2026. Prior to the call, written commentary from CFO Colette Kress will be posted on investor.nvidia.com after the results are publicly announced. The webcast will be available for replay until the first quarter of fiscal year 2027 earnings call.

title: Sam Altman Pushes Back On Report Claiming OpenAI Unhappy With Jensen Huang-Led Company's AI Chips Alternatives: 'Love' Working With Nvidia
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman strongly denied reports suggesting the company was unhappy with Nvidia's AI chips and seeking alternatives, reaffirming their close partnership. Altman stated OpenAI "loves working with Nvidia" and considers them the "best AI chips in the world," expecting to remain a "gigantic customer." While acknowledging OpenAI's expanding partnerships with other chipmakers to meet growing compute needs, a senior OpenAI executive confirmed Nvidia remains their most important partner and the core of their compute infrastructure.

title: Exclusive: Nvidia's AI chip sale to ByteDance hinges on conditions set by Trump administration
summary: Nvidia's potential sale of H200 AI chips to ByteDance is facing hurdles due to conditions set by the Trump administration, primarily a "Know-Your-Customer" (KYC) requirement aimed at preventing China's military from accessing the chips. While the U.S. has approved the license, Nvidia has not agreed to the proposed KYC terms, arguing they need to be commercially practical. This situation highlights the ongoing U.S.-China tech conflict, with China hawks expressing concern over national security implications.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA is Fulcrum Capital LLC's 5th Largest Position
summary: Fulcrum Capital LLC reduced its stake in NVIDIA (NVDA) by 8.7% in Q3, making it the firm's fifth-largest holding. Despite the trimmed position, NVIDIA reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst estimates with significant revenue growth. However, the company also saw considerable insider selling and faces market sentiment fluctuations due to factors like China sales uncertainty and broader industry selloffs, alongside positive drivers such as Google's AI capital expenditures and an Nvidia-backed AI ecosystem.

title: Nvidia may not release new gaming chip this year due to memory shortage: report (NVDA:NASDAQ)
summary: Due to an ongoing memory supply crunch, Nvidia may not release a new gaming GPU in 2026. The company is reportedly prioritizing its existing memory supply instead of launching new products. This decision comes as the memory shortage affects the tech industry.

title: Chip Stocks Soar as Nvidia CEO Huang Says Demand Is 'Through the Roof'
summary: Semiconductor stocks, led by Nvidia, rallied significantly after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that demand for AI technology is "through the roof" and the industry may be at an "inflection point." This surge follows massive AI spending forecasts from major cloud providers like Amazon, which are investing heavily in AI hardware. While cloud giants shoulder the costs, chipmakers are benefiting from increased orders, sending their stocks higher.

title: Taipei finalizes NT$12.2 billion royalty deal with Nvidia
summary: The Taipei City Government has finalized a NT$12.2 billion (US$380 million) royalty deal with AI chip giant Nvidia Corp for its Taiwan headquarters in Beitou-Shilin Technology Park. The contract signing is expected to occur as early as Wednesday next week and no later than Friday, before the Lunar New Year holiday. Construction is hoped to begin before June, following the issuance of a building permit and design review.

title: Google, Amazon, OpenAI and the race to find alternatives to Nvidia
summary: Major tech companies like Google, Amazon, OpenAI, and Microsoft are actively developing their own AI chips to reduce their dependence on Nvidia, which currently dominates the AI chip market. While Nvidia's market share is not immediately at risk, these efforts aim to provide alternatives and leverage in negotiations, potentially impacting Nvidia's long-term growth. Google, in particular, has seen success with its TPUs, training its Gemini 3 model entirely on them and securing deals with other AI startups.

title: J.Safra Asset Management Corp Acquires 28,565 Shares of NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA
summary: J.Safra Asset Management Corp increased its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 38.2% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 28,565 shares to hold a total of 103,440 shares valued at $19.3 million. This makes NVIDIA the 17th largest holding for J.Safra, representing 1.2% of its portfolio. Various institutional investors have also modified their holdings, and analysts maintain a consensus "Buy" rating for NVIDIA with a target price of $263.98, despite recent insider sales and regulatory uncertainties.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Stake Lifted by Allstate Corp
summary: Allstate Corp significantly increased its stake in NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) by 1,731.6% in the third quarter, making it the 7th largest position in Allstate’s portfolio. Despite sizable recent insider sales, NVIDIA shows strong financials with beaten earnings estimates and a bullish analyst consensus. The stock trades near a $4.50 trillion market cap with a consensus "Buy" rating and an average price target of $263.98.

title: Tower Semiconductor and Nvidia partner on 1.6T silicon photonics for AI data centers
summary: Tower Semiconductor and NVIDIA have partnered to enhance AI infrastructure with 1.6T optical modules using Tower's silicon photonics platform. This collaboration aims to double data rates and address high-speed interconnectivity bottlenecks in AI-driven computing, leveraging optical links for scalable and energy-efficient networking. The announcement led to a surge in TSEM shares, reflecting investor confidence in AI and advanced semiconductor technology.

title: SK’s Chey, Nvidia’s Huang explore deeper AI collaboration over beer and chicken
